max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Introverted Girlfriends of Atlanta &amp; Surrounding Cities" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>This group is for introverted women only!!! Introverts can like people as much as extroverts do. The difference is that we take a quality approach to socializing. We prefer intimate gatherings over large parties and one-on-one conversations over group discussions. We like to go beyond "small talk." Yes, we are all introverts here, and need to be alone to recharge. But we are also human, which means we still need human contact.</p>
<p>Let's help each other break out of our shells and get out of the house. We'll do all sorts of fun activities around the city while sharing some fun and laughs!</p>
<p>FYI: Your profile must include a photo of yourself for transparency and the safety of our members. This is a private group, so the usernames, profile information and photos of our members are hidden from search engines and nonmembers.<br></p>
<p>***Please visit https://www.introvertedgirlfriends.com/coronavirusupdate/ for our temporary procedures regarding the COVID-19 pandemic.***<br></p>

inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">•**February 1, 2022 - As we seem to have survived the most recent Covid variant, I am reminding everyone to please be sure your to update your profile to reflect your Covid vaccine status. At this time, only vaccinated members may participate in group events.**

**Contact Sue the Organizer for more information on paying your dues. Sue - ashleygirl1468@gmail.com**

**We will be opening events to include: limited to 8 or less - indoor, outdoor or patio events. We request that you wear a mask until you are seated. At this time, group events are limited to Covid vaccinated members only. Please bring your vaccination card with you on your first visit.**

Welcome!&nbsp;Thank you for joining Atlanta Socializing Women 60+ to expand your group of friends and attend fun and interesting activities. If you're looking to meet new friends, you've come to the right place. We do suggest you find a Coffee Talk in your area to meet other members near you.

Our success is based on participation including planning and hosting events. Please feel free to message me if you have suggestions or ideas for events in your area. I understand that this has been a tough year and we have worked hard to provide events to get together in small numbers or unique lectures via ZOOM.

Although our Organizers have created many amazing events, they are not able to cover every area of Atlanta. We need our members to be actively involved so our group can thrive. If you’d like to see a movie, or go out to dinner in your area, just let us know. We'll post the event and you'll be able to meet members right in your own neighborhood.

Some important issues you need to know...
All members are requested to include a first name and last name OR first initial of your last name &amp; a profile picture that meets our requirements as stated below. Since it's essential that we be able to contact you when we coordinate events, you must also verify that your Notification Settings are activated.
Because of the many popular events we offer to our members, Atlanta Socializing Women 60+ has been growing during the past year. The attendance policy is posted under the MORE tab on our site. PLEASE only sign up for an event if you are sure you can attend.
We will be looking at requiring email confirmation, and/or requiring a refundable deposit, as well as a point system as ways to cut back on the frustration our Organizers experience with these types of cancellations.

IMPORTANT! We require a picture that displays a HEAD to SHOULDER picture ONLY - not standing at a distance, sideways or with another person. No hats, no sunglasses! Please remove distracting backgrounds as well. Our Organizers use your picture as a tool to identify you at events. PLEASE check your profile picture BEFORE you request membership. If your picture does not meet our requirements, your request will be denied. You must delete the incorrect picture first and then upload the new picture.

So once again…welcome! We look forward to meeting you soon.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">201 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="text-viridian">New Group</h3><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Atlanta ITP - Pick Up Soccer Group</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta ITP - Pick Up Soccer Group" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">**Welcome to the new Atlanta ITP (Sandy Springs &amp; Dunwoody) Pickup Soccer Meetup Group**.

**Group Fees**
We created this group to organize fun and structured pickup soccer games. For pickup games that require us to reserve a field, there will be a $3 fee per person to cover field rental fee.

**Meetup Games**
We plan on organizing 3 - 5 pickup days a week. Games will be 9 Vs 9 (Max 10 Vs 10) and teams will rotate and play each other after 60 minutes. We will have small goals, balls and pinnies at every pickup games.

**Pickup Rules:**

**Pay when you arrive to cover field Rental**
**Cost has increased by $1 ($3 to $4) to better help with the cost of field reservations and new equipment.**
**\*\*$4 Zelle to 678-979-6715, Venmo sent to @Dafire95 or Cash app $dargreen95\*\***




* **If you arrive 10+ minutes late YOU ARE NOT GUARANTEED A GAME.**
    * **Games will not start early but we STRONGLY ENCOURAGE everyone to arrive early to pay and get signed in, as this will make starting easier.**
    * **Games will be 9 vs 9 (max 10 vs 10), we will have three games going on max.**
    * **If you arrive late DO NOT pick up a penny/walk onto the field and start playing. Ask for an admin and they will determine if there is room or not.**
* **Teams will rotate ONLY when an organizer says so.**
    * **Follow the instructions of the organizer and rotate accordingly.**
* **No slide tackling or fighting.**


* **CALL YOUR OWN FOULS**
    * **ONLY the person fouled/the person that fouled them(out of sportsmanship) can call it. Unless one of the persons involved is a minor, no one should call a foul for anyone else.**
    * **If able, when fouled, immediately YELL foul**
    * **If someone is on the ground hurt, the game will be paused, so that person can be assisted.**
    * **RESPECT ALL CALLS, but we encourage everyone to not make calls haphazardly.**





**Follow the instructions of the organizers AT ALL TIMES. If you have a suggestion on how events can be better, pull an organizer to side and talk to them privately. There WILL NOT be arguments while an organizer is trying to instruct teams on the field.**




**When you sign up for this event you agree to all the rules of the group as stated above**
**Violators will be warned and repeat offenders will be banned from the group and future events.**




If you have any questions, please send a message to the organizers.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">288 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta, Georgia - Live and Thrive!" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">**"Don't just survive… Live and Thrive!”**&nbsp;

**I use this slogan to motivate myself but my deeper desire is to help others *Live and Thrive* regardless of what’s happening in their lives.**

**My business, [Live and Thrive](https://www.liveandthrive.com/), was created in 2003 and is centered around being active with others through outdoor recreation. The combination of connecting with others in an outdoor environment has long lasting results. Some online classes or meetings are also offered indoors through Zoom.**

**Whether you love walking, hiking, kayaking, bike riding, stand up paddling, gardening, bike riding, or anything else, we’ll help you discover new outdoor adventure friends through our meetup groups.**

**There is always strength and safety in numbers. As you accumulate more outdoor adventure friends it becomes much easier to achieve your goals.**&nbsp;

**Being active outdoors while being supported and surrounded by so many kind, caring, friendly, respectful, and encouraging people of all ages is the BEST! That's what you'll find in our group.**

**Without that constant support, it can feel like a long, lonely, difficult, uphill battle which most of us can relate to in one way or another.**

**PEOPLE are what I’m passionate about! I love doing things with people, supporting people, and helping people.**

**I’ve been on the receiving end. Many kind people have been there for me throughout my life when I needed help the most.**

**I am “people rich” and have many connections, ideas and resources that I’m eager to share with you!**

**Connecting with people who have different backgrounds, cultures, talents and abilities is an awesome thing.**

**Creating and organizing events, meetings, adventure trips, classes, outings and get togethers that bring my members together, online or in person, is what I love to do and have been doing for 20 years!**

**I extend a warm welcome to you and thank you for joining us!**</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">132 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Atlanta Friendships</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta Friendships" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">**HOW EVENTS WORK**
This group posts a number of events for people to meet each other, sometimes multiple events on the same day. The Organizers will NOT be in attendance at each event. To confirm other RSVPs that are attending the event and to coordinate meetup time/location, **please COMMENT on the event page**. Comments are the best way to see who else is going, make a plan and build familiarity with others before you go! Have fun!

**ABOUT THE GROUP**
The purpose of this group is to meet other people around town &amp; fill our void of loneliness! COVID destroyed many things, one of them being in-person social events where we would normally meet new people &amp; make new connections. On top of that, making friends as adults can be hard and....awkward. I get it. But, one of the best ways to make friendships and feel a sense of connection is to see the same people routinely. How did you make friends in high school? You either sat next to the same person in class every day or you both participated in the same activities (clubs, sports, etc.). So, this group is here to create that space where you can build familiarity with people and simply connect. The only way this won't work is if you never come!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">476 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; Many of our members are in their 50s, 60s, 70s and beyond. It's never too late for happy, healthy lesbian love and deeply fulfilling sex! Being active (both physically and emotionally) are an important part of a healthy lifestyle and we want to enable others to partake in fun social activities as a larger group, in order to expand their circle of friends.&nbsp; We do have guidelines that we ask you be aware of.&nbsp; Please stay active by visiting our meetup page (<a href="https://www.meetup.com/AtlantaCircleOfFriends">https://www.meetup.com/AtlantaCircleOfFriends</a>) at least once every 3 months (this does not necessarily mean that you have to attend an event once every 3 months).&nbsp; If you RSVP to an event with a waitlist and you do not plan to attend, we ask that you cancel your RSVP at least 24 hours in advance or notify the organizer in an emergency or unplanned incident the day of.&nbsp; If you fail to attend and do not notify the organizer, you will be considered a "No Show" and will be removed from the group.&nbsp; If you are on the waitlist and meetup automatically moves you to attending on the same day and you do not attend, you will not receive a "No Show".&nbsp;We have a Zero Tolerance policy for undesirable behavior and we ask that everyone act with maturity and respect toward each other.</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">6792 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta lions fc" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">ATLANTA LIONS FC is one of the most oldest team in the city. We are representing Cameroonian community and everyone interested of playing soccer is accepted. We host our training and game in Hammond Park 750 Hammond drive,Sandy Springs on Sundays evenings 5:30 pm. We do recreations, professional trainings, friendly games, organize and participate tournaments. We've President with his staff and coaches also. Come have fun with us and discover our soccer culture without discrimination of races and religions. Invite your friends of friends to come have fun.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">34 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Friends of Alliance Française d'Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Friends of Alliance Française d'Atlanta</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Friends of Alliance Française d'Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><img src="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/c/1/e/a/600_305809642.jpeg"></p>
<p><span>Friends of Alliance Française d'Atlanta Meetup is for those who love anything French! We do conversation groups, wine tastings, fashion shows, film nights, lectures, art and photo exhibits, concerts... un peu de tous (a little of everything). We also have ¨</span><b><i>French in the City</i></b><span>¨ series where we meet up in different places throughout Metro-Atlanta for real-life conversation practice, all while enjoying what the city has to offer :-)</span></p>
<p><span><a href="http://afatl.com/">Alliance Française d'Atlanta </a>school and cultural center plays host to many of these events, as well as special annual events such as Bastille Day, European Wine Festival,&nbsp;Champagne et Chocolat, European Day of Languages, Atlanta Francophonie Festival, Dîner en Français for AF members, and travel abroad to French speaking countries.</span></p>
<p><span>This Meetup also enjoys&nbsp;</span>events by other cultural organizations such as the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.theatredureve.com/">Théâtre du Rêve</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.atlantatoulouse.org/">Atlanta Toulouse Sister Cities Committee</a>,&nbsp;French Atlanta Chamber of Commerce (<a href="http://www.facc-atlanta.com/">FACC</a>),&nbsp;<span><a href="http://www.france-atlanta.org/">France-Atlanta,</a></span> <a href="http://www.high.org/">High Museum of Art</a>, <a href="http://www.scadfash.org/">SCAD Fash</a>, <a href="http://www.besharatgallery.com/">Besharat Gallery</a>, <span><a href="http://www.atlanta-accueil.org/">Atlanta Accueill</a>,</span> <a href="http://www.goethe.de/ins/us/atl/enindex.htm">Goethe Zentrum</a>, &nbsp;local universities, Atlanta restaurants and businesses, and more.</p>
<p><span>Friends of Alliance Française d'Atlanta welcomes everyone with a love for the French language and Francophone culture.</span> So whether you speak French fluently, just a little, or not at all, come join us! It's all about having fun and meeting great people!</p>
<p>**Upgrade your experiences for as low as $5/ month by becoming a member of the Alliance Française community!</p>
<p>Members enjoy:</p>
<p>–&nbsp;Discounts on all Alliance Française Classes&nbsp;</p>
<p><span>– FREE access or d</span><span>iscounts to Alliance Française Cultural Events</span><br></p>
<p>– Discounts at participating Atlanta French restaurants/businesses&nbsp;<br></p>
<p><span>– Unlimited access to the online library Culturethèque</span><br></p>
<p>– Borrowing privileges from our libraries at our Midtown and Roswell locations</p>To become an Alliance Française member click here-&nbsp;
<a href="https://afatl.com/join-us/membership/">https://afatl.com/join-us/membership/</a>
<p><span><br></span></p>
<p><span>À bientôt ! (See you soon!)</span><br></p>
<p>Visit us on:</p>

<p><span> <br></span></p>
<p><span>So what is the Alliance Française anyway?</span> <br></p>
<p>The&nbsp;<b>Alliance Française</b>&nbsp;&nbsp;is an international organization headquartered in Paris, that aims to promote French language and culture around the globe.&nbsp;Created in Paris in 1883, its primary focus is teaching French as an additional language while promoting cultural awareness and events pertaining to France as well as Francophone countries.&nbsp;In 2014, the&nbsp;<i>Alliance</i>&nbsp;has 850 centers in over 130 countries, on five continents. <br></p>
<p><img src="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/d/9/8/2/600_457555682.jpeg"></p>
<p><span>A member supported non-profit organization,&nbsp;</span><a href="http://afatl.com/">Alliance Française d’Atlanta&nbsp;</a><span>is the French-American cultural center serving the Atlanta community as the premier provider of French language and culture since 1912.</span></p>
<p><span>Since 1963 the language school has been offering a variety of courses for individuals as well as businesses, including the CDC, CARE, the Carter Center and Delta Air Lines.</span> <br></p>
<p><span>For information on taking French courses or becoming an Alliance Française member, visit&nbsp;</span><span>AFATL-&nbsp;</span><span><a href="https://afatl.com/" class="linkified">https://afatl.com/</a></span></p>
<br>

Being a “Nature Junkie” is a way of life. Join us outdoors to channel self-awareness, community diversity, peace, and confidence! Enjoy camaraderie amongst other outdoor lovers while creating memorable fun moments during a time where disconnections are at an all-time high! We are based out of Georgia and occasionally meet in surrounding states. Group events range from hiking, social gatherings, educational workshops and more!
All ARE WELCOME! PETS ARE WELCOME!
Keep a look out for events tailored to your interest and join in on the adventures!!
Y.O.L.O at a time so make it awesome!!
Until the next adventure Peace OUT-side!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">622 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="The &quot;New&quot; Black Women over 50 Social" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Welcome to the "New Black Women over 50 Social..

We actually started July 15, 2019 and wanted a refresh for 2022!

We are phenomenally all shades of beautiful.

Yes, when we come together the awesomeness and magic happens ..
This is where sisterhood reigns supreme. It's "our" time to bridge the gaps and defy the odds. Together, let's create some "new" memories..

It's time to take some time for "you", to relax, relate and release. Let's meet, reconnect.. and get to know each other.... Let's run with the girls and have some fun.

We will come together to enjoy many activities like: dinner, happy hour, brunch, spa days, pajama parties, cooking class, game nights, day parties, spades, bbq's, roller skating, concerts, bowling, movies, comedy shows, spoken word, sporting events, bon fires, horseback riding, hiking, kayaking, river tubing, rock climbing, pool parties, skydiving, paintball, museums visits, cultural and history events..

Oh did I say... We will have day and overnight trips, weekend getaways, beach, cabin, mountain, amusement park, casino, wine and brew tasting, camping trips and so much more. Our possibilities are endless..
Join for the Sisterhood and stay for so much more!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">86 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Forties, Fine, &amp; Free Women of Color" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Welcome to Forty, Fine, and Free! This is a group for women of color who are in their forties (or very close to it) who would like to expand their tribe. Women here are career-minded, grown and sexy, and looking to have fun. Nothing is holding us back from living our best lives.

Whether we are being superfly at a lounge, trying out new restaurants around the city, cracking up on a group facetime, or just chilling at one of our houses watching TV, this group will be making memories that will be the foundation for lifelong friendships.

If this sounds like you, this is the right group for you! We can't wait to meet you!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">127 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Gold Line Activities Group" data-testid="next-image" src="https://secure-content.meetupstatic.com/images/classic-events/501946142/178x178.jpg?w=178?w=384" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" srcset="https://secure-content.meetupstatic.com/images/classic-events/501946142/178x178.jpg?w=178?w=256 1x, https://secure-content.meetupstatic.com/images/classic-events/501946142/178x178.jpg?w=178?w=384 2x" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Gold Line Activities Group</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Gold Line Activities Group" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Welcome!
Me and my wife started this group around Pittsburgh, Pa and had success/fun!
Meeting new people, meeting their dogs, playing games, getting a little tipsy, and just enjoying life.

We've recently moved to Atlanta and wanted to start the same thing here. You don't need to be a couple to join, or have a dog, but you should at least enjoy playing games (and enjoying the occasional beverage wouldn't hurt as I imagine a few of our events will take place at pubs and what-not).

This group is called the Gold Line Activities Group because we live off the Marta gold line (north) and most of our activities will try to be Marta line friendly with the idea that no one has to be responsible for driving anywhere (obviously you can still drive or take an Uber/Lyft, but we'll personally try to avoid it - or we'll take responsibility for driving people if it's an event around where we are. Ex. Frisbee Golf course nearby)

Activities you should expect include:
\- Trivia nights at pubs
\- Frisbee Golf
\- Events at the Aquarium \(pref 21\+\)
\- Meetups at parks \(for games or hanging out with the dogs\)
\- Game days at our apartment's clubhouse \(Cards\, Board Games\, Drinking Games\, Etc\)
\- Game nights wherever we think would be fun \(Cards\, Board Games\, Drinking Games\, Etc\)
\- Drinks by the pool
\- River tubing \(this one isn't thought out yet as I don't think there's a place to do this on the gold line\, but we did it a bunch around Pitt and loved it\)
\- Restaurant/Bar meetups
\- Random adventures \(although we're hosting\, we're open to adventures from the group\)
\- Mostly physical things\, but might do the random virtual game night \(like Jackbox\)

Who should join/not join?
\- We don't age discriminate\, but suggested age range would be 21\-45 since there will most likely include alcohol and don't want anyone being turned away at the door for their age
\- We don't care if you have kids\, but unless they are over 21\, please do not bring them to activities without asking\.
\- We don't care if you are super into your religion\, just please refrain from being "that person" at events\.
\- This is meant to be a place to make friendships\. If things happen organically that's fine\, but please respect the idea that this is not meant to be a dating/swingers group\.
\- We don't care if you don't have a pet\, but if you hate dogs\, this might not be your group as we'll probably bring our little pup to some of the park events and what\-not\.
\- If you don't know\, ask\! We're pretty chill and no drama people\.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">40 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; However, all women are welcome!&nbsp;The Dames are a group of women who are looking for a chance to get out and see the beauty that this world has to offer. We hike slowly, enjoying every second, because we know that it is not the destination that is important, but the journey.&nbsp;And when we reach the top of every mountain, you will find us doing the "Dance of the Real Woman" and celebrating the life that is in us all!</p><p>Trail Dames Membership Information:</p><p>All women are invited to join the Dames for a few hikes before becoming an official member, so come try us out!</p><p>Membership includes:</p><p>-The quarterly newsletter. Keep up to date on all things Dame and learn tips of hiking, backpacking and living the life of a Dame!</p><p>- A trail Dames patch to show your spirit</p><p>-Special discounts and coupons from outdoor companies for Trail Dames only</p><p>-Admittance to all Trail Dames hikes</p><p>-Special discount on Trail Dames special events</p><p>Membership details and application can be found at our website:</p><p>https://traildames.com/membershipinfo.html</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">2704 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Christian Singles Connect</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Christian Singles Connect" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Sign up at our website: csc365.org
Support Us. Buy Merch: https://my-store-bfbfe5.creator-spring.com/

Tired of the being alone? Sick of books, conferences, and groups that just talk about finding your ideal mate, or worse, giving you meaningless and repetitive information? Are you tired of looking for the one that God has for you?

Christian Singles Connect was created to actually **solve** those problems. We take the time to actually look deep into the issues that plague singleness and pull out solutions. Through networking, debating, and events, we hope to end your days of loneliness.
Invite your friends and let's have some fun!

Men and women are welcome, and you don't have to be Christian to join.

Note: We are a candid group and encourage everyone to speak, ask questions, and give their personal experiences. We try to keep things realistic, open, and honest. This is a safe place.&nbsp;

We have members from ages 25 to 55 which live in multiple countries and states. We are officially located in Atlanta, GA, USA.

CSC Recommendations and Conduct. \*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

The best way to utilize CSC is to befriend everyone, especially those of the opposite gender. Those interested in you will naturally gravitate toward you. We try to have lots of events there is no need to rush.

For men, this gives you time to “predate” women at no cost. You don’t have to worry about dates because you’re getting to know the person while you hang out at CSC.

For women, this allows you time to relax and “watch” the men to see who is a good fit.

CSC works hard to provide events almost every weekend, especially during the warm months. Members come out often. If there is an event that you’d like to do, simply let the organizers know.

CSC's desire is for your marriage. The goal of CSC Events is twofold.

1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To provide a “High School” environment where you can talk to those in the group to get to know them first, before you become romantic.
2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To be a “wing-person” so that you will be comfortable leaving home. (CSC recognizes that women generally outnumber the men, so we try to find places where there may be more single men available.)

If you jump the gun and try to force a relationship, that person may become uncomfortable and not come back to the group. We’re not in the “grocery store” or at the “gas station.” There’s no need to rush. Also just because you liked someone at an event, there’s no need to jump into their DMs if they haven’t shown interest. The best way to know is to come back and be a regular at the events. Eventually your person will come.
If anyone feels uncomfortable, please tell one of the organizers. We will work with the offending person and explain the “vibe” of CSC. If the person refuses to listen, we will ask them not to come back to any events and will remove their membership.

CSC has a PG-13 energy. You may talk about almost anything that would be in a PG-13 movie. However, do not use excessive profanity or “mature” words/phrases. We understand that to express yourself, especially when discussing dating, you may want to talk about certain subjects. But “how” you talk about those subjects matters. Please don’t try to demean or dominate anyone. In doing so, you are proving that you need to work on yourself and deal with your own problems before dating.

Enjoy. Relax. Chill. Be Friendly. Remember God is watching.

J.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">2150 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; The age range is 30 and up. Let’s make new friends and new memories! We even have some trips planned. It took me several years to get the nerve to go to my first meet-up and I sooooo regret that. Everyone that is there is in the same boat as you and everyone is super nice. I promise!</p>
<p>Please RSVP if you are coming to an event. Some of the venues only allow certain amounts for reservations. If you show up without RSVPing, there might not be enough seats (depending on the venue). If you no show without notice, you will be removed from the group. I understand things happen and I'm ok with same day cancellations (although minimizing them would be great). But the point of this is to make friends. And lets be honest, you would not tell a friend you are coming and then just not show up. inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">S.I.S.— The Society of Introverted Sisters (Atlanta)</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="S.I.S.— The Society of Introverted Sisters (Atlanta)" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>The Society of Introverted Sisters (S.I.S.) is a safe space created for introverted women to be their true, honest, and best selves while being surrounded by other like-minded introverted women—s.i.s.ters. S.I.S. strives to empower, educate, and support its introverted sisters from all over the world and of diverse backgrounds. In such a community, you—a s.i.s.ter—will not only receive endless support and encouragement in a judgment-free zone, but you will have an opportunity to build relationships with relatable women, possibly forming friendships that’ll last a lifetime.</p> 
<p>PLEASE NOTE: Each meetup will consist of no more than 10 attendees. This setup caters best to the introvert personality as introverts are most comfortable in smaller groups and settings.</p> 
<p>REQUIREMENTS TO JOIN:</p> 
<p>1. Must be an introvert (no extroverts and no ambiverts).</p> 
<p>2. Must be a woman and 21+ in age.</p> 
<p>3. Must have a profile photo of yourself uploaded for security reasons.</p> 
<p>4. Must be local or travel often to the area, which should be reflected on your profile.</p> 
<p>*Each member will have a 60-day free trial period.</p> 
<p>**THERE IS A 200 MEMBER LIMIT FOR THIS GROUP.**</p> 
<p>For S.I.S. related inquiries, please contact us at thesocietyofintrovertedsisters@gmail.com.</p> 
<p>DISCLAIMER: In recognition and much appreciation, S.I.S. is greatly inspired by the group Introverted Girlfriends where the Co-Founders formerly served as executive leaders. However, S.I.S. is a separate entity and is not directly affiliated with or endorsed by Introverted Girlfriends or any other organization or business.</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">43 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Wilderness Network of Georgia" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p> <br></p>
<p>WNG is a non-competitive volunteer driven gay men’s outdoor recreational group. Want to know more?&nbsp; Trying to pay your dues? Click on read more: <br></p>
<p><span>Trying to pay your dues but never got an email?&nbsp; We switched to the Meetup membership platform about a year ago, and we have noticed problems with receiving renewal notices.&nbsp; If you are unable to sign on to trips and think your dues are due go to:&nbsp; <a href="https://www.meetup.com/wildnetga/pay_dues" class="linkified">https://www.meetup.com/wildnetga/pay_dues</a> <br></span></p>
<p><span>Not getting messages from us?&nbsp; https://www.meetup.com/account/comm/<br></span></p>
<p><span>MORE ABOUT US: <br></span></p>
<p><span>Membership is open to gay and bisexual men age 18 and older.</span></p>
<p> All skill levels are welcome. We offer day and overnight trips throughout the southeast and occasional national and international offerings. Local trips in metro Atlanta are routinely offered. Sample trips include day hikes, rock climbing, hiking, biking, canoeing, parachuting, hot air balloon rides, caving, and museum visits. Choose from trips posted on our calendar or better, volunteer to lead a trip of your choosing. Annual membership dues are $20. WNG is a great way to meet new guys, enjoy the outdoors and make lasting friendships. Join us! </p>
<p>Scroll down to see what trips we have coming up.</p>
<p><span>Joining our group is a two step process. One step is to send us a request to join the group by clicking on the ‘Join Us’ button right there under this description.&nbsp; Be sure to answer the screening questions asked and to agree to the liability waiver.&nbsp;&nbsp; We will then send you a link for payment.&nbsp; After receiving your dues we will then approve you. </span></p>
<p>Unfortunately MeetUp.com does not manage the payment process and therefore MeetUp.com <strong>will not</strong> automatically approve your request to join once you've made the PayPal payment. The volunteer leadership team here at WNG has to handle this process manually.&nbsp;&nbsp;<i>This process is managed by volunteers, so while we try to process most applications within 72 hours, sometimes it may take up to a week.&nbsp; </i> <br></p>
<p><span>We do not offer trial memberships, however we do have a 90 day refund offer for first-time members. <br></span></p>
<p><span>For more about us, please</span> <a href="http://www.meetup.com/wildnetga/about/">CLICK HERE</a></p>
<p>For FAQ please <a href="http://www.meetup.com/wildnetga/pages/WNG_FAQs/">CLICK HERE</a></p>
<p>Still not sure about joining and want to ask a question? Send us a message: <a href="http://www.meetup.com/wildnetga/suggestion/">CLICK HERE</a></p>
<p><span>When joining WNG it is preferable for you to include both your first and last names with your profile, but we acknowledge the fact that some members wish to keep their privacy. For that reason we are requiring you to include, at a minimum, your real first name and the first initial of your last name in your profile name.</span></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">188 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. ***Welcome to Pain Train Promotions, LLC (hereafter, PTP, LLC)!***
***We would be excited to have you join our group &amp; look forward to seeing you at one of our local events very soon! We have a great group of people, of all ages (must be 21 years old or older for our Hold 'Em Events) &amp; playing skills, attending our events! I assure you that you will fit right in!***
***\

 PTP, LLC is in the "fun-raising" business! We have a blast playing Texas Hold 'Em, and soon to be adding Corn Hole, Golf Tourneys, &amp; Fantasy Sports while raising money for many, many worthy causes. We have donated funds to American Legion Posts, The Susan G. Komen Foundation, Cure - Childhood Cancer Foundation, American Heart Association, The Children's Tumor Foundation, &amp; SHARE Military Initiative at Shepard Center just to name a few! Not all of these organizations necessarily sanction our events. We simply make donations to them based on our players having benefited from the organization, or having identified them as a worthy cause who will use our donations wisely.***
***\

 Our events are professionally ran &amp; we do not tolerate any undesirable behavior. You can come out, be comfortable, make new friends; all in a safe &amp; fun environment at any of our events or venues!***
***The top finishers in all of our events are awarded prizes! \

 Keep up with our events &amp; pick an upcoming one to come check us out! You will be glad you did!***
**CHECK US OUT**!
**Be sure to enter your FIRST &amp; LAST name when applying for membership, as this is a requirement for our group. Thanks in advance!** \</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">2686 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. The purpose is to bring together men and women who want to escape the daily humdrum and replace it with some fun, excitement and sometimes new and challenging experiences that are exhilarating, leaving you with lifetime memories. Our adventures will also help build your confidence, help you get or stay fit and healthy, all with a group of friendly and supportive people. The African American Adventurers is for you if you are black and ready to live life to it's fullest! **We hope you attend as many CRAPPY events as possible with some of the CRAPPIEST Event Organizers you'll ever meet! And who knows, you might learn some CRAP while forming relationships that will last a lifetime!**
**ANNND!!! We can officially say, we have had a CRAPPY love affair!!! We’ve actually had a few relationships start on CRAP and so far we have ONE MARRIAGE and ONE BABY (yes, we take credit for that as well) that all started from a hike!!!**</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">2122 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; Then&nbsp;you've come to the right place!&nbsp;&nbsp;We are&nbsp;a fun, lively group. There is always plenty of laughter and great conversation&nbsp;wherever we go. &nbsp;We have lots of&nbsp;activities on our calendar - lunching at wonderful restaurants in and around our area, Milton, Midtown Atlanta, Buckhead and Roswell -&nbsp;<span>tours of historic sites and mansions, Oakland Cemetery, Atlanta Botanical Gardens, The High, The Biltmore House, The Tate House, Bulloch Hall, The Monastery in Conyers, Wine Tours, and excursions to Charleston and Savannah are in our plans for 2016. &nbsp;(Some of our events are open to spouses, significant others and family members.) &nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span>Check out our calendar and join us, our members are from Woodstock, Acworth, Marietta, Kennesaw, Alpharetta, Jasper, Ellijay and Canton. We are an intermediate to advanced hiking group. Many of our hikes are 10+ miles at a moderate to brisk pace with solid elevation gains. While we primarily focus on the North Georgia Mountains (AT, BMT, Coosa, Amicalola Falls, Blood Mtn., Brasstown Bald, etc.), we also take&nbsp;<span>our adventures to the beautiful trails in TN, SC, NC &amp; beyond.&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span>If this sounds like your idea of fun, give us a shot! If you have any questions, please reach out to the organizers. We're here to provide any additional info you might need.&nbsp;</span> <br></p>

display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="OPALs - Older People with Active Lifestyles" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>We are a group of active men and women age 50 and older who are young at heart, enjoying an active healthy lifestyle, are fit (or want to be fit), friendly and having fun participating in recreational, athletic and social events with peers, including some community service projects.</p>
<p>We actively promote activities that defy the myths about getting older.&nbsp; We are the 'forever young' generation! Visit our <a href="http://www.opalssite.org">OPALs</a> website and sign up to receive our online newsletter.&nbsp; You can learn more about our founder <a href="http://www.CarolynHartfield.com">Carolyn here</a>.&nbsp; Some of the activities that we participate in include:</p>
<blockquote>
<ul>
<li>Hiking</li>
<li>Zip Lining</li>
<li>Horseback Riding</li>
<li>Bicycling</li>
<li>Basketball</li>
<li>Sailing</li>
<li>Caving</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
<p>As the Ambassador for the state of Georgia for the annual World Senior Games held in October, in St.&nbsp; George, Utah, I am looking for more athletes to participate.</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">756 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Westside Spaders" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Westside Spaders</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Smyrna, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Westside Spaders" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>We are NOT your ordinary card group .We do community outreach, health drives, business to business networking, positive teen interaction, group dinners, financial literacy/education, back to school events and all things that involve assisting individuals to evolve. Most of all Westside Spaders is a family-oriented group that connects our member with playing this awesome game we all love called "Spades" We are a diverse group. There is no age gender, race, or qualifications to join and we also have a beginners table to get your skill set up. The only requirement is" Positive Energy" and "Respect Towards Others. If you can handle that, we would love to have you as our newest member. Most games include: Bid Whist, Spades ,Uno, Chess, Dominoes and recreational events including but not limited to Kickball, Basketball, Movie Nights and all things fun; but positive activities. Please click the link and join. We are looking for those individuals who are ready to counterbalance the current negative climate of the present, make a difference, and most of all have FUN!!!</p><p><br></p><p>Thanks in advance for your support!</p><p>Weeeeesssssiiiiiide. One Love.</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>Westside Spaders Rules</p><ol><li>Spades Hierarchy: Big Joker (Color) , Little Joker (All Black), Ace of Spades …</li><li>Straight Cut, Straight Deal, Deal Clockwise, &amp; Cut right</li><li>Handling Misdeals: All players should throw their hand in. Next player (Clockwise) deals.</li><li>Tough Luck: No Spades. No Face Cards. Play your hand. Choosing not to play your hand will result in an automatic loss for your team for the entire game</li><li>Winner’s Decisions: Winners have the right to choose seats, Start the dealing process at the beginning of a new game, &amp; Change out deck at the beginning of a new game.</li><li>First Hand / Session is open</li><li>Place books in the order you won them. Sequentially.</li><li>Table Bids 10 &amp; Under: Books are made. Total the points. All Players throw hands in. Next Person (Clockwise) Deal.</li><li>Locked Bids:</li><li>Lead Spades at anytime</li><li>2 Consecutive Sets = Automatic Loss</li><li>Renege Investigation - Call the Player with the suit - All books can be flipped over - 3 books are given if the renege is legit, 3 books are taken if the renege call is invalid</li><li>No Bags</li><li>No Blinds - You came in seeing! Let’s keep it that way :)</li><li>No Nils</li><li>Talking across the board will result in a minus 3 books</li><li>The 10 Bid - 100 points are put up for collateral. Book Made = 200 points, Books Not Made -100 points</li><li>First team to 350 points wins</li><li>Fighting, Frequent Cheating, Poor Sportsmanship, Disrespect Beyond the normal trash talking will not be tolerated. Any of the actions above will be grounds for disqualification.</li></ol><p><br></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">331 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; If you're 50 + and need some friends to hang out with, in a space that is dedicated to you, this is the group for you. You will find a never-ending list of fun things to do. Rather you prefer virtual or face-to-face you will have fun.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">49 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Off The Grid Adventures" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><strong>Off the Grid Adventures </strong><span>is&nbsp;a&nbsp;welcoming, friendly group of female outdoor enthusiasts of all experience levels from all over the Southeast.&nbsp;</span><br></p>
<p><strong>Membership is free! </strong></p>
<p><strong>Off The Grid Adventures </strong>&nbsp;post a variety of day hikes and backpack trips&nbsp;ranging from&nbsp;beginner to advanced, as well as camping, kayaking, workshops, and more&nbsp;across Georgia and neighboring states. We also&nbsp;share&nbsp;Ranger led hikes in State&nbsp;Parks, festivals, and other fun events! At times we will host family (males and children allowed) events. Most events have a&nbsp;volunteer host, but some are host free meaning the group just meets up for the activity.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>&nbsp; <br>What&nbsp;our members are saying:</strong> <br></p>
<p><em>"Great group of women from all backgrounds. I learned so much this weekend"</em></p>
<p><em>"This is a great group! They offer a wide variety of activities for all experience and ability levels. I've been on a few and have met some great ladies. We all need to get Off the Grid sometimes and this is the group for it!!"<br></em></p>
<p><em>"Very friendly group and knowledgeable hikers"</em></p>
<p><em>"Great planning, the hike was very enjoyable and accommodated different paces"</em></p>

<p><em>"Great women - lots of fun to hang out with!"</em></p>
<p><em>"Very nice women. Well organized."</em></p>
<p><em>"Awesome group of ladies who love the outdoors!!"</em></p>

This group is for exploring new places around the city by meeting new friends and making great connections. display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Beyond Breath - An Introduction to Sky Breath Meditation" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Discover the power of your breath to relieve stress, ease anxiety and calm your mind in a free LIVE and interactive session.

In the online ‘Beyond Breath’ intro session you will learn how to use your breath to instantly get rid of stress and manage your emotions - right from your own home.
In this 75 min workshop you will get the chance to pause, take a breath and clear your mind with the help of a calming breathing technique and a guided meditation.
How breath helps reduce stress and anxiety

Did you know that breathing techniques can quickly help you to release stress and lower your anxiety?
Breathing techniques improve circulation and blood flow to the brain, and activate our parasympathetic nervous system, which means that our brain gets the message to relax. For example, doing the alternate breathing activates the left and right hemispheres of the brain. When balance is created between the two hemispheres, we feel less stressed and anxious, and more relaxed.
In this free workshop you will already learn a technique that you can practice daily to feel calm, centered and stress-free!
Learn breathing exercises that boost health and immunity

Science is recognizing that proper breathing is essential for health. Targeted breathing exercises can actually boost our immunity and improve our overall health. Learning how to breathe is one factor that reduces our susceptibility to getting sick.
We breathe over 10,000 liters of air per day, and the more expanded our lung capacity is, the more nutrients our body can absorb. It’s important to learn how to do breathing techniques under the proper guidance of a certified facilitator, so that we practice them in the right way to get the full benefit.
Why should I attend the Beyond Breath workshop?

During this free live workshop, you will learn:
✔ About the tendencies of our mind and how to overcome negative patterns using certain breathing techniques
✔ A calming breathing technique to quiet and relax the mind, preparing it for deep meditation
✔ A real experience of meditation to effortlessly cut the vicious cycle of thoughts, leaving your mind focused, clear &amp; stress-free
✔ The power of connecting with positive, like-minded people to feel uplifted and supported
✔ About the benefits of SKY Breath Meditation, a powerful technique that will remove deep-rooted blocks, quiet the mind and lead you into effortless meditation.
97+ studies conducted on four continents have demonstrated a comprehensive range of benefits of practicing SKY Breath Meditation.

SKY Breath Meditation is reported to be a fundamental tool for maintaining and improving mental health by the Harvard Medical School and International Journal of Yoga. This science-backed breath-meditation technique quickly calms anxiety, releases stress, and boosts immunity.
Independent research has shown that SKY Breath Meditation
Reduces cortisol - the stress hormone
Supports the immune system
Increases optimism
Relieves anxiety and depression
Increases antioxidant production
Enhances brain function (increased mental focus, calmness and recovery from stressful stimuli)
Enhances well-being and peace of mind
In this live session, you will be guided step-by-step by your certified Breath &amp; Meditation Trainer.

This is not a recorded webinar; it’s an interactive experience where you can ask questions and get clarity on what breathing and meditation is all about. We’re here to guide you on this new breathing journey!
We only have limited spots available, as we want to keep these sessions small enough to properly connect with and guide everyone.
Learn more about SKY Breath Meditation in our online workshop 'Beyond Breath'.
Sign up for free!
How to contact an organizer for any questions?
Please contact at

**Welcome to the Art N Soul Escapes**. For those that have a little bit of soul, and like to stir it up a bit...you've come to the best social experience around. Ok...we may be a little bias, but we'll leave that up to you to decide for yourself. We've been around since 2010, with the original group being in D.C; In 2012, the Atlanta group was established.&nbsp;
**We believe in&nbsp;quality over quantity**....we like to keep our group very close-knit. We try to create a platform for connecting&nbsp;​​mature and progressive like-minded men and women in the Atlanta Area. There are no "cliques" in this group...and&nbsp;we don't tolerate DRAMA. This is a place where like-minded professionals can meet new friends, mix, mingle and network.
**​Invest.In.Your.Soul**\-\- That's our new motto\. &nbsp;Although we still very much believe in work hard\, play hard\, our new focus is all about taking care of ourselves\.\.\.\.\.We only get one life\, so make sure you are investing in YOU\.&nbsp;​Sometimes we get so busy taking care of everyone else\, we put ourselves on the&nbsp;back burner\. You no longer have to\. &nbsp;​There's a diverse group of activities&nbsp;​and travel opportunities ​in this group for everyone\. From Happy Hours to White Water Rafting\.\.\.to Sporting Events\.\.\.\.even traveling across the country\. You'll never be bored with us\! And spending time doing things that make you happy is very important\.&nbsp;
**The Meaning behind Art N Soul (Escapes)**....&nbsp;I chose the name because everything that we do in life is a work of art...we as human beings, especially in the urban community are very artistic. Each event that we create, is an expression of us. &nbsp;The definition of art is the various branches of creative activity. So everything we do--we put a little spin on it. And ultimately, we do things from the soul. Soul is defined as the essence of a person. So, this group embodies all of that. In addition, we use travel to "escape" (or take much needed breaks) every day life and get that quality "me" time.
**The Difference Between the Facebook &amp; Meetup Groups**....The Experience. **You are a VIP**. You will receive advance access to all trips, which is a bonus in itself due to limited space. You will also have access to exclusive trips that are only available to our Meetup members. For those that like to get to know the people you travel with, this is definitely an added bonus; several events throughout the year make it easy to get to know one another. &nbsp;Lastly, meetup members get exclusive discounts and promo codes.&nbsp;
**For Those That Like To Travel:** &nbsp;Majority of our travel packages comes with RT Airfare (unless otherwise specified). Our goal is to make it affordable for people to travel and not break the bank. For those that prefer to do land-only packages, we can do that as well, you would just have to inquire prior to booking. As a bonus for our members, there are certain trips that are only open to our Meetup Members, and can only be found on our Meetup calendar. &nbsp;For trips that are open to the general public, they can be found on our website:
[www.artnsoulescapes.com](http://www.artnsoulescapes.com)
**Cost:** &nbsp;Current cost of our annual membership is $12/year&nbsp;&nbsp;(DURING COVID-19, Membership dues will be reduced to $6/year).&nbsp;</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">77 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. My name is Khadeshia. I am here to share various aspects of mind, body, soul and spirit wellness through complete yoga practices: which include mindful movement, meditation, breathing, journaling, poetry/creative expression and nature outings. *If you would like to learn a little more about me along with my Holistic Wellness Business, [click here](https://heartbloomwellness.com/our-founder). You may [click here](https://khadeshiabeam.com/) to explore my artistic work.* 

I would love to meet people who live and or desire to live healthy, balanced and fulfilling lives! 

If you would like to devote more time to taking care of yourself, tap into your creative nature and or have a desire to heal then this could be a place where you come to get tools to do just that! 

We will have monthly online and or onsite yoga/meditation classes, mindful poetry book reads, journal activities, diy workshops and nature walks.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">65 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; Aren't you tired of sitting in the office all day,&nbsp; watching tv all night, playing on the Internet or playing computer games ??&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Let's get outdoors !</p>
<p><span>We're an established&nbsp;MeetUp club,&nbsp; full of experienced activity leaders who enjoy the outdoors and want to share what they know with you.&nbsp;&nbsp; Whether it be hiking, backpacking, camping, kayaking, canoeing, caving, skydiving, hang gliding, outdoor photography, ....etc..etc.... if it's an adventure, we want to do it ! We also explore cultural festivals, food festivals, street markets,&nbsp; and programs put on at the local state &amp; national parks.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span> <br></p>
<p>Give Georgia&nbsp;Adventures Group&nbsp;a try !</p>
<p>Are you&nbsp;&nbsp;looking for a place to share your experience in an outdoor field ?&nbsp; We welcome anyone who wants to lead an event for our group !&nbsp; We all want to try new adventures ! Bring it on !</p>
<p>" Papa Smurf "</p>
<p>Bill Witherspoon,&nbsp;Organizer</p>
