**WELCOME to the Southeastern Photographic Society Meetup page.**

**[Click here to join or renew your SPS membership.](https://form.jotform.com/spsatlanta/club-membership-registration-form)**&nbsp; *Note:&nbsp; Signing up on the SPS Meetup page does not make you an SPS member.&nbsp; SPS members pay dues to engage in many activities that are unavailable to guests who simply sign up on the SPS MeetUp page.*

**[Click here to go to the SPS website](www.spsatlanta.org)** where you will find everything you need to know about us.

The Southeastern Photographic Society (SPS) is a registered non-profit Atlanta-based community of photographers established in 1976 to help members learn the skills for creating great images and sharing them with others.

We use Meetup to announce all of our events, so please look below to see what is coming up.

Thanks for visiting us here on Meetup.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">3364 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27178%27%20height=%27100%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Integrated Men - Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Integrated Men - Atlanta</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Integrated Men - Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Integrated Men is a support community of men committed to helping men find their own purpose and passion in life instead of living the scripts that they are forced to live by.</p><p>We welcome men from all walks of life and provide a safe space for men to start learning to be their authentic selves. Having read the book is not important to join the group, but if the description below chimes with you, and you wish to make necessary life changes, join our group.</p><p>If you are not familiar with the concept of having a purpose and passion in life, a great place to start is No More Mr. Nice Guy by Dr. Robert Glover and getting familiar with the core concepts discussed in our group meetings.</p><p>Nice Guys have been conditioned to believe that if they are "good" and do everything "right", they will be loved, get their needs met, and have a smooth life. Sound too good to be true? It is. This belief is a myth, which only leaves Nice Guys feeling frustrated, lonely, and powerless.</p><p>Dr. Glover says:</p><p>An integrated male takes responsibility for getting his own needs met.</p><p>----</p><p>This group is about taking Full Responsibility for our lives instead of blaming others for our life situations. Time and again we fall into the trap of comparing ourselves to others' lives and situations. The goal is to forge our own lives based on our own set of values and purpose.</p><p>There is nothing wrong with being nice. But the Nice Guy does it to seek approval and avoid rejection. He's a people-pleaser. He constantly sets his own needs and wants aside, and pretends to be something he's not, in order to make other people happy. Suppressing his authenticity does not work for long. The Nice Guy eventually blows up in a rage, passive-aggressive behavior, or compulsive sexual acting out. Nice Guys do not feel that it's safe to be exactly who they are and therefore are secretive, manipulative, and very unhappy.</p><p>We are a group of men who want to start taking control of ourselves and our lives. We have seen that we cannot do it alone. The group aims to provide a safe space for men to have difficult conversations without fear of judgment.</p><p>We pledge to help, support, and encourage one another in our journey to become Integrated Males.</p><p>We strive to:</p><p>• Stop seeking the approval of others.</p><p>• Learn effective ways to get our needs met.</p><p>• Feel more powerful and confident.</p><p>• Create the kind of intimate relationships we really want.</p><p>• Learn to express our feelings and emotions.</p><p>• Have a fulfilling and exciting sex life.</p><p>• Embrace our masculinity and have meaningful relationships with other men.</p><p>• Live up to our potential and become truly creative and productive.</p><p>• Accept ourselves just as we are.</p><p>• Live with total integrity.</p><p>If these are things you want in your life, please join us! Any adult male is welcome, regardless of relationship status, position in life, religious beliefs, or sexual orientation. We strive to make our meetings safe for all.</p><p>Our support/discussion group meetings are held every Tuesday night and last about 2 hours. Along with our Tuesday night meetings, we also have in-person gatherings and workshops. We also do plenty of other group activities to give you a chance to bond with our group of amazing men.</p><p>Even though we take the principal themes for our meetings from the book "No More Mr. Nice Guy", by Dr. Robert Glover, we also use other inspirational books and materials to enhance our discussions. Join us and start getting what you want in life, love, and relationships!</p><p>Please read the following Community Values and Guidelines</p><p>• Respect for the rights, differences, and dignity of others</p><p>• Respect confidentiality.</p><p>• Honesty and integrity in dealing with all members of the community</p><p>• Accountability for personal behavior</p><p>• Live an authentic life.</p><p>• A pursuit of vulnerability through sharing personal experiences.</p><p>• Being fully present (And listen actively).</p><p>• Discover your personal passion.</p><p>• Accept that everyone is on their own journey.</p><p>• Support others as they pursue an authentic life.</p><p>• Respect women. (without putting them on a pedestal and treating them as equals)</p><p>• Be an example to children.</p><p>• Honor your commitments. (Keep your word.)</p><p>• Strive to build a community spirit.</p><p>• Know our responsibilities.</p><p>Members shall refrain from pursuing other members for the sole purpose of personal gain or personal agenda.</p><p>Members shall refrain from creating disruptions within the group.</p><p>By attending the meetings, I agree with the community values and vow to withhold the code.</p><p>Membership Requirements</p><p>We advocate authenticity, and this is the first and important step towards it.</p><p>.</p><p>As part of the membership process we require that all members meet the following requirements:</p><p>• Have an appropriate Meetup profile picture</p><p>• Provide their name.</p><p><br></p><p>Note: This is a paid membership group to ensure I provide the best community experience of a safe space for men possible. If you are ready to join, start by sending a Meetup join request and then taking a free quiz below.</p><p>If you are ready to begin your journey take a short quiz to get started. (<a href="https://niceguysto.integrated.men/go" target="_blank">https://niceguysto.integrated.men/go</a>) page.</p><p>.</p><p>Thank you.</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">50 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; Then this group is for you! I envision us meeting once a month at a Brewery for a good time, maybe games, and no networking..LOL</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">330 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Ladies....many of us are transitioning or have transitioned in life and may have out-grown, moved away from, or travel different paths from our original friends….so it might be time for New Friends.
&nbsp;
Fantabulous Friends in the A is a group of fun-loving women who want to Live, Laugh, Love, Eat, Drink, Travel and Enjoy Life!

Respectful, Judgment-Free Group of Friends Where You Can Be You!
This group is for all Fantabulous women who want to get together with other women and enjoy good laughs, food, experiences and great conversation.
&nbsp;
A Fun Girls Trip with women who don’t want to travel alone.
&nbsp;
The goal is to have brunch, lunch or dinner at least once a month and some other activity. Let’s take a day trip, weekend getaway or longer trip.
&nbsp;
-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; PLEASE Don’t be a flake \~ RSVP, Attend &amp; have Fun.
-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If you Always late....please pass us by.
-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If you rsvp to everything &amp; attend nothing....please pass us by.

Let’s Have A FANTABULOUS Time Together!!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">133 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. Metal Society</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta Rock &amp; Metal Society" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">[A.R.M.S. t-shirts available now!](https://www.customink.com/fundraising/support-arms-spring-2022)

A society consists of like-minded people governed by their own norms and values within a dominant, larger environment- **Welcome to the Atlanta Rock &amp; Metal Society!**

This meetup group is a judgement free zone, designed for all metro Atlanta fans of rock and metal music to come together and enjoy all things rock! What’s not to love about going to see great live shows with some good friends, right? We plan events that take us to a variety of the greatest live venues that Atlanta has to offer, as well as other gatherings that will allow us to chill and socialize as a group.&nbsp;
**In the spirit of building a true Society we have&nbsp; a few basic rules:**

• We require that all members attend **at least one event** in each calendar year, this is a MeetUp group after all!

• In the event that you **amass 3 no-shows,** we will give you the boot!&nbsp; It's inconsiderate and downright rude to stand up you fellow Society Members!

• We also require **each user include a photo** in their profile so that we may be able to identify you when you come to events.
So, if you are a fan of Rock/Hard Rock/Metal and,&nbsp; can abide by these rules ...Come rock out with us!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">420 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="50 + Card Players" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
**YOU MUST SHOW PROOF OF VACCINATION !!**
**We're a mature group of individuals who are at least ( 50 ) years old. Hence, the title of the group ( 50+ ). We get together to play mostly Bid-Whist, some Spades, and at times a Lil ole Pinochle. We will teach you Bid-Whist if you would like to learn the game. While playing we listen to old-school music and TALK TRASH.**
**We play at different venues or at one of our member's homes. When a venue allows us to play at their establishment we MUST patronage the venue. Each member must spend at least ( $10 ) for food and drink. When playing at a member's home it is a POTLUCK and each person MUST bring a dish or something to drink.&nbsp;NO CHILDREN ARE ALLOWED.**

**When requesting to join you MUST:**
**1\. Have a current picture of YOURSELF\.**
**2\. Write a short bio \( tell us a little something about you \)**
**3\. Please state the name of the individual who referred you to us**
**4\. What is your EXACT age?**
**5\. Have you read our welcome message?**
**Our membership dues are ($20) annually payable each January.&nbsp;If you join after March 31 the dues will be assessed at a pro-rated amount for the remainder of the year.&nbsp;From the date, you join the group you have (30) days to pay your dues. If you do not pay your dues inside of a (30) day period you will be removed from the group. Also, you're not allowed to attend a private party at a member's home if you have not paid your dues. Once removed from the group you MUST request to rejoin again if you desire to do so. You may pay your membership dues in cash at a meetup, via PayPal, CASHAPP, or Zelle.&nbsp;If, paying at a meetup please bring the EXACT amount. In the memo section please identify yourself and state the reason for payment when paying online.**

inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>You will be lead by a teacher, but we will all learn from each other's creativity, sharing of past projects and techniques, and ideas for future projects. We will inspire each other in a fun and relaxed atmosphere.&nbsp;</p>
<p><span>Monthly classes are held for beginners to advanced paper crafters, with an emphasis on card making.&nbsp;</span></p>
<p>I do not represent any company and use various company's products. The classroom is stocked with full ink lines from 5 different companies, as well as hundreds of stamp sets, dies, embossing folders, and stencils from various manufacturers. There are several die cut machines and 2 embossing folder machines, so you never any waiting. Each of the 8 crafting areas is stocked with a task lamp, Ken Oliver mat, a regular size MISTI, and all the tools and adhesives you will need, so there is no lugging your own tools to class.</p>
<p>Please join us for all the fun and creativity!</p>

Events will be adult only. The activities are designed for fun like dancing, trivia, bowling, eating out together, festivals or whatever sounds like a good time to hang out.&nbsp; &nbsp;Couples and singles are welcome, but must enjoy a good time.&nbsp;
Regular members wear the red wrist band shown in the group picture to make it easy to find the group.&nbsp;&nbsp;

Hang Out Woodstock is HoW we like to party.

Due to high level of last minute cancellations for dinners, we are implementing a new policy. For dinners which require a reservation and high level of planning with restaurants, anyone cancelling within 24 hours of the dinner will be marked as a no-show. This is very unfair for restaurants who go out of their way to staff for our large parties, and risking our reputation for continued support. Additionally, as we extend a reservation to additional attendees - those with a known history of consistent attendance will take precedence before others. As always, our policy has been 3 no-shows and you will be removed form the group. As a reminder, we are an adult only group, no children under the age of 18. \*\*All decisions held at the discretion of leadership\*\*</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">1872 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. All are welcome! Metro Atlanta Volleyball is the ultimate in Sports &amp; Recreation – it is a very social sport. Beach volleyball is also a great form of low impact exercise. See you on the court!</p><p>Please review the Atlanta Volleyball "About" page for information on how to play more volleyball by organizing a volleyball event.</p><p>This group is for Adults... age 18 and up.</p><p>To&nbsp;view a video of one of our volleyball games, check out:</p><p><a href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/7NMrFqIuJ2g" target="_blank">http://www.youtube.com/embed/7NMrFqIuJ2g</a></p><p><strong>Chip into this meetup!</strong></p><p>If you have enjoyed our events, please consider chipping in. Atlanta Volleyball Meetup costs $200 per year for the website. We'll spend your contributions to fund improvements to public volleyball courts so we have more or better volleyball courts. Please see the link on the left under "This Meetup is community funded - Chip in"</p><p>Lets play some Volleyball Atlanta! . . . Warm weather is the time to play beach volleyball, and metro Atlanta has over 50 beach volleyball courts, but many of them need improvements.. so lets play vball!</p><p>&nbsp;</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">6135 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; in-person and serves as a calendar to discuss various GitOps-related topics! Whether you’ve been wanting to learn about GitOps for the first time or you need help convincing your teams to understand the benefits of GitOps, this meetup group is for you!

Note to our Flux community: [Flux v1 is in maintenance mode](https://github.com/fluxcd/flux/issues/3320) and we **strongly advise** everyone to familiarize themselves with the latest version of Flux and [start the process of migrating](https://fluxcd.io/docs/migration/). You can find monthly updates here: [https://fluxcd.io/blog/](https://fluxcd.io/blog/) and join the conversation here: [https://github.com/fluxcd/flux2/discussions](https://github.com/fluxcd/flux2/discussions)

GitOps Conversation Kit
The GitOps Conversation Kit ([https://gitops-community.github.io/](https://gitops-community.github.io/)) includes links to the GitOps Days ([http://www.gitopsdays.com/](http://www.gitopsdays.com/)) session videos categorized by topic areas as well as the full YouTube playlist. Weaveworks is donating the kit to the community and will continue to improve it so that you can use it to move the needle in your company with GitOps!

We’ve also created a minimalist, non-spammy mailing list ([https://mailchi.mp/7e9e02588c50/gitops-community](https://mailchi.mp/7e9e02588c50/gitops-community)) to share updates to the GitOps Conversation Kit. Subscribe ([https://mailchi.mp/7e9e02588c50/gitops-community](https://mailchi.mp/7e9e02588c50/gitops-community)) if you want non-noisy updates regarding the kit and relevant information about GitOps.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">32 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">This group welcomes all gay single men in Atlanta (30-39) who are open to meeting new people for friendship or dating! Whether you are a recent transplant to the city or a long-time resident, this is a space for everyone to mix and mingle to build genuine connections. 

To create a community based on trust and openness, **everyone who requests to join this group must be willing to identify themselves and upload a picture of their face.** If you prefer to be discreet or remain anonymous, we have no judgment here but there are better spaces for you. 

We will meet at least once per month and activities will be based on the interests of the members who join. Event suggestions are highly encouraged and welcomed. We want this to feel like an egalitarian space where everyone has an opportunity to suggest ideas and lead/organize an event for the group if they like. 

We value members who join with the intention of actively participating and taking initiative in the group (no passive observers or bystanders). If everyone contributes to this community, this can grow into an incredible space where lifelong friendships and romantic connections are made!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">13 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Dealing with Negativity and Insecurity in Life" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">**Have you ever gotten angry and not known why?** **Do you introvert or become shy for no reason?** **Do you get upset without any particular reason?** **Do you feel confused and lacking emotional energy?**

These are just some examples of what people might go through in their lives that could lead them down paths towards happiness, but first, need to deal with. This group aims at giving tools so everyone can be happier than before by imparting knowledge on how everyday life affects our mental health.

We are a group of people who want to help others improve their lives. Our events will teach you ways in which we can do this through understanding other people and controlling your emotions, anxieties or even becoming more positive! Currently, the only meeting place for our online community is MeetUp but soon it'll extend into physical locations too if all goes well.


This group has been created in association with the Dianetics Life-Improvement Center.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">86 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; <p><span>Attention! All Atlanta Jazz Lovers <span>&nbsp;</span>it doesn't matter if you’re Single, coupled or a new comer to town. we invite you to join us for weekly Live Jazz Meetups in and around the Atlanta area. If you enjoy meeting new people, having fun, group discount rates at selected shows and most importantly Live Jazz, then this is the Meetup experience you've been waiting for. The Atlanta Jazz Lovers Meetup Group is where you will have a chance to checkout some of the Jazz worlds best up and coming artist in the company of like-minded Jazz Lovers. This groups Mission is to <strong>keep Live Music</strong> flowing in Atlanta with affordable, quality, top notch shows, at great venues</span></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">269 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; maybe you experience anxiety or depression; maybe you feel alone or stuck; maybe you are simply interested in the wisdom of life.

Whatever your reasons, if you feel you are not as happy as you can be, and you wish to learn the secret of happiness, this is the group for you.

In this group, we will specifically tackle the following:
• What it means to have mental health
 • Letting go of bad experiences 
• Learning how to start good relationships
 • Learning how to maintain good relationships

To do the above, we will have free weekly meetings available to the members in Atlanta area.

ABOUT THE ORGANIZER: I have been a life improvement consultant at a non-profit organization for about 8 years now. I specialized in helping people learn tools for communication, relationships, and getting rid of low self-esteem, anxiety and depression.

I think HOW TO BE HAPPY is the MOST important thing in life for anybody to learn.  This group is created by the Dianetics &amp; Scientology life improvement center.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">54 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta Stress Fighters, Anti-Stress Group" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">**WE ARE LIFE LEARNERS AND STRESS FIGHTERS!**

Have you ever gotten angry and not known why? Do you introvert or become shy for no reason? Do you get upset without any particular reason? Do you feel confused and lacking emotional energy?

These are just some examples of what people might go through in their lives that could lead them down paths towards happiness, but first, need to deal with. This group aims at giving tools so everyone can be happier than before by imparting knowledge on how everyday life affects our mental health.

We are a group of people who want to help others improve their lives. Our events will teach you ways in which we can do this through understanding other people and controlling your emotions, anxieties or even becoming more positive! Currently, the only meeting place for our online community is MeetUp but soon it'll extend into physical locations too if all goes well.

This group has been created in association with the Dianetics Life-Improvement Center.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">71 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; <p>Life can be complicated, busy and stressful. The ultimate energetic salve? Being in the outdoors (and occasionally indoors), making new connections and enjoying an experience. </p> 
<p>Following are a few experiences I have in mind:</p> 
<p>Canoeing <br>Disc Golf<br>Nature Walks<br>Escape Room<br>Picnic<br>ATV Ride <br>Zip Line <br>Skeet Shooting </p>

max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta Dining (In and Out) Book Club Meetup" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">We will meet monthly online on a Saturday to check in with one another and hopefully have value-added discussions about our selected book.&nbsp; I hope one day to go back to the Atlanta Dining Out Bookclub, but let's see where life and this pandemic takes us:)!
Bring your thoughts, ideas, passion, coffee, tea, breakfast, and/or favorite cafe pastries...and let's dine "in" together:)!.
Each member will have an opportunity to select a book and a restaurant that best matches the theme or setting of the current book selected for monthly book club discussion. I had a similar book club while living in Newport Coast and the book club members and I had a blast connecting each month to discuss our books and dine out. I made some great connections and life-long friendships. I am hoping the same for the Atlanta Dining Out Bookclub Meetup.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">15 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Healing Without Borders: Atlanta</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Healing Without Borders: Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Everyone deserves options. Until global citizens of all socioeconomic and geopolitical denominations have easy access to complementary and alternative medicine, Healing Without Borders will fight to educate, engage and advocate on behalf of holistic/integrative healers.

Healing Without Borders was created to host in-person events, but when you're starting a public health org, a pandemic is a call to action, not an excuse to delay plans; so we - like many&nbsp;[healers we adore](https://heale.rs/directory)&nbsp;- took to Zoom for the time being.

With much of the world vaccinated, healers and advocates have resumed community programming: workshops, retreats, etc. It’s been a year since we launched and are excited to soon organize the local chapters we’ve envisioned since the start, with the addition of an online home.

**Social Meetups**

At the start of 2022, Healing Without Borders will be recruiting volunteer hosts for semiautonomous chapters, to represent the organization in their community and, optionally, online. Events are perfected with support of the central team.

**Social Media**

Thanks to a serendipitous series of events, HWB will soon receive a significant in-kind donation, an already-operational social networking site, which is the predecessor to the app-based community Healers™ plans to release next year.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">14 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%2718%27%20height=%2718%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="question" srcset="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/next/images/Question.svg?w=32 1x, https://secure.meetupstatic.com/next/images/Question.svg?w=48 2x" src="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/next/images/Question.svg?w=48" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="w-full h-full" style="position: absolute; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="FUN 40 CREW!" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">FUN 40 CREW!</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="FUN 40 CREW!" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><img src="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/d/b/2/e/600_482756110.jpeg"></p>
<p><i><b>FUN 40 CREW! </b><b>- A Group For Mature, Grown &amp; Sexy People Over 40 With A Zest For Life!</b></i> &lt;br&gt;</p>
<p>If you're over age 40 who is young at heart and looking for a group to freely be yourself, isn't afraid to let loose, get buck wild and live life to the fullest, this group is for you. FUN 40 CREW is a group designed for mature, grown and sexy singles and couples of all races over 40 who enjoy having fun and life itself. Where The Sexy Silent Generation, Baby Boomers and Generation X come together.</p>
<p>Our group is about making new friends and creating new memorable experiences. We want to meet other pleasure enthusiasts who live like tomorrow never dies and still in their prime. There's NO LIMITS to the things we do in this group, we do a little bit of everything. We host variety of events such as bowling, networking, open dialogue, happy hours, nightlife, trips, summer activities, movies, dining and more. Our group will have opportunities to try new experiences regularly to stay engaged with all life has to offer. Just by getting to know one another, form friendships and grow to a moderate size so that we can plan private parties. Even travel together. You should really enjoy yourself and feel most comfortable here. All required is an open mind, a free spirit and strong self-confidence along with transparency. With the willingness to try something new or out the ordinary without any pressure. We would love for you to join our group and experience Atlanta with laughter, great conversations and wonderful people. </p>
<p><i><b>A DRAMA AND J</b></i><i><b>UDGMENT FREE GROUP:</b> W</i><i>e are an authentic diverse group embracing the Joys of Life in our world and in each other. We leave drama, issues and insecurities behind. There's no one judging in our group. We believe in treating each other with respect. By respecting people's opinion, lifestyle and choices. Please be respectful of others. But most importantly, just be YOU! </i></p>
<p><i><b>TO JOIN THE GROUP:</b> </i><i>You must be 40 and older to join. Fill in all honest answers to questions about yourself on your profile. Including your real name and a current full face picture. Also must agree to our group rules and policies at the next paragraph below. Failure to provide a full face head shot picture, not filling out answers fully on your profile and not agreeing to group rules is an automatic denial of your request for membership. <b>NO MODEST NARROW-MINDED PEOPLE ALLOWED!!</b></i></p>
<p><i><b>***GROUP RULES AND POLICIES***: </b><b>All rights reserved. </b><b>Any illegal activities such as illegal drugs, weapons and theft will not be tolerated. </b><b>Everyone must pay your own expenses when dining in restaurants, clubs or lounges (Including tipping severs and bartenders). In other words, no freeloaders! Any aggressive and/or abusive behavior is unacceptable in our group. Bullying, harassment, slandering, arguing and fighting among others will not be tolerated. Well as these rules applies when we interact with members in other groups. </b></i><b><i>Members have the right to report any violation by others to host or organizer and the situation will be handled immediately. Violation of these rules will result in immediate removal and banned from group. Fun 40 Crew reserve the right to remove and ban members at any time. Our events are monitored in order to provide a relaxed and safe environment. </i></b></p>
<p><i><b>***PHOTO OF YOURSELF (YOUR PERSON) IS REQUIRED***: </b>Y</i><i>our profile must contain a picture of yourself (not an object or someone else). Please upload a current single full-face head shot picture of yourself. Recognizable so we can recognize you when we meet. That means no back head shots, no group shots, no pets shots, no land/building shots, no using celebrity photos and no body parts or nude photos. </i></p>
<p><i><b>PLEASE DO NOT POST GROUP PICTURES OR WITH CHILDREN!!!</b></i></p>
<p><i><b>NO CATFISHING!!!</b></i></p>
<p><i>Failure to provide a full face picture of yourself is an automatic denial of your request for membership.</i> </p>
<p><i><b>IF YOU ARE SELF-CONSCIOUS AND/OR UNCOMFORTABLE TAKING PICTURES AND HAVING THEM POSTED ON OUR WEBSITE, PLEASE DO NOT JOIN THIS GROUP! </b></i></p>
<p><i><b>COME AS YOU ARE</b>: F</i><i>or most of our events, the attire is to come</i><i> dressed comfortably casual. No mater how risqué or skimpy your outfits are.</i></p>
<p><img src="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/d/b/3/3/600_460376115.jpeg"></p>
<p><img src="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/4/2/0/7/600_489496903.jpeg"></p>
<p><b><i>"A lack of transparency results in distrust and a deep sense of insecurity.” - Dalai Lama</i></b> <br></p>
<p><b><i>***ATTENDANCE / RSVP RULES***</i></b>: <i>As a new member, we would like to meet and greet with you. The best way to gauge a person's authenticity is to meet in person at our events. We ask that you come to ONE event within the months you join. Or at least once within 2 months time frame. We rely heavily on the accuracy of RSVPs as we plan our events and make reservations. Members are given ample time and reminders to update their RSVPs days before the event. Please update your RSVP to "NO" when you realize you will not be able to make it. Also, if you are on the waitlist for an event, you are not clear to attend unless organizer updates your status to "YES". That way, we will fill in the limited spots of those who have backed out. If any facilities has full reservation bookings, we will not fill in the spots of those who backed out. Having more than 1 no shows is not tolerated and will result in removal and being banned from group. </i></p>
<p><b> ***When we have reservations at a dining facility, PLEASE BE ON TIME!***</b></p>
<p><b> ***PLEASE DO NOT JUST SHOW UP AT EVENTS IF YOU DID NOT RSVP!***</b></p>
<p><i><b>EVENT SUGGESTIONS AND HOST VOLUNTEERING: </b></i><i>We welcome suggestions and offers to host any kind of events. </i><i>If anyone have a suggestion and would like to host an event, please send all information and details to organizer. You will have access to change, update or cancel your event if needed. When hosting an event, please take pictures and have them posted on our website.</i></p>
<p><b><i>We're all about being ourselves by letting loose, having a great time and enjoying life!&nbsp;</i></b></p>
<p><img src="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/7/e/2/6/600_482372294.jpeg"></p>
<p><b><i>OUR MAIN GOAL IS TO BRING </i></b><b><i>MATURE SEXY PEOPLE TOGETHER TO HAVE FUN WITH NO DRAMA!</i></b>&nbsp;</p>
<p><b><i>N</i></b><b><i>OW GET OUT OF YOUR COMFORT ZONE AND COME JOIN US FOR SOME FUN!</i></b></p>

display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Soul Sisters Woman's Group" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Yes, that’s you, girlfriend! Soul Sisters are inclusive, respectful, and non-judgmental. Life is about surrounding yourself with your kind of crazy. Bring your best authentic self to bring out the best in others. New in town, ready to get out, wanting to increase your girl tribe, looking for your newest best friend, empty nesters, then this group is for you. We are about sharing, laughter and relaxation. We will share coffee, brunch and dine at local restaurants, visit breweries and wineries, go for walks in parks, do fun activities, do events for charities, go to the movies, have game nights, paint &amp; sip nights and potlucks.</p><p><br></p><p>Now for the boring GROUP RULES and the behind-the-scenes stuff that make a group successful.</p><p>Be Respectful and Mindful, it takes time and effort to organize events and make sure things run smoothly ahead of your arrival.</p><p>Don’t be the flaky friend, it is important to update your RSVP at least 48 hours before the event you signed up for. It takes a minute to change that RSVP! If you do not show up, you will be recorded as a ‘No Show’. 2 Event no shows, gets you removed.</p><p>Of course, life can get in the way of your ‘ME TIME’ but a quick message regarding circumstances when 48 hours is not possible, makes all the difference!</p><p>Keep in mind, last minute cancelations are unfair to the next person on the waitlist, so be kind and do the right thing.</p><p>Don’t hog the events if you are not 100% sure you can make it, you will be removed for doing this repeatedly.</p><p>Regular members will get priority when there is a waitlist for an event.</p><p>We will automatically remove members who do not have a profile picture.</p><p>This is a women’s only group.</p><p>Members will pay annual dues of $10, after a 90 day trial period and this will go towards an end of the year event and potlucks. Member dues are non refundable!</p><p><br></p><p>LASTLY, and most importantly!</p><p>Girlfriends, the key to building friendships is about showing up, being authentic and being accepting of others. This is the new you! Welcome!</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">29 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27178%27%20height=%27100%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Women's Outdoor Network" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Women's Outdoor Network</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Women's Outdoor Network" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Women’s Outdoor Network, Inc. (WON) is an LGBT-friendly, membership-based organization that has been serving the Metro Atlanta women’s community for over 30 years by providing a fun and safe environment for indoor, outdoor and volunteer opportunities. Our mission is to create a community that is welcoming, inclusive and supportive, providing a safe environment where you can have fun, make friends and become more active. Membership is $15 per year paid through MeetUp.com WON members must agree to the terms of our Membership Agreement including the Liability Waiver (see below). To Join WON go to MeetUp.com/WONatlanta 1\\. Make sure you have a personal meetup account \

2\\. Request to Join our meetup group 3\\. We will approve you as a trial member of the meetup group 4\\. As a trial member\\, you will submit payment so we can approve you as an official member of the Women’s Outdoor Network group\\. We do require first and last name along with a photo of you on your profile\\. We hope you will start leading or suggesting events soon! Please contact us if you have any questions WON Leadership: \ Karen Newell, President \ Theresa Weber, Treasurer \ Tracy Becker, Membership Chairperson \ Jodi Jernigan, Officer \ Women’s Outdoor Network (WON) Membership Agreement By joining the Women's Outdoor Network I have read and agree to the following: The Women’s Outdoor Network, Inc. operates strictly through volunteers. Participants must read and agree to this “Voluntary Participation Form.” This form releases anyone associated with the group from liability, and it states that participants agree to assume the responsibility of all risks associated with activities both known and unknown. Participants recognize that all leaders are volunteers and participants attend voluntarily.&nbsp; WON POLICIES WON does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national or ethnic background, relationship status, sexual orientation, or disability. All women eighteen years of age and older are welcome as members. Men are welcome on some, but not all trips. Safety and respect for others is a priority. Each individual is personally responsible for conducting themselves in a manner that is respectful to others and places safety above all else. With that in mind, WON, Inc. has zero tolerance for drug abuse (prescription or otherwise) or alcohol consumption that jeopardizes the physical safety of any participant, including themselves, while participating in activities that require full physical and mental engagement. Furthermore, outing participants must affirm to have the level of skill required to safely participate in and complete the specific activity(ies). WON activities may not be profit-making ventures for either WON, Inc. or activity leaders. All WON activities and events are NO SMOKING. Please respect your fellow members by refraining from smoking in or around functions being held. PARTICIPANT AGREEMENT, RELEASE AND ASSUMPTION OF RISK In consideration of being allowed to participate in any way in any Women’s Outdoor Network (herein after called WON) program, trip or other activity, including, but not limited to hiking, camping, swimming, scuba diving, snorkeling, biking, rollerblading, back packing, flag football, bocce, tennis, golf, tubing, caving, zip-lining, rock and wall climbing, whitewater rafting, kayaking, or canoeing, I agree as follows and, I fully understand and acknowledge that:&nbsp; (a) outdoor recreational activities have inherent risks, dangers and hazards and such hazards existing by virtue of my participation in such outdoor recreational activities and the use of various equipment in connection with such activities as well as risks that may be encountered in transit to and from various venues where such activities may take place;&nbsp; (b) outdoor recreational activities have hazards which may result from activities associated with strenuous outdoor activities, including, but not limited to, injury or death from personal limitations, falling, hypothermia, drowning, rock falls, snake or insect bites, lightning strikes, equipment failure, weather conditions, or errors of trip leaders or other participants or third parties;&nbsp; (c) my participation in such activities and/or use of such equipment may result in injury or illness including, but not limited to bodily injury, disease, strains, fractures, partial and/or total paralysis, death or other ailments that could cause serious or permanent disability;&nbsp; (d) outdoor recreational activities have risks and dangers which may be caused by the negligence of trip leaders, participants, officers, directors, executive committee members, or members of WON; the negligence of others outside WON; accidents; the forces of nature or other causes; and&nbsp; (e) by my participation in these activities and/or use of equipment, I hereby assume all risks and dangers both known and unknown and all responsibility for any losses and/or damages, whether caused in whole or in part by the negligence or other conduct of the members, agents, officers, trip leaders, or directors of WON, or by any other person.&nbsp; I, on behalf of myself, my personal representatives and my heirs, hereby voluntarily agree to forever release, waive, discharge, hold harmless, defend and indemnify WON and its members, officers and directors from any and all claims, actions or losses for bodily injury, property damage, wrongful death, loss of service or otherwise which may arise out of my participation in the various outdoor recreational activities that may be sponsored, directed, organized or otherwise sanctioned by WON. I also accept and assume the inherent risks of participating in these outdoor activities both known and unknown.&nbsp; I understand that the various members, trip leaders and other participants in the various outdoor activities undertaken by WON may, from time to time, take photographs, slides, films or videos during such activities and that such photographs, slides, films or videos may appear in various promotional materials, newsletters, the WON website, advertisements, or presentations, and I consent to the use of my image. WON, its members, officers and directors assume no liability in the disclosure or dissemination of such images, and I expressly covenant to hold harmless and release WON, its members, officers and directors from all liability in regard to such disclosure or dissemination.&nbsp; I understand that WON does not condone excessive drinking, use of narcotics or other controlled substances, or any other illegal activity, and that I may incur civil and/or criminal penalties for violation of applicable laws, park rules or WON policies. I understand that I may bring only necessary items to WON events and that firearms, fireworks or other dangerous items are strictly prohibited.&nbsp; I am at least eighteen (18) years of age and possess the appropriate physical conditioning and stamina for the activity that I am participating in. I assume all responsibility for determining whether or not a particular activity or trip is appropriate for my current level of fitness and conditioning. I understand that my participation in an activity that is beyond my physical limitations may cause harm and inconvenience to myself and others. I assume responsibility for advising the trip leader of any medical condition that may affect, or be affected by, my participation in such activities. I intend to participate in WON activities in the spirit of good will, discretion and mutual respect.&nbsp; This agreement shall be construed by the laws of the State of Georgia and any dispute that may arise out of it, or otherwise between the parties shall be governed by the laws of the State of Georgia.&nbsp; Should WON or anyone acting on their behalf, be required to incur attorney's fees and costs to enforce this agreement, I agree to indemnify and hold them harmless for all such fees and costs. I certify that I have adequate insurance to cover any injury or damage I may cause or suffer while participating, or else I agree to bear the costs of such injury or damage myself. I further certify that I am willing to assume the risk of any medical or physical condition I may have. In the event that I file a lawsuit against WON, I agree to do so solely in the state of Georgia, and I further agree that the substantive law of Georgia shall apply in that action without regard to the conflict of law rules of that state. I agree that if any portion of this agreement is found to be void or unenforceable, the remaining document shall remain in full force and effect. I ASSUME ALL RESPONSIBILITY FOR DETERMINING WHETHER OR NOT A PARTICULAR ACTIVITY OR EVENT IS APPROPRIATE FOR MY CURRENT LEVEL OF FITNESS AND CONDITIONING. I HAVE READ THE ABOVE WAIVER AND RELEASE AND BY JOINING WON I AGREE IT IS MY INTENTION TO EXEMPT AND RELIEVE WOMEN’S OUTDOOR NETWORK FROM LIABILITY FOR PERSONAL INJURY, PROPERTY DAMAGE OR WRONGFUL DEATH CAUSED BY NEGLIGENCE OR ANY OTHER CAUSE. I AM AT LEAST EIGHTEEN YEARS OF AGE AND UNDER NO LEGAL DISABILITY.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">106 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. Some information about the group is public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%2718%27%20height=%2718%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="question" srcset="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/next/images/Question.svg?w=32 1x, https://secure.meetupstatic.com/next/images/Question.svg?w=48 2x" src="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/next/images/Question.svg?w=48" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="w-full h-full" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"></span></button></div><button class="fill-current text-gray5 hover:text-gray6" aria-label="Share group" tabindex="0" data-element-name="groups-share-click" data-event-label="Share icon" data-testid="share-btn"><div class="flex items-center"><div id="share-in-group-search-results"><div><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" class="injected-svg fill-current" data-src="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/next/images/design-system-icons/share-outline.svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><title>icon</title>

inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Fab Ladies Night Out 45+</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Fab Ladies Night Out 45+" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">This meetup is for mature ladies over 45+ that actually like to go out and have a good time on a regular basis. The meetup is for new members only please. It will eventually become a private group, limited to 10-20 active ladies. 

\*\*\*JOIN IF:
-You are tired of the work/errand/home routine
-You want to meet new people
-You are friendly and flexible
-You want to explore the city
-You are positive and like to have fun
-You plan to participate 2-3 times per month
-You are a new member and not a member of a sister meetup. 

\*\*\*DO NOT JOIN IF:
-You like to join and monitor meetups for ideas but don't plan to attend the meetup
-You want the red carpet treatment but don't want to pay
-You must sit down at every club venue and not willing to pay for the seating.
-You cannot or do not plan to attend 2-3 times per month. Inactive member will be removed.
-You RSVP and cancel at the last minute on a regular basis. Such members will be removed. 
-You don't change your RSVP or inform the group you can't attend or a no show for meetups that require a reservation at the venue. You will be removed.
-You complain about meetups that are not on your side of town but don't make requests to visit venues that are on your side of town.
-You are a complainer. Good vibes only.

Most meetups will be at public settings and some virtual.
Practice personal COVID precautions at every public venue.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">50 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; Are you an investor looking for interesting companies to invest in?

Either way, you've come to the right place.

Welcome to **[The Startup Tank](https://mattward.io/remote)** presented by **[The Syndicate](https://mattward.io/syndicate)**, the startup pitch fest where founders get a chance to pitch their project to prospective investors, possible cofounders and the tech ecosystem as a whole.

If you've ever wanted a chance to pitch your company or get in front of VCs and angel investors, now is your time to shine.

**YOU MUST APPLY HERE to attend - that includes both startups and investors:**

**[https://bit.ly/remote-demo-day](https://bit.ly/remote-demo-day)**

## 

**[About The Syndicate:](http://mattward.io/syndicate)**

The Syndicate angel group invests in mission-driven pre seed to Series A startups tackling big problems in the areas of commerce/ecommerce, platforms/marketplaces, consumer tech, fintech, cleantech &amp; climate change, B2B/enterprise, hardware-as-a-service and of course software/SaaS.

**NOTE:** At this time, only accredited investors (folks with net worth &gt; $1M or yearly income of at least $200k) can participate in syndicated deals.

For more information on The Syndicate, please visit: **[mattward.io/syndicate](https://mattward.io/syndicate/)**
---

**BONUS:** Interested in fundraising for your startup? Be sure to check out my 5-part series: The Ultimate Guide to Startup Fundraising:

**[https://mattward.io/startup-fundraising-101-pros-cons-angels-vcs-angel-groups-syndicates/](https://mattward.io/startup-fundraising-101-pros-cons-angels-vcs-angel-groups-syndicates/)**

--

**[About The Startup Tank:](https://mattward.io/remote)**

YCombinator popularized the demo day. Shark Tank revolutionized the investor pitch. We take the best of both worlds combined with the Covid-fueled remote nature of everything to bring you The Startup Tank Demo Days presented by The Syndicate, the startup pitch fest where founders get to pitch to prospective investors, possible cofounders and the tech ecosystem as a whole.

If you’ve ever wanted a chance to pitch your company or get in front of VCs and angel investors, now is your time to shine.

**About the host:**

I am a serial entrepreneur, startup advisor and business coach, occasional angel investor and ex-VC podcast host interested in helping startup founders change the world for the better.

And to do that, founders need funding and support. That's why I help mission-driven companies with the strategy, growth and fundraising to change the world faster.

To learn more about what me, how I help 10x results, and what past clients have to say about working together, visit **[mattward.io/testimonials](http://mattward.io/testimonials)**</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">19 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; Well, here's Speed Friending! It's all about making new friends online. Jump into great and exciting conversations, learn new things, and find a new friend right in your own backyard! Stop "liking" pictures and start liking PEOPLE (we've got a bunch of great ones) :0)

All you need is a device with a webcam or camera and a good WIFI connection and your on your way!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">1759 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;
