display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27178%27%20height=%27100%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="FUN &amp; FABulous Girlfriends (Southside)" data-testid="next-image" src="https://secure-content.meetupstatic.com/images/classic-events/451700542/178x178.jpg?w=178?w=384" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" srcset="https://secure-content.meetupstatic.com/images/classic-events/451700542/178x178.jpg?w=178?w=256 1x, https://secure-content.meetupstatic.com/images/classic-events/451700542/178x178.jpg?w=178?w=384 2x" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">FUN &amp; FABulous Girlfriends (Southside)</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="FUN &amp; FABulous Girlfriends (Southside)" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">• This group is for FUN and FABulous ladies age 40 and over who want to network, socialize, or just have some fun experiencing new things. Let's face it, meeting good-hearted women such as yourself is hard to come by when you are a busy, independent woman. One of the founding principles of the FUN and FABulous Girlfriends is to give women the opportunity once a month to take a minute for themselves, while enjoying the company of other FUN and FABulous Girlfriends and a bunch of amazing meals along the way with monthly luncheons. In addition to the FAB Luncheons, let's also enjoy some social events such as Happy Hours, Dining Out, Brunch, Wine Tastings, Cultural Festivals, Educational Events, Museums, Road Trips, House Dinners/House Parties, Get Togethers, Movies, Plays, Relaxing Beach Days, Shopping, etc..
Together we will have FABulous new experiences, explore new places, try new things, and enjoy all that the Southside of Atlanta and surrounding areas have to offer. So why not increase your network of friends and cross paths with us! You never know who you can learn from, or simply have a good laugh with at the next FABulous event!
***We have two hallmark events per month - our luncheons and Chat and Chews.***
**Luncheons -** we will visit a restaurant and break bread together over a great meal, while enjoying each other's company. We try to find hidden gems on the Southside, but occasionally we'll wind up in Atlanta. We've done Saturday brunch at Copeland's, Corner Cafe in College Park, Longhorn's in McDonough, just to name a few. Please feel free to bring a guest and suggestions are very much appreciated.
**Chat &amp; Chews -** Chat &amp; Chews are a great way to get to know our members within a more intimate environment. We'll be in the confines of a member's home and we can relax. Here, we can "let our hair down" and enjoy a wonderful meal &amp; some good old fashioned girl time! **CHAT &amp; CHEWS ARE FOR PAID FAB MEMBERS ONLY. NO GUESTS ARE ALLOWED. Each member brings a bottle of wine and a dish.** For those members that do not consume alcohol, feel free to bring a non alcoholic beverage. We ask that each member attend one other FAB event prior to RSVPing to a Chat &amp; Chew, as we'd like to get to know you before allowing access to a member's home. Certainly, we can all understand that!
**Dues** \- FAB dues are $25 per year and used to cover the cost of the Meetup site \(yes\, there is a fee to us to be on meetup\)\, any deposits we need to pay\, Chat &amp; Chew paper goods\, giveaways\, etc\. We will also sponsor events for dues paying members only\.
**Trips** \- We have 2 trips per year \- a summer beach trip &amp; a winter mountain trip\. Check the calendar for the details on those trips\. We always have a blast\! That doesn't mean we can't do other trips throughout the year\. We're always open to traveling\! Please feel free to make suggestions\.
**HOUSEKEEPING**
1\. No shows will not be tolerated\. 3 no shows will result in your removal from the group\. We put in a great deal of time planning quality events and speaking with restauranteurs\, a lot of which are small businesses who need our support\. Not only does this foster a great relationship with these business owners\, but they use our numbers to bring in extra help \( whom they have to pay\)\. Lets be respectful and change RSVPs at least 48 hours before an event\. Waiting till the last minute is the same as a no show\.
2\. Please adhere to trip payment schedules\. We don't want to hunt you down for you to keep a commitment you signed up for\. E\-m\-b\-a\-r\-a\-s\-s\-i\-n\-g\!
3\. We leave stuff as we found it\. At a Chat &amp; Chew we all assist in returning our hostess's home to the same condition in which we found it\. We don't want her to host &amp; clean up\!
Our group is member supported, so please make suggestions for luncheon venues, concerts &amp; plays, cultural events - King Center, wine tastings, happy hours, overnight trips, whatever. Our goal is to bring you quality events while having a ball!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">17 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Blacks United in Leading Technology -  Metro Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Welcome!&nbsp;</p><p>Blacks United in Leading Technology - Gwinnett County / Atlanta is the official, chartered chapter for Gwinnett County / Atlanta, Georgia of the dynamic, growing, vibrant&nbsp;<a href="https://builtinternational.org/" target="_blank">Blacks United in Leading Technology International non-profit corporation</a>.</p><p>Our Chapters are operated under the BUILT Forward brand, and there is no charge to attend. Our dues-paying members, in BUILT International, receive extra benefits - mentors, training scholarships, free job postings, speaking &amp; leadership opportunities, and more.</p><p>We educate people and seek to increase the representation of Black women and men in technology. It’s proven, enterprises that embrace diversity yield the most innovative solutions. We’re talking about the whole gamut from developers, scientists, digital media specialists, engineers, web masters, technicians, QA folks, social media strategists, cyber-security analysts, online marketing experts, UI/UX artists, recruiters, bloggers, operations staff, project managers – and many, many more technology professionals, students and educators.&nbsp;</p><p>We operate in a united fashion with the hundreds of other nonprofits, corporate resource groups, and diversity professionals with whom we share a common mission. Our BUILT Alliance.</p><p>We include all races and ethnicities. Non-technologist supporters are welcome in our community. The doors are wide open for those folks who are simply just passionate about all things technical.</p><p>Our events are held in-person and virtually, with a winning mix of top tech presentations, entrepreneurial series, more tech presentations, networking events, social justice messaging, collaborations with other aligned groups, career advancement seminars, more tech presentations, and Member’s Only, Reserved and Private Events.&nbsp;</p><p>Join us. Share our knowledge. Provide your viewpoints. Let’s explore together how technology is changing the world. Let’s effect Tech Equity, and help ensure technology is inclusive for all.</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">214 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Osho Meditation Atlanta</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Osho Meditation Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><strong><span>Group of Osho Lovers, a gathering of friends.</span></strong></p>
<p><span><span>Group explores Active and Passive Meditations devised or recommended by Mystic Osho. Some of the meditations include: Dynamic, Nadabrahma, Kundalini, Vipassana, Nataraj, No-Mind, No-Dimension, Kirtan, Sufi Whirling, Tantra, Chakra Healing, Chakra Sound, listening to Osho, Osho Video, Spiritual movies, breathing techniques etc</span></span></p>
<p><span><span> <br> Events are held in Kennesaw, Decatur, Suwanee, Douglasville, Norcross, Woodstock, Sandy Springs area.</span></span></p>
<p><span>Group organizes regular weekend, weekday and 1 to 3 day Meditation Retreats / Workshops.</span></p>
<p><span>It has been observance of several friends that meditation in a group has been very effective for them. This group is an opportunity for all to experience group meditation in a safe and friendly enviornment. The group is not promoting or selling or providing any service.</span></p>
<p><span>Group is an <strong>informal and non profit gathering of friends</strong> to meditate in group. The group is not part or affiliated to any organization in USA or abroad. The gatherings are held at the <strong>homes of organizers or at temporory rented space</strong>. Each participant makes a small contribution to cover the associated costs. If you are unable to afford the 'at-cost' suggested contribution for a specific event then please let the organizer know. No one will be refused participation due to their inability to financially contribute towards the event. In <strong>each</strong> gathering all participants - new or experienced are welcome. Detailed instructions are provided. <br> </span></p>
<p><span><span> <br> Group offers a free shared library of great books, audio and Videos of Osho, Eastern and Western mystics, and General Welness topics. The library has been developed by gifts from other members.</span></span></p>
<p><span>Osho does not teach any religion and does not belong to any particular religion. What he really teaches is religiousness - the real fragrance of all the flowers of existence, the Buddhas, the mystics and sages that this world has known. <br> Osho has given thousands of discourses on all the well-known and not so known mystics of the world—from Ashtavakra to Zarathusthra.</span><span> <br> Osho is a modern day mystic whose wisdom, clarity and humor have touched the lives of millions of people around the world. <br> </span><span>His insights are creating the conducive atmosphere or ‘ Atma-Sphere ” for the emergence of what he calls the ‘New Man’ or Zorba, the Buddha – the combination of celebration, dance and song of Zorba and the silence, stillness and meditation of the Buddha, the meditation of the East and the materialism of the West. <br> Zorba the Buddha is a totally new human being who is an awakened one, and he is life-affirmative and free. <br> When someone asked Osho the definition of religion, Osho replied: To be in romance with life is religion. <br> Osho teaches meditation for our inner transformation. Love and compassion are the natural expression of this transformation. We can meditate with Buddha, dance with Krishna and celebrate our love with Sufis.</span></p>
<p><img src="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/7/4/a/event_71446922.jpeg"></p>
<p><span>For more information on Osho on web check <a href="http://www.osho.com/">http://www.osho.com</a>, <a href="http://www.oshoworld.com/">http://www.oshoworld.com</a>, <a href="http://www.oshona.com/">http://www.oshona.com</a>, <a href="http://www.oshoviha.com/">http://www.oshoviha.org</a>, <a href="http://www.oshoatlanta.com/">http://www.oshoatlanta.com</a> ; Youtube Osho Channel.</span></p>
<p><span>Love</span></p>

max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="The Souls of Black Folk: Up From Slavery" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>A co-ed social and book club. &lt;br&gt; &lt;br&gt;"Bringing the gifts that my ancestors gave, I am the dream and the hope of the slave. I rise. I rise. I rise." ~Maya Angelou &lt;br&gt; &lt;br&gt;The intention of this social/book club is to facilitate educational, financial, entrepreneurial, relationship and cultural events that enable us to take full advantage of the opportunities afforded to us that were denied to our ancestors. &lt;br&gt; &lt;br&gt;Some upcoming events will be: &lt;br&gt; &lt;br&gt;Tour: Alonzo Herndon Museum – Born a slave, Herndon went on to become one of the first Black millionaires in the U.S. and Atlanta’s richest black citizen &lt;br&gt; &lt;br&gt;Book Club: Men Don’t Love Women Like You by black male author G.L. Lambert &lt;br&gt; &lt;br&gt;Book Club: The Religious Instruction of the Negroes in the United States by Charles Colcock Jones. Published in 1842, this book sought to inform slave owners how to teach Christianity to their slaves. The “old time religion” may have worked for your grandma and great grandma, but is it working for you.&nbsp;&lt;br&gt; &lt;br&gt;Book Club: She Ain't It by black male author G.L. Lambert</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">2973 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; Do ANY of the following phrases resonate in your heart:</p>
<p>"Han shot first!" <br>"Captain, we are being hailed." <br>"It's bigger on the inside." <br>"Goram reavers!" <br>"Kneel before Zod!" <br>"All your base are belong to us." <br>"Excelsior True Believers!"</p>
<p>If so, you are one of us! Join your comrades in this Social Guild of Calamitous Intent. We share, discuss, and enjoy all things geeky online and in REAL LIFE! ::gasp::</p>
<p>For all the places we live on the internet (Facebook, Goodreads, etc) visit <a>www.metroatlantageeks.com.</a></p>
<p>ABOUT FREE PASSES: Frequently, the Metro Atlanta Geeks procures free passes to movie screenings and other events. These passes are to be reserved ONLY by members of MAG. Anyone found to be distributing links for our passes to other groups will immediately receive a lifetime ban without further notice. <br></p>
<p>Important Notes regarding events: <br>We have several organizers across Atlanta and each is allowed to set up their own meeting criteria (such as ages, singles only, no children, etc.) Certain meetups such as those at restaurants, bars, attractions, ticketed events, etc. may have a minimum age requirement as well. If uncertain, please confirm before attending an event.</p>

Disclaimer: Organizers can’t be held responsible for your well being at an event. Please be responsible for your own and those in your care's well being. We will not be held liable in case of any injury or mishap. \


By signing up for this group you agree to these terms &amp; conditions and accept responsibility for the safety of you and anyone coming with you and agree that Atlanta Indian Divorced/Single Parent Support/Meetup Organizers are not liable for any loss or injury. \


\

 \

FYI: Members take photos in our events and may share this online or with other friends. We don’t manage this and don’t have control over whose photos are taken and shared online. By signing up and becoming member, you agree to release all organizers and event hosts of any liability. \


Due to the nature of this support group, only one spouse or ex’s ex can join this group. We reserve the right to remove a member we later come to realize are related to an earlier approved member.\


There is a $5 membership fee per year which helps us to pay for hosting fees and other meetup event expenses. \


Please respect everyone’s privacy and do not share other people’s personal information. Please be respectful and do not solicit other members for anything. Repeated offenders will be removed from the group. By requesting membership you agree to all the terms listed above.

inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Welcome beginning and experienced screenwriters! We host regular screenwriting bootcamps, classes, script coverage and career coaching from professional, repped screenwriter Conor Kyle. Each week there are a few live &amp; virtual classes, workshops, Q&amp;As and intensive 6- to 8-week bootcamp sessions that take you from idea to first draft, to polished feature screenplay or TV pilot.

Some of our classes are free and some are paid. There are no membership dues or fees required to attend our free classes.

This group is affiliated with Conor Kyle's Script Camp

Website: [https://scriptcamp.net](https://scriptcamp.net)

Our classes are taught live on Discord at: [https://discord.gg/Qy3E35DZna](https://discord.gg/Qy3E35DZna)

Upcoming class schedule: [https://scriptcamp.net/events/month](https://scriptcamp.net/events/month)

\*About the Instructor\*: Conor Kyle has written for Shudder's Creepshow (2019) and placed twice in the Nicholl Fellowship with his scripts “Peter and the Wolves” (quarterfinals, also Launchpad top 10) and The Tube (semifinals). His screenplays have also been featured on the annual Hit List, Young &amp; Hungry List, Spec Book, and on Tracking Board’s “Best Writers of the Year” booklet. He writes everything from stage musicals to Westerns to horror movies.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">183 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Indian Couples in Atlanta Meetup Group" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><img src="https://img1.meetupstatic.com/img/smileys/smile.gif" alt="smile"></p>
<p>Ever been in a situation where you see another couple at mall or movie theater or even a grocery store but too embarrassed to introduce yourself ? <br> <br> If you answered&nbsp;<strong>'Yes'</strong> to any of the above, You have come to the&nbsp;<em>Right Place</em> <br> <br> The Goal of this group is to provide a safe forum for couples in Atlanta to meet, share,do different activities together and increase our "Refrigerator" friends in life! <br> <br> The following are the&nbsp;<em><strong>ground rules</strong></em> for the Group. <br> <br> 1) This Group is open to&nbsp;<strong>All Indians and Non-Indians</strong>! As long as you respect the culture and people in the group, it doesn't matter where you come from! <br> <br> 2)&nbsp;<strong>No Regionalism</strong>! Enough of South/West/North/East Indian. We are in Atlanta!(And ofcourse no ABCD's, FOB's and other "narrow minded" terms.) <br> <br> 3) You should be <strong>Married or Committed Couple</strong>!&nbsp; <br> <br> 4) This group is open to all couples, with or without kids. However , the&nbsp;<strong>primary objective of the group is for Couples to meet as Couples</strong>. The distribution of events is 90%-just couples and 10%-with kids.&nbsp; <br> <br> 5) This is&nbsp;<strong>NOT A SINGLES OR SWINGERS</strong> website or Meetup group! (aways good to EXPLICITLY MENTION that). <br> <br> 6) Please know that we place a high premium on <strong>Courtesy</strong>. If you RSVP Yes to come to a meetup and don't show-up&nbsp;<strong>without informing</strong> via phone call or Text or Email, we reserve the right to remove you from the group. A lot of effort goes into organizing a meetup. The least we expect is some courtesy to make our planning easier.&nbsp; <br> <br> 7) Like Gym-memberships, many join the group with good intentions. Unlike gym-memberships that don't want you to leave whether you attend or not, we remove <strong>Inactive members</strong> periodically. We consider someone inactive if a couple hasn't attended a single meetup in the&nbsp;<strong>past 3 months</strong>.&nbsp; <br> <br> 8) Any kind of <strong>Soliciting</strong> by the members of this group for Amway or pyramid schemes or networking events will lead to removal of those members immediately from this group. Please know that this group is to find <strong>Genuine Couples</strong> with no financial motive whatsoever behind the meetups.&nbsp;</p>
<p>9) While its rare, we exercise the option to remove anyone from the group. <br> <br> To become a member, just send an email telling us something about yourself and what activities you would like to see happen in the group! <br> <br> The Success of any group lies with its Members!&nbsp; <br> <br> So, participate, be open, embrace everyone and feel free to send us any ideas, suggestions or feedback!</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">84 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Outdoor Afro is a community that reconnects African-Americans with natural spaces and one another through recreational activities such as camping, hiking, biking, birding, fishing, gardening, skiing — and more! Outdoor Afro uses social media to create interest communities, events, and to partner with regional and national organizations that support diverse participation in the Great Outdoors. Here is where you can start locally connecting with people who share your outdoor interests!</p>

display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Women Who Code Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Join us by attending a WWCode event or signing up at <a href="http://www.womenwhocode.com/">www.womenwhocode.com</a>.</p>
<p>Women Who Code is the largest and most active community of engineers dedicated to inspiring women to excel in technology careers. We envision a world where women are representative as technical executives, founders, VCs, board members, and software engineers. Our programs are designed to get you there.</p>
<p>Who should join?</p>
<p>Our community is for professional women in technology careers, including software engineers, developers, UX/UI designers, data scientists and more. Current and aspiring coders are welcome. Bring your laptop and a friend!</p>
<p>What to expect?</p>
<p>Our events offer free hands on technical events, study groups, panel discussions, lightning talks, and keynotes featuring influential tech industry experts, innovators, and investors. We help you build the skills you need to raise your professional profile and achieve greater career success.</p>
<p>Support us:</p>
<p>WWCode relies on donations to support this catalytic movement. Funding directly impacts our ability to deliver programs and expand to more cities, ensuring that even more women have the opportunity to excel in tech careers. womenwhocode.com/donate</p>
<p>Share a Job with our Community:</p>
<p>Post your jobs on the Women Who Code Job Board and hire from our exclusive community of technical professionals. Get started at womenwhocode.com/companies.</p>
<p>Code of Conduct:</p>
<p>WWCode is an inclusive community, dedicated to providing an empowering experience for everyone who participates in or supports our community, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, ability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, socioeconomic status, caste, creed, political affiliation, or preferred programming language(s). Our events are intended to inspire women to excel in technology careers, and anyone who is there for this purpose is welcome. We do not tolerate harassment of members in any form.</p>
<p>Our Code of Conduct applies to all WWCode events and online communities. Read the full version and access our incident report form at <a href="http://www.womenwhocode.com/codeofconduct">www.womenwhocode.com/codeofconduct</a></p>
<p>Terms of Service:</p>
<p>Everyone who participates in our community agrees to abide by our Terms of Service. Read it at www.womenwhocode.com/tos </p>
<p>Privacy Policy:</p>
<p>Everyone who participates in our community agrees to abide by our Privacy Policy. <br><span>Read it at www.womenwhocode.com/privacy-policy</span></p>
<p><span>Connect with #WWCode Atlanta:</span></p>
<p><span> <br></span></p>

display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Southern Cycles" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Founded by David and Angela Cook in 2012 to form a group of riders that loved to ride and created a family bond between members.
We are a group of motorcyclist who enjoy good rides, good scenery, &amp; good company. We feel it's not only about the ride, but the people you ride with. We ride the mountain roads, around the city, and out in the country. We ride the speed limit, obey the laws, &amp; ride safe! We are open to people who have ridden for years, and people just beginning.
\

We want participation and to meet new riders who enjoy riding and meeting other people. \

Going forward we will need every member to look at website once a month and participate in a ride or event once every three months. \

 \


If you are unable to meet requirements due to illness or other please email co-organizers to let them know. \

Any member that joined in 2014 and back will be excluded due to their devotion to club already and are exempt. \

Most of meet up location are around woodstock and Acworth.
We do not mix other clubs on rides and if you want to bring a guest it must be cleared thru organizer of event.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">83 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Welcome to Georgia Foodies! As a foodie group, we enjoy meeting people, experiencing new foods and venues, and revisiting our favorite tried-and-true locations. After all, what better way to forge new friendships than over food?
&nbsp;
Be sure to view and subscribe to our blog (georgiafoodies.com) and follow us on Facebook and Instagram by searching Georgiafoodies!
&nbsp;
**Regarding Attendance:**
As our organizers work tirelessly to set up reservations and make necessary accommodations for our members, we have a strict No-Show Removal policy. While members are encouraged to make any changes to their RSVP before the event, should you need to cancel, we ask that you do so a soon as possible. Doing so allows us to make any changes to our event menu and gives the members on our Waitlist the opportunity to attend.
&nbsp;
Please be aware that failure to notify us that you will not be at an event through the MeetUp RSVP feature or other means of communication will result in no-show removal from the group.
&nbsp;
Further, we will immediately remove any members who create an unsafe or uncomfortable atmosphere for our other members.&nbsp;
&nbsp;
Members who are removed are not eligible to rejoin the group in the future.
&nbsp;
**Regarding COVID-19 and Other Illnesses**:&nbsp;
&nbsp;While it is always our goal to provide our members with a safe dining experience, we cannot control the contagious nature of COVID-19, nor that of other illnesses.
&nbsp;
By attending our events, members and guests acknowledge and accept the sole risk and responsibility of potential exposure to and infection of COVID-19 and other illnesses. Furthermore, attending members and guests take on the sole responsibility for any accompanying consequences of exposure and/or infection, including, but not limited to, the transmission of illness to others around you (household, work, etc.), long-lasting conditions/side-effects/permanent disability to you or others around you, and death to you or others around you.
&nbsp;
To protect our members’ medical privacy, we do not require vaccination or proof of vaccination to attend our events.&nbsp;
&nbsp;
If you are not feeling well, we do ask that you do not attend our events until you are well.&nbsp;

max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Boss Mom Mastermind Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">If you're a business owner, you know that success is directly tied to the people you associate with the most. When you see other people doing things around you, you unconsciously integrate those habits into your behavior. If you want to change a bad habit or adopt a good one, it's essential to surround yourself with the right people.
&nbsp;
This insight is why many consider joining&nbsp;**Mastermind**&nbsp;groups: to surround themselves with people who share their values and support them in pursuing their goals.
&nbsp;
**Boss Mom Mastermind**&nbsp;was established to bring a community of like-minded, motivated women entrepreneurs together who are ready to create powerful connections and excel in their businesses.&nbsp;It's not unusual for people who participate in Mastermind groups to experience a six-figure or more upside in their business performance annually. During our Meetups,&nbsp;we openly share what we've done right and what we've done wrong so that you don't have to make the same mistakes. And we do it all while having fun!
&nbsp;
**This group is right for you if:**

* You crave connections with other like-minded people who are big thinkers (I'm talking millionaire status) and refuse to settle.
* You've searched tirelessly online to find your tribe, and the Facebook/digital groups just aren't doing it for you.
* You're a minority. 
* You love wine.
* You're ready to strategize a plan that will give you the time and money to enjoy the summer with your kids.
* You need more collaboration and accountability.
* You seek genuine, no-drama relationships with other Boss Moms in your area.
* You're all about self-development.
* You're passionate about generational wealth.
* You're open to learning how to give/receive constructive feedback.
* You are an action taker and ready to change your life.

If you're looking for a solid and genuine TRIBE of Boss Moms who have your back and love to have a good time, come join us on this path to success!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">43 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Spiritual But Not Religious  Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">We are not human beings on a spiritual journey, but spiritual beings on a human journey. **Our highest tribute to this journey is to live a joyous, inspired, and fulfilled life.**

Children of Infinity is a non-denominational nonprofit dedicated to raising human consciousness and aligning humanity with Purpose, Joy, Love, and Service.

The attunement to higher consciousness begins with a better worldview. The core problems that afflict our planet – fear, disharmony, confusion, and greed – are manifestations of problematic worldviews. Current prevailing worldviews – Scientific Materialism and Religion – are both inadequate. Scientific Materialism sees human life as an accident, thus denying all spiritual phenomena. Religion requires faith in beliefs without offering any framework for validating and refining them, a core limitation that leads to dogma, disharmony, conflict, and violence.

Our organization promotes the progressive worldview of Scientific Spirituality, a discipline that seeks to integrate Science and Spirituality in holistic yet rational ways. Scientific Spirituality leads to an evidence-based model of reality that is open to research and refinement. To learn more about this worldview, watch this video:&nbsp;[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qI37-psjtE4](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qI37-psjtE4)

**Community Resources**
Our organization is dedicated to distilling the essence of spiritual wisdom and making it accessible to the community. The research includes philosophical works dating back thousands of years, from Vedantic times in ancient India to the latest advances in Quantum Mechanics.

**The foundational material for our teachings is available here:**&nbsp;[https://childrenofinfinity.org/recommendations/](https://childrenofinfinity.org/recommendations/)

**To make our teachings digestible, we have created free video courses available here:**&nbsp;[https://childrenofinfinity.org/courses-2/](https://childrenofinfinity.org/courses-2/)

Join us in this global effort to transform fear into love, strife into harmony, and suffering into joy.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">53 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Ageless Women Excursions (AWE!) -     Live Bravely!" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><b>Ageless Women Excursions "AWE":&nbsp; Live Bravely!&nbsp;</b></p>
<blockquote> 
 <p><b>This group is for women that live Bravely; both tender and fierce. For women of Indomitable will. This group is for ALL women who are or wish to live life to its fullest. This group is for the Ageless Woman. For the Young and the Young at Heart. For the woman that is non judgmental, welcoming, fun and game for anything! Married, single, divorced.. we don't care.&nbsp;</b></p> 
</blockquote>
<p><b>Come on out and join us for Travel &amp; Outdoor Adventures. Meet your tribe and make memories to last a lifetime!&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;AWE! was created for making friendships and creating memories that will last a lifetime. Come on out and join our enthusiastic embrace on life as life is a daring adventure or nothing at all. </b></p>
<p>We offer day hikes, backpacking, camping, weekend getaways to weeklong expeditions. Our events are concentrated in the North Georgia area but we have travelled from Florida to Wyoming too! We have outdoor events on the calendar for the Beginner to the Advanced enthusiast. </p>
<p>My trail name is "B.I.C." ( Because I Can). I have been a Leader for many years and I am now bringing my finds to you! </p>
<p>You can also check us out on our Facebook Group page for extra tidbits and pictures: <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1647047938888930/">https://www.facebook.com/groups/1647047938888930/</a> &lt;br&gt;</p>
<p>Happy Exploring,</p>
<p>Anita (AKA: B.I.C)</p>
<p>&lt;br&gt;</p>
<p><b>THIS IS WHAT IS BEING SAID ABOUT "AWE":</b></p>
<p><b>This was a fun day! You ladies were awesome! By far one of the most fun days I've had with a hiking group. The winery was great. I'll go with this group again! &lt;br&gt;</b></p>
<p><b>I wanted to let you know what a wonderful experience this has been for me....it has been such a pleasure being outdoors with the group. I have been totally relaxed &amp; have had the ability to let my hair down with your group....you are an adventurer keep it that way...&amp; keep having fun.........Rosa &lt;br&gt;</b></p>
<p><b>I love this group...everyone is friendly &amp; accommodating....it was perfect...I had a really relaxing time....thanks so much for making this group such a fun &amp; exciting group...I appreciate all the hard work you put into this group. I look forward to every event! </b></p>
<p><b>Amazing. I immediately felt part of the group. Can't wait for more events. </b></p>
<p><b>This experience has been amazing on so many different levels for me! Thank you girls who have shared and will continue to share those AWE-amazing moments. My life has been changed by this group of amazing women!</b></p>
<p><b>Anita was FANTASTIC at helping out all the newbies in the group (myself included!). She has such a passion for the outdoors and loves to share it with everyone. Anita is patient and FUN!</b></p>
<p><b>The meetup was absolutely the BOMB!!!!.... the bomb.com... thanks for all the motivation and help... I could not have made it without each one of you... I look forward to many many more to come... the best group of ladies ever. </b></p>
<p><b>"This group is really fun! I've been on at least 5 hikes already and we always have a great time. If you're looking for a fun, relaxed group of ladies to hang out with in the woods - you've come to the right place! See you on the trails! ”</b></p>

We're a group of seniors ( 55+ ) who would like to get together with other seniors, make new friends and have a good time. We will meet for dinner, happy hour, parties at someone's home, card parties, cookouts, plays, comedy shows, jazz shows, short trips etc. Please feel free to suggest a Meetup Event at any time. Also, we're always looking for Event Organizers. In order to keep this group going, we ALL must work together.

inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Atlanta Circle of Men</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta Circle of Men" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><strong>We are a group of men committed to empower men to win in their lives by providing clarity, commitment and accountability in s safe circle of trust.</strong></p><p><strong>We all post our events here on meetup and provide more information on training programs that we provide as an EVENT on Meetup.</strong></p><p>We want to help you be the best at who you are. We are made up of black, white, straight, gay, married, single, divorced men who range in age from 18 to 88.</p><p>Various teams of men meet all over Atlanta weekly. You can come to one meeting or come to several. Meetings are with teams of men from 5-15. We meet all over town.</p><ul><li><br></li></ul><p>Not every meeting is announced on meetup, so please contact any of the event organizers if you are interested in attending a meeting that is not listed. We can usually find a meeting that fits your schedule best.</p><p><strong>What we are NOT:</strong></p><ul><li>MLM based</li><li>Sales based</li><li>Religious based</li><li>12 Step based</li></ul><p><strong>We are A Circle of Men who do the following:</strong></p><ul><li>Provide a safe place to drop your "social mask" and GET REAL around men</li><li>Don't buy the excuses you tell yourself to justify "playing small" in your life</li><li>Compassionately "call you out" when you're bullshitting yourself or others</li><li>Offer moral and emotional support through the challenges we all face as men (no pity parties, though)</li><li>Will be honest, direct and authentic about how we experience you</li><li>Will demand your best, and expect that you demand the best from us</li><li>Will strengthen your relationships with others in your life; "steel sharpens steel"</li><li>Offer insightful feedback on your life situation and relationship with career, women, family, money, etc.</li><li>Give you a place to bring your biggest challenges, without being judged, shamed or ridiculed</li><li>Challenge you to "play a big game" in your life, take risks, face your fears and push your edges to help you grow as a man and as a human being - and expect the same of you.</li></ul><p><strong>If this sounds like something you'd interested in, then we should talk.</strong></p><p><strong>Contact me when you join: </strong><a href="http://www.Calendly.com/DominicX" target="_blank"><strong>www.Calendly.com/DominicX</strong></a><strong> and I can answer all your questions before you attend an event or if you just want to talk purposefully.</strong></p><p><strong> </strong></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">613 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="P.o.P  [Passion on Purpose]" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Tired of talking about what you want to do or how you wish life was different? This group is to support **women of color** as they shift from dreaming to doing. We will discuss our goals, share resources/knowledge, and network with like minded individuals. Maybe you want to start your own business, better advocate for yourself at work, or even create a more balanced home life... The majority of our meetings will be **virtual** and hosted by Joy R'zelle, a Certified Professional Coach.

This group is free! Our only ask is that you participate. When you RSVP try your best to show up. When you attend share your experience because it's valuable. If you can't attend, update your RSVP so that someone else can have your spot. Lastly, help facilitate a safe, judgement free space for everyone in attendance.

\-\-\-\-\- \-\-\-\-\- \-\-\-\-\- 

For additional support, Joy R'zelle is available for one-on-one coaching. Skills that will benefit people of any gender, all ages and in every relationship, whether it is romantic, work, family or friends.</p><p><br></p><p>A Conscious Partner is FUN!</p><p>This is information that is so important to anyone and everyone, yet it isn’t clinical. (It’s designed so that the sports loving guy will have fun too!)</p><p><br></p><p>A Conscious Partner is AFFORDABLE!</p><p>Free Events include: Do I Love Myself? / Attachment Style / Core Values / What is Love? &amp; Explore my Personality!</p><p><br></p><p>6 Week Programs are just $149 CAD (approx.$120 USD) and individual events are just $25.</p><p><br></p><p>A Conscious Partner is RELEVENT!</p><p>We will discuss topics that impact your life EVERY day and we will create Aha moments that will change your life.</p><p><br></p><p>Please read our reviews!!</p><p><br></p><p><a href="https://www.aconsciouspartner.com/reviews.html" target="_blank">https://www.aconsciouspartner.com/reviews.html</a></p><p><br></p><p>Podcast</p><p>Audio – www.acppodcast.com</p><p><br></p><p>Video - <a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6PtIKmMWgtX-RHjo28Tn4Q" target="_blank">https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6PtIKmMWgtX-RHjo28Tn4Q</a></p><p><br></p><p>Do you know your Attachment Style?</p><p>How about your Core Values?</p><p>Your Emotional Triggers?</p><p>Conscious Communication?</p><p>The 7 Deadly Sins of Relationships? <p>Let's get together for fun activities in and around Atlanta... like movie nights, dancing, dining out, game nights, casual conversation events etc. It's a great avenue to meet new friends, socialize and have fun at the same time.</p>
<p>We are confident that you will like this group. If you have other friends, please bring them along as well. &nbsp;Please note that new members must send the organizer a text or whatsapp message (678 795 9985) in order to be approved. &nbsp;This is a free group. &nbsp;However, there maybe some events that require buying tickets in advance (like concerts etc.). &nbsp;We will be using PayPal for all financial transactions. &nbsp;If you link your bank account to your PayPal account, then there is no charge for transferring money. &nbsp;</p>
<p><i>In addition, if you have ideas for a new meetup event, feel free to contact the organizer or any of the assistant organizers. We will make every effort to host that event or even make you in charge of hosting your own event.</i> <br></p>

I understand and intend that this assumption of risk and release is binding upon my heirs, executors, administrators and assigns, and includes any minors accompanying me on the Activity.&nbsp; <br> <br>If I bring guests to participate in the event I take full responsibility of the guests and agree to all above terms and conditions. <br></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">2191 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">The Rotaract Club of Atlanta</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="The Rotaract Club of Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><span><strong>Are you a young professional who wants to make your community a better place?</strong></span></p>
<p><span><strong>Would you welcome the chance to expand your circle of friends at home and around the world?</strong></span></p>
<p><span><strong>Are you looking for ways to hone your leadership skills and explore career opportunities?</strong></span></p>
<p><span><strong>Then Rotaract is for you!</strong></span></p>
<p>The Rotaract Club of Atlanta is a non-profit organization made up of college educated (or equivalent) young professionals aged between 21-30. Our club offers a multi-dimensional approach by networking and giving back to the Atlanta community through professional development, community services, and social activities.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The&nbsp;Rotaract&nbsp;Club of Atlanta strives to adhere to the principles of Rotary International. The club welcomes civic-minded young professionals who want to develop professionally and become agents of change for their community. We heavily emphasize in giving back to the community by participating in community service events such as tutoring and/or help in cleaning parks in the community. In the past, we have drawn speakers from different sectors such as finance, non-profit organizations, and/or the arts.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Contact us at&nbsp;<b>president@atlantarotaract.org&nbsp;</b><span>or&nbsp;</span><b>vicepresident@atlantarotaract.org&nbsp;</b><span>with any question or comment you may have. We look forward to hearing from you.</span></p>
<p><span><a href="https://www.facebook.com/AtlantaRotaract/">Facebook</a></span></p>

display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Leap - Conversations for curious people" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Leap is an exciting new online meeting place that gets people talking via conversations in small groups. At Leap, we host 20-minute video or audio chats that are designed to put a spring in your step as you go about your day. You'll be grouped with a maximum of four other people because we know that big conversations come in small packages.</p><p><br></p><p>Members can choose from a selection of topics, taking place at different times throughout the day, and jump in. Think of it like striking up a conversation in a coffee shop – it's just simple, social serendipity, with a helping hand from Leap as your host. The conversation topics themselves are varied and interesting, but most of them share a common thread – they are designed to prompt conversation and they motivate the sharing of stories and anecdotes.</p><p><br></p><p>Joining a Leap Conversation is simple:</p><p>1. Join the conversation via Zoom with your video on — the Leap Leader will be there to greet you and kick things off</p><p>2. The Leap Leader will share the conversation prompt and assign you to a breakout room with four other people</p><p>3. Start chatting – you'll have 15 minutes to swap stories, share your thoughts and connect with the people in your group</p><p>4. Rejoin the full group for a quick closing and goodbye</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">195 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">30's &amp; 40s Hikers and Adventurers</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="30's &amp; 40s Hikers and Adventurers" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><b>Single? Looking to meet new people? Want to make new friends? Tired of meetup groups revolving around drinking?!</b> So am I!! That’s why I decided to start this group. My idea is to have fun hiking &amp; outdoors events to facilitate meeting great people and like-minded professionals.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Would you like to contribute?&nbsp;<b><a href="https://secure.meetup.com/30s-40s-Single-Hikers-and-Adventurers/contribute/">Chip In</a></b></p>
<p>Events will never be at 6am or in awful locations that are impossible to get to with ATL traffic.<br></p>
<p>I’ll plan fun stuff like hiking a hidden trail you’ve never tried and perhaps a fun place to eat or have coffee/drinks afterwards. I work near the Brave’s stadium so a lot of these events will be in that area. And it’s a great one! There are several hidden hikes and cool spots to check out.</p>
<p>I do a lot of events and networking activities with work so we'll have icebreakers like human bingo, humble brag, show and tell, and other icebreakers to help us get past that awkward stage of meeting new people. =)</p>
<p><b>Group Guidelines:</b></p>
<p>1) You want to meet new people (singles, networking, friends, etc). You don't have to be single to join! &lt;br&gt;2) You are in the age range of 29-49. &lt;br&gt;3) You are nice and not a creeper; stalkers will be booted. &lt;br&gt;4) Dogs are welcome as long as the location allows it. Please keep them on a leash. 5) I'm not a fan of being a stickler about RSVPs, but repeat no shows will be removed from the group. We have started marking attendance with the app. Regular members will get preference to attend events (no shows get lower preference and are booted after 2 times).</p>
<p>****Please do not join if you attend to sell your wares to members. You will be removed.****</p>
<p><b>Update on Hikes</b>: We are planning hikes of varying difficulty. I will rate these D1 - D5. Please be considerate to other experienced hikers and consider easier hikes or other activities if you are new to hiking. Difficulty levels:</p>
<p>• D1 - Easy; 1-3 miles. Pretty flat.</p>
<p>• D2 - 2-4 miles. Fairly flat. Some hills.</p>
<p>• D3 - Moderate. 3-6 Miles. 2 hours or more. Hills, you will sweat. Some difficulty.</p>
<p>• D4 - Difficult. 3-8 Miles. For advanced hikers only. Very hilly.</p>
<p>• D5 - Expert 6-12 miles. Expert level, very tough (we probably won't do any of these).</p>
<p>Atlanta’s a big city with lots to do, but it can be difficult to meet people in the “city that never reveals itself.”</p>
<p><i>Join us! Let’s make A-town a little smaller!</i></p>
<p><b>Rescheduling, Cancellations and Extreme Weather Policy: </b>I'm not a afraid of a little weather, but most people tend to bail on events if there is a chance of rain in Atlanta. We also schedule some events that can create safety risks for attendees if it rains. Your organizers reserve the right to cancel, reschedule and/or change meetup locations at any time if attendance is low or weather looks likely. We'll make every attempt to update events and schedule an alternate meeting place if possible. Thanks for your understanding.</p>
<p><i><b>Participate at your own risk</b>. The 30's &amp; 40's Hikers &amp; Adventurers Meetup assumes no liability associated with meetup events and meetup members, including: injuries, parking fees, event fees, food, drinks, medical bills, loss of property, theft, parking mishaps, towing fees and/or any other negative thing that might happen. In a nutshell: We organize events to help you meet people and make new friends. That's all we are responsible for. By RSVPing and attending our events, you waive all rights to make any legal claim against Meetup and this group's organizers. You are responsible for yourself and your own safety! Thanks &lt;br&gt;</i></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">3443 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; We clearly label each hike with skill level, anticipated time of completion, pace, and directions.</p><p><br></p><p>FYIs:</p><p>&nbsp;. Hikes typically are scheduled on Sundays to start at noon</p><p>&nbsp;. I always include directions in the event description, so please use these written directions and not any pins or Google maps, as they often are incorrect</p><p> . No surprises: We typically hike eight to ten miles - in the woods - which means uphills and downhills over rocks and roots and through stream beds, so be sure to have proper attire (hiking boots, hiking poles, and enough food and water)</p><p>&nbsp;. On hike days when it is or will potentially be raining, I will announce any cancellations two hours prior to the event by posting "Canceled Rain" in the event title</p><p>&nbsp;. We typically do not permit dogs (some parks prohibit them, some terrain is too harsh), but we encourage attendance from any children who can keep the posted pace (but often it is us old fogies trying to keep up!)&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>I look forward to seeing you on the trails!</p><p><br></p><p>Charlie</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">8163 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Over 50 and Active" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>This group is for anyone over fifty and active that love to hangout and have a great time. Active lifestyle means we are not sitting around but getting out and finding places to go and things to do. &nbsp;</p>
<p>This is a <b>DRAMA FREE</b> group, we respect each other and opinions, these rules also applies when we interact with other meetup groups.</p>
<p>This group requires you to have a current&nbsp;<b>PHOTO</b> on your profile.</p>
<p><b>NO SHOW RULES</b>: If you RSVP to a event and you can't make it, <b>PLEASE</b> update your status.</p>
<p><b>(3) NO SHOWS</b> will cause you to be removed from this group.</p>
<p>We ask that you come to at least one event within 2 months.</p>
<p>We ask each member to donate<b> $12.00 a year</b> to help support our meetup group. &nbsp;That's $1.00 a month.</p>
<p> <br></p>
<p> <br></p>
<p>Join this group and you will have the best time of your life.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!</p>
<p> <br></p>

How? Through the shared experience of our kickass outdoor adventures and trips!</p><p>We provide exciting itineraries to local and global destinations, a supportive adventure-loving community,&nbsp;uncommon experiences, and our signature SHE-nanigans. Discover your awaiting adventure— from a local day tour, a weekend road trip, or your next travel bucket list vacation of a lifetime. Whether you arrive as a female solo traveler or with several of your closest girlfriends, you’ll be greeted by a&nbsp;small group of like-minded women travelers of all ages.</p><p><strong>ABOUT US</strong></p><p><a href="https://explorerchick.com/" target="_blank">Explorer Chick Adventure Co.</a> is an adventure travel company offering women-only, small group travel trips, workshops, and Mini Adventures.</p><p>Our adventures range from local day trips (Mini Adventures) and weekend getaways, to multi-day travel bucket list hot spots all over the world! Outdoor activities on our trips include: hiking, camping, rafting, rock climbing, backpacking, canyoning, surfing and more! Basically, anything that gets us in the outdoors to be active and play.</p><p>Oh, and we think we’re the most BAD ASS group of women around! Explorer Chicks show up with open minds, willing to push their comfort zones, ready to have fun, and to be all in.</p><p>This Meetup is sponsored by&nbsp;<a href="http://explorerchick.com/" target="_blank">Explorer Chick</a>, so&nbsp;there are no dues for joining! max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Downtown Dungeons and Dragons" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Downtown Dungeons and Dragons</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Downtown Dungeons and Dragons" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Dream of being a daring adventurer in kick-ass magical realms? Wish you were an actual elf wizard or a brawny but soft-hearted half-orc? Then come play the world's greatest role-playing game - **Dungeons and Dragons!** *(and other RPGs)*

We run weekly events in Atlanta several nights a week. We try to make our games as inclusive as possible; our goal is to lower the barrier for entry for new folks to get involved in the hobby. New players don't need to bring anything--we provide free dice and character sheets for all first-timers, and all skill levels are welcome!

**How it works:**
When you show up, you'll hear pitches for our regular low-commitment, beginner-friendly one-shot games. You'll pick the game that sounds most interesting to you, your DM and our volunteers can help you with the rules, and you'll start playing right away.

If you enjoy the event and want to come back, you can join one of the ongoing campaigns in our community.

**For Dungeon Masters:**
Anyone that wants to pitch and run a one-shot can just show up any night by 7:00PM to run it (6 to 7 is unofficial "DM Happy Hour"). You don't have to schedule with us or do anything in advance.

So, if you want to meet new people, learn the rules of D&amp;D, or just play some games and have some drinks, come out and join us every week!

Everyone should feel free to join our **[Discord](https://discord.gg/dtCHXFJgUW)**[ ](https://discord.gg/dtCHXFJgUW)community as well!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">2268 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;
