max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Network After Work - Atlanta Networking Events" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Network After Work is a professional community consisting of Entrepreneurs, Professionals, Executives and thought leaders who understand the importance of building meaningful connections. Built on the idea that professionals in every industry across the world all share a common goal, to develop strong relationships that help grow their businesses and careers. Through meeting in-person and virtually, Network After Work provides a platform that makes connecting easy. Hosting live events in 87 US locations with plans to add additional US cities and international locations, growing your business and relationships has never been easier.</p>
<p>For 10 years, we have been at the forefront of face-to-face business connections. As social media and virtual relationships have been all the rage over the past decade, we have found that live interactions are still the best way to build solid connections. Shaking hands and looking someone in the eye is an invaluable skill and builds the strongest foundation for long lasting connection.</p>
<p>Though meeting in-person is our foundation, meeting virtually is a great accompaniment to our signature live events. With our goal to make your business connections long lasting and sustainable, our mission is to do everything for you, all you need is the desire to seize new opportunities and the willingness to help others.</p>
<br>
<p>Visit us on the web at (&nbsp;<a href="http://atlanta.networkafterwork.com">https://www.networkafterwork.com/find/GA-Atlanta</a><span>) for additional information.</span></p>
<br>
<br>
<p>We hope to see you at future event!</p>

max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta - Bucket List Group Travel" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><b>Solo Traveler?</b></p> 
<p><b>Looking for an adventure vacation?&nbsp;</b></p> 
<p>Have the desire to travel, but would like a few friends to go along?</p> 
<p>Bucket List Group Travel (BLGT)&nbsp;is the perfect group for solo travelers (just like you) who have similar interests and a wish to explore the world. We make travel easier and more social for you!</p> 
<p>Bucket list group travel&nbsp;brings together like-minded travelers from across the globe where we experience new cultures, the most breathtaking views, and even learn new things about ourselves along the way.&nbsp;</p> 
<p>As the name says, our tours are designed around – ‘6 Bucket List Interests’ &nbsp;</p> 
<p>Adventure (An unusual and exciting activity)</p> 
<p>Cruise (Pleasure &amp; relaxing vacation)</p> 
<p>Festival (Annual celebration &amp; events globally)</p> 
<p>Hiking (Long walks, treks &amp; camping)</p> 
<p>Road Trip (Long drives with sightseeing)</p> 
<p>Wildlife (An expedition for animal lover)</p> 
<p>With hundreds of trips planned we take care of all the stressful parts like transportation, and accommodation leaving you time to relax and enjoy a unique travel experience you wouldn’t be able to book on your own. Throughout our trips, our guides will ensure you have the best experience by offering local tips and insights to highlight the authentic side of every place you visit.</p> 
<p><b>What are Bucket List Tours All About?&nbsp;</b></p> 
<p>- Small groups of 7 - 15 people</p> 
<p>- NO Mandatory Single Supplements on most group trips!</p> 
<p>- Free roommate matching</p> 
<p>- Solo Traveler friendly tours</p> 
<p>- Exciting trips to all 7 continents</p> 
<p>LET'S EXPLORE THE WORLD TOGETHER!</p> 
<p><b>Our Mission&nbsp;</b></p> 
<p><b>One-stop platform for Solo Travelers</b></p> 
<p>Bucket list group is aimed to bring all destinations a click away for solo travelers. We team up local vendors in order to support local economic and workforce sustainability.</p> 
<p>Our experts have high satisfaction checks to make the trip accessible and hassle-free for solo travelers to team up in groups.</p> 
<p>We have something for everyone with a perfect blend of culture and personal style of traveling while exploring the planet EARTH. Our team’s aspiration is to explore each destination like locals do – with cravings of real-life experiences.</p> 
<p><b>We truly believe; 'an adventure is the soul of traveling and passion is key to enthusiasm.'</b></p> 
<p><br> </p>
<p><b>Ready to check off your bucket list?&nbsp;</b></p> 
<p><b>Visit:&nbsp;<a href="https://www.bucketlistgrouptravel.com/">https://www.bucketlistgrouptravel.com/</a>&nbsp;and find your next adventure!</b></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">505 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; Pace of play is important at all courses, so be mindful if you are new golfer. Max score is 3 over par on any hole. Let's have some fun!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">108 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">The Atlanta Science Tavern</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="The Atlanta Science Tavern" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">If you are excited by science - but not necessarily a science professional - and you live in the Atlanta area, then the Atlanta Science Tavern is the meetup for you.

Our program is centered on a fourth Saturday of the month meeting at a tavern or brewery, which features a speaker - typically a scientist from a nearby university or research center - who presents his or her work to a smart general audience of science enthusiasts.&nbsp;We also host occasional presentations as part of&nbsp;our ongoing Young Researchers Series, which features talks by graduate students and postdocs.

In addition, we organize social outings and field trips that provide opportunities for our members to experience science as it expresses itself in the community at large. Public lectures at local universities, most prominently the Georgia Tech College of Sciences, are a mainstay of our meetup calendar.

See you at the Tavern!

Cheers,

\- The Science for Georgia team

Note:

* Unapproved soliciting of any kind is not allowed at our events.
* We expect adherence to all health &amp; safety guidelines of venues and authorities.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">8442 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; &nbsp;
This also works in reverse, if you have nice items that you want to get rid of, we can sell them for you for a small percentage of what it sells for.

Everyone is welcome to join, there is a one-time cover fee of $2 coming in the door. Zelle 404-909-4489 or $Elayne91. We will have weekly events, usually on Saturday afternoon, and if you're local we can set up a time to meet you so you can have your thing asap.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">5 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; We will focus on ways to transform our inner being and step into flow manifestation.&nbsp;All members of our community are welcome to step into this space where we honor ourselves and each other in our journey.</p><p>Our meetings will be varied, but all dedicated to increasing your clarity, confidence, and commitment.&nbsp;If you want to be able to express your divine feminine in your lives, raise your vibration, and become your BEST empowered self, this is the place for you!&nbsp;</p><p>Some meetings will focus on visioning to become more connected to your soul truths. inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Atlanta Startup Village</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta Startup Village" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">ATL Startup Village is the largest bi-monthly gathering of entrepreneurs in the southeast, hosted at [Atlanta Tech Village](http://atlantatechvillage.com). *(Limited in-person tickets available due to COVID, pending the situation at the time of the event)*

The goal is to provide a forum for the new expression of ideas and business (in a five-minute pitch model), but also give entrepreneurs a place to discuss roadblocks and moving forward in a fun, friendly, inclusive environment. This group is focused on all Atlanta startups, not just technology startups, to broaden exposure and realize that all startups use technology and can benefit from one another.

Follow us on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/atlsv) and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/atlstartupvillage/) with #atlsv. Prior event recordings can be found at&nbsp;[ATV Live Events](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCK7ZjMChCmXPl64rak_mukQ).
__
**Why pitch at ATLSV?**
Startups pitch for all sorts of reasons, typically one of the following:
•&nbsp;Funding (many investors attend or watch online)
•&nbsp;Visibility (for beta testing, more users, brand, upcoming launch or pivot)
•&nbsp;Practice (pitching, answering questions, finding gaps in pitch)
•&nbsp;Hiring (need to find more team members/co-founder, etc)
•&nbsp;General idea validation or product/market fit
__
**Presenter Requirements:**&nbsp;
The company should be considered a "startup" (in size, age, funding, etc); must have something demo-able for 4-5 minutes (a prototype if a physical product, or a beta version at minimum if software or tech); and that their primary operations/base are in the Atlanta metro area.
Service providers who wish to reach the ATLSV audience can participate in the following ways:
•&nbsp;Beer sponsors, who cover the cost of the beer for attendees, and receive 1-2 minutes in front of the audience at the beginning of the event
•&nbsp;Volunteers\*, who man the front door and set up or take down chairs, etc, as needed, and receive 30 seconds in front of the audience at the beginning of the event (*\*Please note, volunteer slots are temporarily on hold due to the virtual nature during COVID)*

**How to Apply**
To learn more about being a presenter or volunteer, please send an email to hosts Paraj Mathur (pmathur@panoramic.vc) and Christian Ross (Christian@happytalks.co). Thank you!

***




***Update on Logistics:***&nbsp;
We’ve showcased more than 350 startups, supporting them in their journey to success. ATLSV alums have scored investors, multiple funding rounds, acquisitions and incredible hires, and we hope we had a little something to do with that.
And after seven and a half years, we were ready to shake things up a bit!
Starting with our January 2020 event, ATLSV moved from a primarily monthly format to every other month. This will give our presenters more time to truly polish up their pitches, and provide stronger value for our attendees.&nbsp;
**Now with Prizes!**
But wait, there’s more -- we’re keeping the same format of 5 companies, 5-minute pitches, but we’re adding just a little more incentive for presenters to bring their A-game: Audience Favorite voting tied to a pretty fancy prize! (Not just the bragging rights, though those are pretty cool too!)

The audience-selected “winner” from each event will have the opportunity to compete in a “Pitch-Off” at the final ATLSV of the year. Up for grabs is one year of two reserve desks and parking valued at $12,000 (if you're a current villager, you get a credit to your account)!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">15798 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta Love, Live and Thrive!" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Healthy relationships really matter! This group was created for those seriously looking for love and for those who have a desire to be active, mostly outdoors.
We attract those who

1. have a desire to be active
2. love the outdoors even though online meetings/classes are offered
3. are kind, caring, and compassionate
4. are grateful people
5. notice, appreciate and crave simple, natural beauties in life
6. are low maintenance
7. are nature lovers
8. are friendly, fun, respectful and welcoming

Over the past 19 years of growing my Live and Thrive groups, these character traits stand out the most and are the most common in our membership.
 
When you attend any online meeting and/or class I'll be eager to get to know you better and help others more easily connect with you. 

Just some of the ways I accomplish this:

1. Make a short podcast about you
2. Create a Nature Note of your first name only (it's a great conversation piece)
3. Plan some group dates for you that are low risk and no pressure
4. Encourage you to consistently attend some group outings so people can find you easily and get to know you better

I have seen first hand how many long-term relationships have developed over time. 
Rather than expensive, high-pressure dates, our members want to spend more time with someone who loves simple, inexpensive activities or outings centered around nature.&nbsp;
If this concept resonates with you, I hope you will join us soon and let me get to work finding someone you are truly compatible with!

Welcome!</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">17 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; Brothers,**
Welcome to a Sacred Space to gather, to Learn &amp; Share the Ancient African Kemetic (Egyptian) Yoga Art to Heal the Mind Body &amp; Spirit. Learn Breathing &amp; Meditation while holding Postures from the Walls of the Ancient Pyramids, carved thousands of years ago. They say are way is DEAD, but Let's us give Life to what still exists internally Ascending into our Devine Higher Frequency &amp; Living our Highest &amp; Wisest at All Times. These Postures have many health benefits for flexibility, circulation, pain &amp; overall Health.In Joy the Stories translated in the exercises we can apply to our daily Lives. Listen to the sounds of the Ancient Kemetic instruments bringing us into a Higher Vibration as we go through the postures &amp; visualize the embodiment of our Divinity of spirit into Creation. Let us find Peace in our Breath &amp; applying the elements of Life to our Journey of Life. Let us in Joy each other's presence, become one with the Devine Essence of Spirit &amp; Live the Ancient Way, to the 20th Century Way\~Dua Ntr. Give Thanks to Devinity in Us All🙏🏽🤍✨</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">66 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Mingling In Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><b>Eclectic Fun Social Events.......Are you looking to&nbsp;to get out more and&nbsp;make new friends??</b></p>
<p><b>Come join us around town for unique and exciting events &amp; Activities each month at the coolest venues in town. Our activities include sports events, hiking, dancing, happy hours, trivia, Texas holdem, dinners, wine tasting, museums, jazz, many indoor and outdoor activities, and much more. We offer our events to members at no charge with the exception of ticketed events and provide significant discounts for food, drink, sports events. We seek to negotiate great food/beverage deals for our members so that they can meet and make friends in Atlanta while keeping your wallet full of cash.</b></p>
<p><b>So, if you are friendly and want to meet friendly people,</b></p>
<p><b>Check out our web site for more information. <br> <a href="http://www.MinglingInAtlanta.com">www.MinglingInAtlanta.com</a></b></p>
<p><b>No membership fee.</b></p>
<p><b>You have just joined a great group of friendly and fun people. &nbsp;Check out our calendar of events and RSVP. &nbsp;If you have any questions, please feel free to ask. &nbsp; Do you want to get out of the house, try new things and new places, and have a lot of fun while meeting other great people? &nbsp;This group welcomes everyone looking to expand their social and professional circles. We will hold different types of social events throughout the month designed to introduce you to friends in your age range.&nbsp; <br>Many folks just join a ton of meetup groups and actually never attend a meetup. Many don't attend due to fear of the unknown, anxiety, don't like showing up alone in a room full of new people. <br>We've all been there. The hardest part is getting in your car to go. I've had people tell me they sat in their cars for 10 minutes anxious to get out and walk into the meetup. But once they do, the realize it's not a big deal and everyone is there for the same reason - to make new friends. It's like anything else, if you don't take the first step, you might just miss out on the journey. <br> <br></b></p>
<p><b>So if you are ready to attend your first Meetup - make 2016 the year for you to resolve and get out to make new friends. In over 8 years, I have seen friendships, marriages and new jobs all stem from meetup. It's a great social tool - but only if you use it! <br>Come join the fun!I look forward to meeting you soon!Larry <br></b></p>
<p><b>We hope to See you soon!!!</b></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">24728 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Black Vegan Life™" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Black Vegan Life<strong>™</strong>&nbsp;Meetup is a place for people of color and their friends to meet other vegans and aspiring vegans in the Atlanta area. We began in November of 2014 and have hosted over 500 activities and events.</p><p><br></p><p>Download the FREE Black Vegan Life Guide to Self-Care here: https://lp.constantcontactpages.com/su/T5BrGMS/blackveganlife and visit our website for more information at blackveganlife.org.</p><p><br></p><p>Each month you will have the opportunity to participate in anywhere between 2-10 events. Events typically take place in Atlanta and the surrounding areas; some are even virtual, allowing you to participate from home. We support vegan restaurants and events geared toward black culture, compassion and wellness. We hope you will join us!</p><p><br></p><p>Download the Meetup app on your phone for easy communication, particularly during events where we need to find each other.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>Some events have the risk of physical injury. It is your responsibility to only attend events you are physically able to participate in. Black Vegan Life<strong>™</strong> and its organizers may not be held responsible for injuries at any events.</p><p><br></p><p>We hope you will join us as we continue to grow and form an amazing vegan community.</p><p><br></p><p>We look forward to seeing you soon!</p><p><br></p><p>Trish&nbsp;</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">4646 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Are you interested in exploring the world, but uncertain about where to start or who to go with? Find travel mates in our community!</p><p>We are pleased to welcome you to The Atlanta GA Travel Community, powered by YouTravel.me! At our community, we use a laid-back approach to small group travel that feels more like exploring the world with old friends than anything else. Our less-restricting itineraries mean spontaneous, fun-filled opportunities to capture the best of what every spot along the way has to offer.</p><p>Join our community! https://youtravel.me/Meetup-ATL</p><p>Our community of travelers gathers travelers from across the globe to join forces with like-minded people to experience new cultures, views, and let themselves be surprised by what they find.</p><p>12,191 adventures</p><p>103 destinations</p><p>3,475 travel experts</p><p>39 travel styles</p><p>OUR MISSION</p><p>YouTravel.me's mission is to make the world's destinations available through a quick click. As part of our efforts to sustain local economies and workforces, we work with local guides. To make the trip convenient and hassle-free for solo travelers, we have a team of travel experts to help them team up in groups.</p><p>OUR STORY</p><p>This all started from our own experience</p><p>The founders of YouTravel.me, Olga and Ivan, have always traveled on their own and visited more than 35 countries, planning detailed itineraries with visits to secret and undiscovered places. But everything changed one day. They faced all the disadvantages that could be on the trip: flight delay, the guide's endless deceptions, who also took advantage of the fact that they did not know the Chinese language. After returning from the worst trip of their lives, they started looking for a service that collects interesting itineraries for travelers to use next time. There was no such service.</p><p>This is how the dream was born - to make services, where everyone can find a unique journey for themselves, meet new friends, and experience local flavors.</p><p>Now there are 50+ people working at YouTravel.me, making thousands of travelers happy. We truly believe; 'an adventure is the soul of traveling and passion is the key to enthusiasm.'</p><p>TOGETHER, LET'S EXPLORE THE WORLD!</p><p>Check out https://youtravel.me/Meetup-ATL for your next adventure!</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">450 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; We will join to have events which will include featured artist, open mics, singers, and poetry slams. Lesbian Language welcomes all whether you would like to come and enjoy in the audience, if you are a spoken word artist, or even a first timer to the mic will be welcomed with artistic arms. All forms of poetry are welcomed whether it is militant, erotic, or empowering. All ages and ethnicities are welcomed. Please feel free to invite any creative lesbians you may know. Also please join our Facebook page at <a class="linkified" href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/841691945924768/">https://www.facebook.com/groups/841691945924768/</a></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">1268 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Roswell Photography Workshops" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>This is a group for anyone interested in location portrait photography. Most meetups will include models and will require a model fee plus an entrance fee for locations that require them.&nbsp; Every effort will be made to keep cost down. With that in mind, <b>tips for the Models are strongly encouraged!</b>&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p>Our goal is provide photographers with an opportunity to photograph portraits in great locations at a reasonable price.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p>It is designed for photographers of all skills. Assistance will be available for those who require it, however; intermediate and advanced photographers will find this group beneficial for expanding portfolios, meeting new people and to just have some fun.</p>
<p>Activity in the group is strongly encouraged.&nbsp; If you are joining this group to find new locations or new models, you're in the wrong group.&nbsp;From time to time I will download the member list, and review member activity.&nbsp; Inactive members will be removed.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p>We hope you will be an active participant in Roswell Photography Workshops.</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">633 members · Private<button tabindex="0" aria-label="Only members of this group can see its full content, including details about its members and events. <p><b><i>As a progressive Christian community our purpose is to nurture spiritual growth and transformation. In our community we have no dogma, no creed, and no judgement. &lt;br&gt;</i></b></p> 
<p><b><i>If you are seeking a spiritual home, a place where uncertainty and doubts are welcome, a place where one's faith is a journey and not a destination, then join us and let our home become your home. </i></b></p> 
<p><b><i> &lt;br&gt;No matter where you are on life's journey you are welcome here!</i></b></p>

display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="LANGUAGE EXCHANGE ATLANTA" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Like Languages? We do too! Do you want to improve your English or learn/practice a foreign language and have the opportunity for language exchange? Regular practice is the key! Join us at this helpful multi-cultural language exchange meeting organized every other Sunday from 4:30pm to 6:30pm to brush up on a foreign language, learn some key sentences before traveling abroad or to make friends. Members split into smaller practice groups to improve their Spanish, French, German, English, Portuguese, Korean, Chinese and the list goes on! You can also help other members to improve in your native language and learn your culture! &nbsp;We're a diverse language club that meets for fun language and cultural events! Join us if you're into enhancing your language skills and making friends from all over the world. &nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p>Also, if you are interested in preparing for the TOEFL or IELTS exams, I am a certified English teacher.&nbsp; &nbsp;I can prepare you for the reading, writing, speaking, and listening parts of the exams.&nbsp; These you can arrange with me individually.</p>
<p><b>Meetup Rules:&nbsp;</b></p>
<p>1. Members are responsible to find and check in with us as soon as they arrive.</p>
<p>2. We provide a safe and comfortable environment; Sexual harrassment, rude or inapropiate social behaviour won't be tolerated&nbsp;</p>
<p>- We&nbsp;REMOVE&nbsp;members that break our rules, are rude, aggressive or socially inappropriate towards our members. -&nbsp;</p>
<p>&lt;br&gt;</p>
<p>Arabic, Chinese, Dutch, English, French, Farsi, German, Greek, Hebrew, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish and more.</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">2806 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; <p>We look forward to meeting you, soon! <br></p>
<p>--------------</p>
<p><b><i>"If life were to come with a manual, this in my opinion would be it! If we all applied the Inner Engineering technology, our world would instantly transform to exist from a foundation of peace, joy, and compassion for all beings." &nbsp;-Evita Ochel</i>&nbsp;</b>&nbsp; &nbsp; <br></p>
<p>For&nbsp;all of the strides we have made in science and technology with standards of living unimaginable a century ago, most human beings still remain in search of wholeness and purpose in their lives. &nbsp;<a href="http://www.ishausa.org/programs/inner-engineering/?webSyncID=6366b7b5-2e57-b99d-a0d9-8144b41a2963&amp;sessionGUID=978454c1-093a-d3e1-8b9c-608859c3457e">Inner Engineering</a>&nbsp;is scientifically-structured to offer&nbsp;powerful processes from the ancient tradition of yoga&nbsp;to transcend the limitations of who you are and bring you to higher levels of consciousness. &nbsp;&nbsp;Inner Engineering was designed by<b> Sadhguru, a yogi, visionary, and one the foremost authorities on yoga as a powerful tool to create your life the way you want it. &nbsp;</b> <br></p>
<p> <br></p>
<p><a class="embedded" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hUeyqLTsGJs">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hUeyqLTsGJs</a></p>
<p><b>Sadhguru &amp; Deepak Chopra— Creating Inner Peace, Joy and Fulfillment in a Hectic Modern World</b> <br></p>
<p>"The word 'yoga' means union, that means you experience the entire universe as yourself...by working with the body, by working with the mind, by working with your emotion and energy, you can setup a step-by- step system within yourself where your energies are kept at such a level of exuberance that your sensory body is as large as the universe...Once you experience everybody around you as yourself... your goodness is a consequence, not an effort."</p>
<p><a class="embedded" href="https://youtu.be/WMhJgdpj1d0">https://youtu.be/WMhJgdpj1d0</a></p>
<p><b>About Sadhguru</b>—Sadhguru is a realized yogi and mystic – a man whose passion spills into everything he encounters. With a keen mind, balanced by a heart that knows no boundary, his presence and powerful yoga programs create an extraordinary opportunity to break through limitations into one’s natural state of freedom, love and joy.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Sadhguru has a unique ability to make the ancient science of yoga relevant to contemporary minds. Sadhguru serves as a bridge to the deeper dimensions of life. His approach does not ascribe to any belief system, but offers methods for self-transformation that are both proven and powerful.</p>
<p>An author, poet and internationally renowned speaker, Sadhguru’s wit and piercing logic provoke and broaden our thoughts and perception of the meaning of life, the very purpose of life. Sadhguru has been an influential voice at major global forums including the UN, MIT, TED, and the World Economic Forum.</p>
<p>Sadhguru established Isha Foundation, a non-profit organization supported by over two million volunteers worldwide. From powerful yoga programs and meditation practices to large-scale humanitarian projects, the foundation’s activities are designed to create an inclusive culture and establish global harmony, earning a special consultative status with the United Nations.</p>
<p><b> <br></b></p>
<p><b>Sadhguru at Emory University—&nbsp;</b>&nbsp;"Consciousness and living well are not in conflict with each other... &nbsp;"</p>
<p><a class="embedded" href="https://youtu.be/FVdDwS0ijU4">https://youtu.be/FVdDwS0ijU4</a></p>
<p><b>------------------</b> <br></p>
<p><b>Isha&nbsp;Kriya Guided Meditation</b>—Jump Right In... Learn to Meditate NOW! <br></p>
<p>These 1-hour guided meditation sessions offer a simple, but powerful&nbsp;<i>kriya&nbsp;</i>practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to elevate your conscious awareness and easily and naturally achieve a state of deep meditation. Once you are meditative on a daily basis, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much richer. <b>Daily meditation makes your life stress-free, effortless and joyful!</b> <br></p>
<p>You can&nbsp;easily learn this 12-to-18 minute&nbsp;Isha&nbsp;Kriya process in a convenient, online meditation class, or through a live,&nbsp;free meditation class near you. &nbsp;Our online formats include our streaming guided meditation video, the Isha Kriya meditation app (for iphone &amp; android devices), and weekly webinars hosted by trained teachers who can answer your questions about the practice. &nbsp;Local sessions are hosted regularly to enhance and deepen the experience of meditation with the group.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Benefits of regular Isha Kriya meditation practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Isha&nbsp;Kriya&nbsp;is a simple, gentle guided meditation that can be done seated cross-legged on the floor or sitting in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.</p>
<p><a class="embedded" href="https://youtu.be/q8NYZdYd5GQ">https://youtu.be/q8NYZdYd5GQ</a></p>
<p> <b>Take a &nbsp;Deeper Step...Create a Life of Total Wellbeing—</b></p>
<p><b><i>“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma. It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve--just have to learn to use... &nbsp;Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” –Sadhguru&nbsp;</i>&nbsp; <br></b></p>
<p><b>Inner Engineering&nbsp;is&nbsp;</b><b>a 7-session online course </b>that&nbsp;gives you the opportunity to intellectually explore the ABC’s of life using methods that are the distilled essence of yogic sciences. The course imparts practical wisdom to manage your body, mind, emotions, and the fundamental life energy within.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Program components include:</p>
<p>•&nbsp;Enlightening interactive sessions</p>
<p>•&nbsp;Guided meditations</p>
<p>•&nbsp;<i>Asanas</i>, simple yoga postures.</p>
<p>•&nbsp;<b>Shambhavi Mahamudra, a powerful , 21-minute inner-energy technique that brings your entire system into alignment so that your body, mind, emotions and energies function in harmony.</b></p>
<p><a class="embedded" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&amp;v=ooFAmT4n89Y">https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&amp;v=ooFAmT4n89Y</a></p>
<p><b>**<a href="https://www.innerengineering.com/online/testimonials">Live Reviews from Inner Engineering Participants&nbsp;</a>**</b> <br></p>
<p><b>------------------</b></p>
<p><b>The Isha Institute of Inner-sciences</b>&nbsp;is a breathtaking mountain retreat for stress relief, rejuvenation, and complete inner well-being. The retreat offers yoga in its purest form, through experiential classical yoga and meditation classes, and powerfully energized meditation spaces such as the Adi Yogi: The Abode of Yoga. &nbsp; <br></p>
<p><a class="embedded" href="https://youtu.be/RpXEcB5uhZc">https://youtu.be/RpXEcB5uhZc</a></p>
<p><b>A Serene Mountain Getaway to Learn Classical Yoga: <br></b>Relax and rejuvenate at the Isha yoga retreat—</p>
<p>The Isha Institute of Inner-sciences is a world-class yoga center offering classical yoga and meditation classes from beginner to advanced levels. Guests journey from around the globe to visit this unique destination to relax, reflect, and reconnect with nature in this tranquil oasis nestled in Tennessee’s spectacular Upper Cumberland.</p>
<p><b><i>Drop-by for&nbsp;a&nbsp;Day Visit</i></b></p>
<p>The Isha retreat center offers campus tours daily that include light hikes to one of many beautiful bluff vistas or waterfalls and a visit inside <i>Mahima, </i>the largest yoga and meditation hall in the western hemisphere!&nbsp;Several free yoga classes and guided meditation sessions are available each day. &nbsp;Inquire with the main office for details.</p>
<p><b><i>Hiking and Mountain&nbsp;Biking on Pristine Forested Trails</i></b></p>
<p>The Isha retreat center also offers myriad opportunities for hiking and mountain biking on forested trails winding throughout nearly 1400 acres. The center's five miles of mountain biking trails have been professionally classified from beginner to intermediate skill levels, with steep climbs, water features, and tight switchbacks on the more challenging portions. The trails are part of an expanding network of over 15 miles of hiking and biking trails featuring beautiful waterfalls, a meandering spring-fed creek, and breathtaking bluff overlooks.</p>
<p><b><i>Relaxation &amp; Wellness Retreats</i></b></p>
<p>Overnight stays include the option of private studio accommodations, delicious vegetarian buffet meals, and&nbsp;beginner-level yoga classes of the visitor`s choice, such as the 'yoga of sound', yoga for strengthening the joints, and yoga for purifying life energies.&nbsp; Extended retreat packages feature Ayurvedic rejuvenation consultations and therapies; guided hikes and adventure outings to nearby caves, rivers and falls; and even cooking classes to bring home some of your favorite vegetarian delights! &nbsp;Learn how to mix the pungent, tangy spices of the East, culture farm-fresh milk into yogurt, roll vegetarian sushi, or bake homemade sourdough bread in the Isha center's popular, international kitchen.</p>
<p>For over 30 years, Isha Institute programs have offered the immense benefits of classical yoga and meditation to over&nbsp;7 million people around the globe. For further details on the Isha retreat center and the programs offered, visit<a href="http://www.ishausa.org/blog">&nbsp;IshaUSA.org.</a></p>
<p><b>Visit us online...</b></p>

inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">This Meetup group is about an open hearted sharing of spiritual experiences that people from all religious backgrounds and all walks of life have and may not understand.
Have you had a vivid dream that helped you understand a difficult problem? Have you had a dream with a loved one who has passed away and wondered if that was real? Have you had an out-of-body experience or an experience with inner light or sound? Have you had an extraordinary experience of Divine Love?
As members of the local ECKANKAR community, we will share tools and techniques, such as chanting HU, to help you understand these experiences and navigate your own journey back to home to God. Some basic beliefs we hold are: *You are Soul. You exist because God loves you.* And, *animals are Soul, too.*
We will help you develop skills to discover your own answers to your inner and outer experiences. You have the God knowledge within you as a Divine spark of the creator. We all walk our own path back home to God. Here, you can meet others who are making the journey.

Sponsored by Georgia Satsang Society, a chartered Affiliate of Eckankar—The Path of Spiritual Freedom.

Jung Society of Atlanta serves to provide a place of community for those of us drawn to the ideas of Carl Jung. It offers an opportunity, both individually and communally, to gain a broader and deeper understanding of ourselves as part of a larger story, a larger purpose. In listening to others' stories, others' metaphors, we develop clarity and meaning about our own extraordinary journey.</p>
<p>Welcome to exploring the larger story, the metaphors and meanings as we share our journeys.</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">296 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; We come together every third Saturday for a nature hike on one of the many beautiful hiking trails located throughout the metro Atlanta area. On occasion we will stop to meditate, explore historic sites, walk labyrinths, do forest bathing, take day trips, and more. 

Join us for the opportunity to be at one with the healing energy of nature, while communing with your fellow trekkers. 

Whether you are a newbie or an experienced hiker. All are welcome.

There are no fees or dues to join this group.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">40 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Newnan Paddlers" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>If you're a paddler and looking for kayak or canoe paddlers in the Central Georgia, East Alabama area that want to get out on our local waterways as well as an occasional extended canoe and kayak trip. This is open to paddlers of all levels from flat water to whitewater enthusiast. If you've ever watched others out enjoying our many lakes and rivers from their kayak/or canoe, and wanted to join in this is for you. All we ask is that you have a boat and are willing to be an active participant.</p> 
<p>&lt;br&gt;</p> 
<p>Safety is our number one priority. With that in mind we have a few common sense rules as follow. 1) Group members must wear coast guard approved PFD at all times while on the water participating in a Newnan Paddlers Meetup event. 2') Members must agree to follow the instructions of the event leader at all times. 3) In Class III rated water or higher members must wear helmets. 4) Members agree to dress appropriately and will bring dry clothing in the event of getting wet. 5)Members take personal responsibility for their safety and Newnan Paddlers Meetup, trip leaders and organizers are not responsible for any injuries that may occur during meetup events. 6) Members recognize the inherent dangers involved in paddle sports. 7)By being a member you agree to the above terms.</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">737 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; The Blue Knights is an international motorcycle organization of and for law enforcement professionals. You must be in law enforcement (full-time; part-time; reserves; retired) to be a member of this group. If you are not a member of the Blue Knights GA XVI and you are a law enforcement professional (federal, city, state, military, tribal, county etc), be sure to mention in your message. If you are a current Blue Knight member, please mention that as well. display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlantic Station/Midtown Book Club" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Welcome to the Atlantic Station/Midtown Book Club! We're a book club that has been around since October of 2017.&nbsp;I know that this group has an intimidating number of people in it - please note that most meetings, on average, tend to be from 4 - 6 people ), so it is still an intimate place to discuss the book of the month.</p><p>We try to read a variety of genres, as you can see from the above. Please join if you love discussing books! At our monthly meeting, we decide/vote as a group on what book we're going to read in the following month.&nbsp;Bring your ideas to the meeting.</p><p>To give you an idea of what we read, please see the below list of past books:&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>A Deadly Education by Naomi Novik</p><p>Hamnet by Maggie O'Farrell</p><p>Outlawed by Anna North</p><p>Binti Trilogy by Nnedi Okorafor</p><p>The Water Dancer by Ta-Nehisi Coats</p><p>The Vanishing Half by Brit Bennett</p><p>Red Rising, Golden Son, and Morning Star by Pierce Brown</p><p>Where the Crawdads Sing by Delia Owens</p><p>American Gods by Niel Gaiman</p><p>My Grandmother Asked Me to Tell You She's Sorry by Fredrik Backman</p><p>Talking to Strangers by Malcolm Gladwell</p><p>The Murder of Roger Ackroyd by Agatha Christie&nbsp;</p><p>Of Bees and Mist by&nbsp;Erick Setiawan</p><p>Long Bright River by Liz Moore</p><p>City of Brass by&nbsp;S. A. Chakraborty</p><p>Starship Troopers by Robert Heinlien</p><p>Bringing Ragnorak by Andrew Tanner</p><p>Devil in the White City by Eric Larson&nbsp;</p><p>The Gifted School by Bruce Holsinger&nbsp;</p><p>Dark Matter by Blake Crouch&nbsp;</p><p>The Little Paris Bookshop by Nina Georgia&nbsp;</p><p>The Road by Cormac McCarthy&nbsp;</p><p>The Weight of Ink by Rachel Kadish&nbsp;</p><p>Mirage, a Novel by Somaiya Daud&nbsp;</p><p>Underground Airlines by Ben Winters&nbsp;</p><p>Children of Time by Adrian Tchaikovsky&nbsp;</p><p>In the Garden of Beasts by Erik Larson&nbsp;</p><p>Never Let Me Go by Kazuo Ishiguro&nbsp;</p><p>The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society by Mary Ann Shaffer and Annie Barrows&nbsp;</p><p>Children of Blood and Bone by Toni Adeymi&nbsp;</p><p>Prisoner of Birth by Jeffery Archer&nbsp;</p><p>Bone in the Throat by Anthony Bourdain&nbsp;</p><p>A Perfect Piece by Daniel Black&nbsp;</p><p>The Immortalists by Chloe Benjamin&nbsp;</p><p>The Alice Network by Alice Quinn&nbsp;</p><p>Americanah by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie&nbsp;</p><p>Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury&nbsp;</p><p>Artemis by Andy Weir&nbsp;</p><p>A Thousand Acres by Jane Smiley&nbsp;</p><p>Do Androids Dream in Electronic Sheep by Phillip K. Dick</p><p>&lt;br&gt;</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">216 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; Would you like to study the text along with others? If so, this meetup might be for you. Each week we will listen to a section of a chapter and then discuss the material and share relevant experiences. Please prepare ahead by reading the designated chapter. I am not trained facilitator nor a Course Teacher, rather a fellow learner like you, who strives to follow the teachings of The Course and desires to meet other "brothers" interested in the same. Let's walk the path together as happy learners. Our group was founded in December, 2016. All meetings are currently online only.</p><p><br></p><p>If you need to purchase the book, "A Course in Miracles - Combined Volume", you can find it at the <a href="https://shop.acim.org/collections/english" target="_blank">ACIM Online Store</a>. You can also view the <a href="https://acim.org/acim/en" target="_blank">book online</a> at The Foundation for Inner Peace's website.</p><p><br></p><p>If you're brand new to The Course and feel you need some insights, the following resources are helpful:</p><p>• "<a href="http://www.cynthiamorgan.us/aciwpodcast" target="_blank">A Course in What?</a>" podcasts by Cynthia Morgan</p><p>•&nbsp;"<a href="https://read.amazon.com/kp/embed?asin=B00DJ736RK&amp;preview=newtab&amp;linkCode=kpe&amp;ref_=cm_sw_r_kb_dp_SX3Izb2TKEEEG" target="_blank">The Disappearance of the Universe</a>" by Gary Renard</p><p>•&nbsp;"<a href="https://read.amazon.com/kp/embed?asin=B0143QG4QK&amp;preview=newtab&amp;linkCode=kpe&amp;ref_=cm_sw_r_kb_dp_TY3Izb6GZ5B0A" target="_blank">A Course in Miracles Made Easy</a>" by Alan Cohen</p><p>• YouTube <a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClXYpldD7anfL-Kvm9N4RGg" target="_blank">videos by The Foundation for Inner Peace</a> (start with "The Real World", parts 1-10)</p><p>• <a href="https://acim.org/events/" target="_blank">Webinars</a> by the Foundation for Inner Peace (acim.org)</p><p><br></p><p>Note: Because of this Meetup's membership level, the group is limited to 50 members. From time to time it may be necessary for me to remove members that have never attended a meeting in order to make room for new members that would like to attend. If you are removed, I apologize. You are welcome to rejoin if you decide you would like to start attending. <p>Join our group in sharing and discovering new ways of expressing your creative spirit. First in-person regular meetings are generally free for you to check things out. Come join us, we are always looking for new claymates!</p>
<p>For more details check out our website <a href="http://gapcg.org">www.gapcg.org</a></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">374 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Shut Up &amp; Write!® Smyrna / Marietta" data-testid="next-image" src="https://secure-content.meetupstatic.com/images/classic-events/485647649/178x178.jpg?w=178?w=384" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" srcset="https://secure-content.meetupstatic.com/images/classic-events/485647649/178x178.jpg?w=178?w=256 1x, https://secure-content.meetupstatic.com/images/classic-events/485647649/178x178.jpg?w=178?w=384 2x" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Shut Up &amp; Write!® Smyrna / Marietta</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Smyrna, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Shut Up &amp; Write!® Smyrna / Marietta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>For more virtual events, join our Online Events Meetup here:&nbsp;<a href="https://www.meetup.com/shutupandwriteonlineevents/">https://www.meetup.com/shutupandwriteonlineevents/</a>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Shut Up &amp; Write!® is more than a movement, more than a good idea. We’re a method of writing that delivers. As an international organization, we are thousands of writers in a worldwide community, but most importantly, we are writers who write together in a local cafe. Join us.</p>
<p>We have events every week, all over. Sometimes we talk after. Whatever you’re writing, whatever form it takes, wherever you are in your process, you won’t be the only one.</p>
<p>And if you need help with your writing, we offer that too.</p>
<p>Want to know more? Check us out: www.shutupwrite.com. Or get in touch: questions@shutupwrite.com.</p>
<p><b>Meetup Event Format</b></p>
<p>It is an empowering and rewarding experience to write an hour each week, at the same time and place. It serves as powerful support for building your daily writing discipline.</p>
<p>RSVP and please arrive 10–15 minutes early to get settled. At the Meetup our Organizer will lead introductions and then everyone will sit down and write.</p>
<p>Afterwards, feel free to get to know each other. Members often talk about their successes and challenges as writers. The Shut Up &amp; Write!® format brings a social facet to a normally isolated craft.</p>
<p>Our Meetups are a safe space for writers to work on their craft. No one will read or critique your writing.</p>
<p>“Writing is the only thing that, when I do it, I don't feel I should be doing something else.“ - Gloria Steinem</p>
<p>This is your time to write.</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">223 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; </svg></div></div></div></button></div></div></a></div></div><div class="w-full"><div data-testid="group-card" class="py-3 border-t border-gray3 bg-white cursor-pointer flex flex-col"><a class="flex hover:no-underline" data-element-name="-groupCard" id="group-card-in-search-results" href="https://www.meetup.com/Decatur-Women-s-Book-Club/"><div class="d1xev8qx mr-4 relative hidden sm:block"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Decatur Women´s Book Club</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Decatur, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Decatur Women´s Book Club" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Are you&nbsp;looking for&nbsp;a women's book club where the members&nbsp;love to read, talk and&nbsp;share a laugh or two about books? <strong>Join us!</strong> The purpose of this group is simple -&nbsp;we read books and we discuss them.&nbsp;Once a month we meet at a local restaurant and enjoy&nbsp;a couple of hours away from the family discussing a book we've read&nbsp;with other fun and interesting women.&nbsp;&nbsp;You'll see&nbsp;as you browse&nbsp;books we've read and books we'll be reading, we have an eclectic reading list with one thing at its center - members like you who enjoy reading a variety of books and discussing them with&nbsp;women you enjoy meeting with each month, sharing your thoughts and laughter.</p><p>Although we ask for RSVPs so we'll know how many seats to ask for at the restaurant if there is a wait list for a scheduled meeting put yourself down and plan to come anyway - we always have room for extras!</p><p>There are many book clubs and venues in Atlanta for&nbsp;socializing and if all you want to do is drink and socialize we encourage you&nbsp;to join one of these&nbsp;groups instead of our book club.&nbsp;As noted, our focus is to discuss books which&nbsp;in and of itself will be a social activity.&nbsp;Also, there are many book clubs and venues in Atlanta for&nbsp;writers to discuss writing.  Book club members and individuals sending solicitations to read or promote their books&nbsp;please&nbsp;kindly remember we are not a&nbsp;forum for members who&nbsp;are authors to read or promote their books nor a forum for non-members who are authors to read or promote their books.  Thank you.</p><p><img src="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/2/8/c/9/event_42790441.jpeg" height="173" width="215" style="margin : 5px ; max-width : 700px ; max-height : 700px"></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">1390 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta Movie Club" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><span>This is a group for everyone who loves and enjoys movies. We mainly focus on independent and foreign movies but not exclusively. O</span><span>ur meetings take place at movie theaters such as Midtown Art Cinema, Tara, Springs Cinema &amp; Taphouse, etc. &nbsp;We certainly meet for dinner and conversation before or after the movie. <br></span></p>
<p><span>We generally announce events weekly on Tuesday or Wednesday as that is when the theaters we watch movies in make their weekend schedules public. <br></span></p>
<p><span>This is also a&nbsp;</span><span>social group and we hold activities such as bar trivia, bowling, karaoke, lunch, coffee, etc. All ages and backgrounds are welcome!&nbsp;</span><span>I am truly a movie fan and hope people alike join this group. We welcome and encourage new members, I hope all movie aficionados can find a place in this group.&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span>Now the not so fun part. I will be enforcing a profile picture rule, therefore I will ask everyone to have a picture of their face in order to join or stay in the group. The RSVP policy is that you should un-RSVP if you can't come to the meetup, this will prevent me looking at the door and waiting for you outside the theater or wherever. If you're a no show without notice two times or more, you will get a warning and after that be removed from the group. We have a ZERO TOLERANCE policy towards bad behavior. Please treat everyone with respect, as you would like others to treat you.<br></span></p>
<p><span>I hope we can enjoy fun times and great movies together. Hope to see you at our next meetup!</span></p>
<p><span>Gopi.</span></p>

All are welcome regardless of background or belief. There are no group membership dues or fees and donations will not be accepted.</p><p><br></p><p>About us:</p><p><br></p><p>Inspired by similar meetup groups across the country, we have started our own group here in Decatur as an act of service to our community with the goal of creating (with your help!) a space for deeper conversation, connection, reflection, and action. Individuals of all ages, backgrounds, and beliefs gather together each week to explore uplifting (and sometimes challenging) topics and to engage respectfully and civilly in elevated conversations, inquiry, consultation, and mutual learning. Using short selections from the Bahá'í teachings as a starting point, we hope to grow together and learn from one another as we seek to build bridges of unity and respect for all humanity.</p><p><br></p><p>Please note: attendees under the age of 18 must have a guardian with them.</p><p><br></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">508 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; Tired of the blank stares you get from your non-art friends when you talk about your creative challenges?</p> 
<p>The Atlanta Illustrators &amp; Makers Group is for you! </p> 
<p>Foster friendships and meet some like-minded Atlanta artists and makers of all kinds to collaborate, commiserate, and create!</p> 
<p>This group meets every other Sunday for low-key hangouts, drawing sessions, and discussions on all things creative.</p>

You’ll have the opportunity to meet local founders and investors, exchange ideas with experts, get feedback on your idea, participate in startup workshops, and more.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Typical startup event topics include:&lt;br&gt;• Coming up with a strong startup idea&lt;br&gt;• Startup legal basics&lt;br&gt;• How to pitch your startup&lt;br&gt;• Starting a company without quitting your day job&lt;br&gt;• How to raise funding for your startup&lt;br&gt;• And much more!&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Join the group to be invited to our next event!</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">6242 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; We are always looking for the best places to eat gluten free in the Atlanta area. We have more options now than ever before as restaurants learn how to accommodate a gluten free diet. The options for us grow every year! Things we thought we couldn’t have anymore (pizza, pasta, Asian cuisine, even fried food!) have once again become part of our diets. A great resource is our Discussion Board where you can join in a discussion on a gluten free topic or ask a question.</p>
