**A good resource for beginners is&nbsp;[StudyBuddhism.com](http://studybuddhism.com/)**

**Coronavirus Info Last Updated March 20, 2022**

**IN-PERSON MEDITATION AND BUDDHIST EVENTS HAVE RESUMED AT THE FOLLOWING GROUPS:**

* **Atlanta Pure Land Association Mietoville Academy:** Mindful Chanting Service every Sunday at 9am - 12pm
* **Roswell Insight Meditation Community**: Small group meditation every Monday at 7pm (also Zoom)
* **Buddhanara Temple:** Small group meditation every Saturday at 9am
* **Georgia Buddhist Vihara:** Vipassana (Insight) meditation and Theravada sutta study, every Saturday at 9am (also Zoom)
* **Emory Buddhist Club**: All welcome for guided meditation and discussion every Thursday at 6pm, both in person at Cannon Chapel 106 on Emory University main campus (free parking) or on Zoom
* **Jun Dung Sa Temple**: Small group online Zen meditation and discussion, Saturdays at 5pm
* **Atlanta Shambhala Center**: Open house meditation Sundays at 10am
* **Wat Dhammakaya Georgia Meditation Circle**: Wednesday nights at 7pm
* **AtlantaBuddhism.org Sunday Zen Meditation at Bao Chi Temple**: Sundays at 3:45pm (new!)

**ONLINE ONLY at these groups:**

* Dharma Jewel Monastery Atlanta Zen Meditation Center \| Drepung Loseling Monastery \| Atlanta Insight Meditation Community \| Kim Cang Monastery \| Dharma Drum Mountain Atlanta \| Elder Care \| Mahamevnawa Meditation Center \| Emory\-Tibet Week \| Atlanta Buddhism Association \| America Dhamma Society Pa\-Auk Tawya Vipassanadhura Hermitage Georgia \| Sandy Springs Insight Meditation \(at UU Northwest Universalist Unitarian church\)

Atlanta local group live virtual meetings! All welcome to join online.

**Daily, either in the morning or evening**:&nbsp;Compassion Meditation with Cognitively Based Compassion Therapy (Emory-Tibet Partnership CBCT)
[https://www.compassion.emory.edu/cbct-daily-practice.html](https://www.compassion.emory.edu/cbct-daily-practice.html)

**Mondays at 7pm**: Roswell Insight Meditation Community, meets at UUMAN church
[http://www.roswellinsightmeditation.org/](http://www.roswellinsightmeditation.org/) (in person and Zoom)

**First Tuesday at 5:30pm:**&nbsp;Medicine Buddha Puja with Tibetan Buddhist monks
[http://www.drepung.org](http://www.drepung.org)

**Tuesdays at 6:30pm**:&nbsp;Public Buddhist Teaching with Drepung Loseling Monastery
[https://livestream.com/accounts/7116288](https://livestream.com/accounts/7116288)

**Wednesdays at 7pm**:&nbsp;Sandy Springs Insight Meditation group meditation and discussion
https://sandyspringsinsightmeditation.org/

**Wednesdays at 7pm**: Dhammakaya with Meditation Circle:

**Thursdays at 6pm:**&nbsp;Guided Meditation with Emory Buddhist Club&nbsp;
[https://emory.zoom.us/j/515025945](https://emory.zoom.us/j/515025945)&nbsp;&nbsp;(in person also available)

**Fridays at 8pm**: What Would Guan Yin Do - Buddhism in Modern Life through Exploring the Lotus Sutra, hosted by Georgia Buddhist Summer Camp in collaboration with Berkeley Buddhist Monastery / Dharma Realm Buddhist University
Register at [http://www.georgiabuddhistcamp.com](http://www.georgiabuddhistcamp.com)

**Saturdays at 9am**: Vipassana meditation with Georgia Buddhist Vihara&nbsp;
In person for vaccinated people, or on Zoom:
https://zoom.us/j/99758531863?pwd=UXhQcmxIekIwQTE4Z1JBMFRyQUIrQT09
Meeting ID: 997 5853 1863
Passcode: 906250

**Sundays at 10am**:&nbsp;Shambhala Atlanta virtual open house&nbsp;&nbsp;
atlanta.shambhala.org

**Sundays at 11am:**&nbsp;Guided Meditation with Drepung Loseling Monastery Atlanta&nbsp;
[https://livestream.com/accounts/7116288](https://livestream.com/accounts/7116288)

**Online Live Buddhist Classes from around the Country in English:**

**Berkeley Buddhist Monastery goes online:**
Morning and Evening Prayer, Mindful Recitation, Chanting of Mantras and Sutras, Zen Meditation, and Bowing Practices
Daily 8am - 10pm (Eastern) via YouTube Live (DharmaRealmLive) and Zoom
[http://www.berkeleymonastery.org/](http://www.berkeleymonastery.org/)

Chanting, Meditation, and Sutta Study
**Wednesdays at 10pm** (Eastern) , and
**Saturdays at 1pm** (Eastern) : How Do you apply the Dharma to This?!
via Zoom with American Buddhist bhikkuni (nuns) in the Theravada Buddhist (Pali-based) tradition from Karuna Buddhist Vihara in California
[http://www.karunabv.org/](http://www.karunabv.org/)

Daily Evening Pujas (Theravada / Pali tradition)
**Daily at 10pm** (Eastern) plus Extended Dhamma Talk on Saturdays,&nbsp;via Youtube Live
Every day (except the day after monthly lunar observance day) American Buddhist monks following the Thai Forest tradition of Ajahn Chah lead evening recitation and chanting of Buddhist texts in English, and silent meditation, from Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery in California
[https://www.youtube.com/c/AbhayagiriBuddhistMonastery](https://www.youtube.com/c/AbhayagiriBuddhistMonastery)

The Foundation of Buddhist Practice by His Holiness the Dalai Lama and Venerable Thubten Chodron
**Fridays at 9:15pm** (Eastern)&nbsp;via Livestream
American Buddhist nun Ven. Thubten Chodron teaches Stages on the Path to Awakening (podcast downloads also available) in an online course developed with His Holiness the Dalai Lama
[https://thubtenchodron.org/live/](https://thubtenchodron.org/live/)

**Tibet House US**&nbsp;has unlocked their video archives for free to all during the Covid-19 pandemic. This rich collection features a diversity of talks and topics from various speakers:
[https://tibethouse.us/video-library/](https://tibethouse.us/video-library/)

Find links to more virtual classes and great webcast resources at
[www.sfzen.org/virtualchurch](http://www.sfzen.org/virtualchurch)

**American Buddhist Songs - new release album Good Karma Music**
[http://dharmaradio.org/](http://dharmaradio.org/)

**\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-**
\*\*[MeditateAtlanta.org&nbsp;](http://www.georgiameditation.org/)\*\*Meetup features regular and special events representing various traditions of Buddhist meditation throughout Atlanta, such as Zen, Tibetan Buddhism, Insight / Vipassana Meditation, and Mindfulness Practice. Drop in any week - newcomers welcome! All events below are&nbsp;free, in English, and open to beginners.&nbsp;
![](https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/e/1/b/5/600_454257781.jpeg)Visit [www.georgiameditation.org](http://www.georgiameditation.org) or write us at info [ a t ] georgiameditation [ dot] org ( info@georgiameditation.org ) to get a monthly newsletter!
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
**[AtlantaBuddhism.org](http://georgiameditation.org/index.html)&nbsp;Upcoming Special Events**&nbsp;(free!):

* **Georgia Buddhist Scholarship**&nbsp;-- for students and young adults, including cash prize for high school seniors, as well as awards for use at educational programs such as&nbsp;[Georgia Buddhist Summer Camp](http://www.georgiabuddhistcamp.com/)&nbsp;or retreats at[&nbsp;Dharma Realm Buddhist University](http://www.drbu.org/).
* **Mindfulness Meditation Retreat**, next March 26 2022, 9am - 5pm, at&nbsp;[Kim Cang Monastery](https://www.meetup.com/Atlanta-Buddhism-Events/events/241666043/)
    -&nbsp;**Guan Yin Blessing Ceremony &amp; Lotus Sutra chanting:**&nbsp;Eighty Eight Buddhas Repentance Ceremony, Date TBD 9:15am - 12:15pm, at&nbsp;[Dharma Jewel Monastery](http://www.dharmajewel.us/events)
* **Meditation Practice,** Tai-Chi and exercise, silent sitting and walking sessions,&nbsp;Zen retreat TBD at [Dharma Drum Mountain](http://www.ddmbaatlanta.com)
* **The Diamond of Perfect Wisdom Sutra Service**, cancelled indefinitely, at&nbsp;[Dharma Jewel Monastery](http://www.dharmajewel.us/events)
* **Guan Yin Recitation &amp; Meditation Residential Retreat**&nbsp;at the&nbsp;[City of Ten Thousand Buddhas&nbsp;](http://www.cttbusa.org/)\- Beginner's Track in English available\, application here at&nbsp;[DRBUX](http://www.drbux.org/),&nbsp;in California.
    \-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

**Global Disaster Relief Efforts&nbsp;by Tzu Chi**
Please donate to help those in need from recent hurricanes and fires. One reputable charity to consider is&nbsp;Tzu Chi USA, a Buddhist group helping all in need -- already with $7 million distributed directly to Hurricane Harvey victims in Texas. Visit&nbsp;[TzuChi.us](http://www.tzuchi.us/)

![](https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/e/3/2/600_458703634.jpeg)

**[Dharma Jewel Monastery](http://www.atlantazen.org/),**&nbsp;Zen meditation center in Atlanta, invites you to guided meditation and a sequential weekly fundamental concepts of Buddhism class!&nbsp;Join us on TBD at 6:30pm,&nbsp;all welcome! Classes are led by dedicated Buddhist monastics who have years of meditation experience and rigorous training and devote their entire lives to authentic Zen practice. Courses are offered at no charge. Everyone is welcome. Children's class on weekends. Atlanta! LIVE Smooth Jazz! R&amp;B! Blues! Rock! Funk!</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Tucker, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Tucker! Atlanta! LIVE Smooth Jazz! R&amp;B! Blues! Rock! Funk!" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Hello LIVE MUSIC Fans and Dancing Fans too!!

This group is about Simply Awesome LIVE Music Entertainment gatherings. Social distancing style meetups. Both indoor and outdoor events in our communities with local venues and local musicians.

We are mature adult group of LIVE MUSIC lovers! Jazz! R&amp;B! Blues! Rock! Funk! Oldies! &amp; More!

We want to bring together like-minded souls that appreciate Simply Awesome LIVE Music Entertainment for their listening ear in a safe social distance environment of respect, maturity, and integrity in our local communities. Therapy for the old school soul in us in these crazy challenging times that we are living.

We will enjoy LIVE Music with our local professional musicians and bands with our monthly meetup events in venues that offer social distancing square footage indoor or outdoor.

The COVID-19 pandemic has had a significant impact on the music industry, mirroring its impact across all arts sectors. Numerous music events, including music festivals, concert tours, awards shows and the like were cancelled or postponed.&nbsp;

Our local musicians have suffered a great loss of income. Our meetups will be a way to pay forward to all our musicians, bands and venues who will be helping us to enjoy LIVE MUSIC again in safer environments.

Thank you for your interest.
Ms. LTanya
770.837.7067
www.SimplyAwesomeEntertainment.com
https://www.facebook.com/simplyawesomeentertainment

We offer inspiring workshops and classes, taught in-person and online, designed to build your own direct connection to the Divine and ignite your soul’s potential. We offer programs at every level of interest from free Meetup events and meditations, single workshops to steady ongoing training.</p>
<p>Our mission is to offer clear, practical and high quality spiritual education designed to assist the soul in its spiritual evolution.</p>
<p>Founded in 2005 by Barbara Y. Martin and Dimitri Moraitis, Spiritual Arts Institute is 501(c) (3) tax exempt educational corporation located in Encinitas, CA. The goal of the Institute is to help people from all walks of life accelerate their spiritual understanding and development. It is our aim to help reassign metaphysics to its proper place in the study of life and human development and to inspire confidence, love, self-sufficiency, charity, kindness, creativity, and inner knowing in all aspects of life. (For more info: www.spiritualarts.org)</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">461 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Dancing4fun, Dinner, Dancin &amp; Socializing in Gwinnett Meetup" data-testid="next-image" src="https://secure-content.meetupstatic.com/images/classic-events/495943114/178x178.jpg?w=178?w=384" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" srcset="https://secure-content.meetupstatic.com/images/classic-events/495943114/178x178.jpg?w=178?w=256 1x, https://secure-content.meetupstatic.com/images/classic-events/495943114/178x178.jpg?w=178?w=384 2x" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Dancing4fun, Dinner, Dancin &amp; Socializing in Gwinnett Meetup</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Norcross, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Dancing4fun, Dinner, Dancin &amp; Socializing in Gwinnett Meetup" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><img src="https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/9/8/0/5/event_21938917.jpeg"></p>
<p> Meet other folks in the Gwinnett &amp; metro Atlanta area who just want to go out and have fun dancing!!</p>
<p>Venturing out dancing by yourself might make you feel intimidated. We realize that it's more fun to go out as a group, especially if you are just a beginner or new in town, so we formed the Dancing4fun Meet-up group! We organize activities and inform you of dance events and dance classes around Gwinnett and Atlanta.</p>
<p>Even though most of our activities revolve around going out, dinner, &amp; dancing Swing, Latin, &amp; Ballroom, we also organize activities like white water rafting, karaoke, road trips to the beach, cruises, or simply hanging out as a group at the local sushi bar.</p>
<p>So, come on!! What are you waiting for? Single, married, dating, young, old, all shapes, and colors are all welcome!! It's a great way to just leave your troubles at the door and just have a great time, meet some fun and exciting people, and, most importantly, get ready to experience.....</p>
<p>See you on the dance floor! <br>Sean-Christopher <br> </p>

inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">MTB Atlanta - 30 Years of building trails!</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="MTB Atlanta - 30 Years of building trails!" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p><span>MTB Atlanta&nbsp;is a Member Based Non Profit that serves you and all Mountain Bikers in Metro Atlanta.</span><br></p>
<p>Your membership is vital to Mountain Bike Access, Trail Construction, and Trail Maintenance in Metro Atlanta.</p>
<p>Trail projects on public lands are driven by Volunteer work and Volunteer fundraising. Land managers simply do not have the budget to build and maintain the trails that you want to ride.</p>
<p>Your membership provides the basic budget for us to operate on your behalf.</p>
<p>Choose SORBA Atlanta as your Chapter at:</p>
<p><a href="https://www.imba.com/join/chapter/210548">https://www.imba.com/join</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;Join today!</p>
<br>
<p><br></p>
<p><b><a href="http://www.tourdelanta.com">TourDeLanta</a></b><span>&nbsp;is an active group of Mountain, Hybrid and off-road bicyclers who ride various urban single-track loops&nbsp;around&nbsp;Atlanta&nbsp;during the week and maintain and ride MTB Atlanta bike trails on the weekends.&nbsp;</span><br></p>
<p>The&nbsp;TourDeLanta&nbsp;weekday ride&nbsp;is part bike lane, part&nbsp;urban single-track loop around Atlanta. The riders skill level ranges from intermediate, to advanced.&nbsp;The group meets in front of Earl's Bike Shop&nbsp;and traverses&nbsp;miles of "Beltline trails", "The Path" trails, "urban single-track", off road, as well as bike lanes and sidewalks when necessary. This ride will take us through most of the big name parks and popular regions in Atlanta including Piedmont Park, West Midtown Betline, Virginia Highlands, Centennial park, Woodruff park, Krog Street Bridge, hidden Atlanta trails (Shhhhh!).&nbsp;We also host theme costume rides. FUN FUN!&nbsp;</p>
<p><b><span>Why Mt. bikes, hybrid and off-road bike tires?</span></b><br></p>
<p>These bicycles offer more terrain choices for any terrain we ride in in the city. We ride urban single-track, paved paths, sidewalks, open natural terrain, walls, jumps, drainage culverts&nbsp;etc. Mt Bikes also provide a more dynamic workout in a shorter distance. Our average ride burns close to 1000 calories. The ride ranges from high rep low resistance to low rep high resistance.</p>
<p><a href="http://www.strava.com/clubs/tourdelanta-urban-mtb-club-65044">Follow us on STRAVA!</a> <br></p>
<p><a href="https://www.facebook.com/TourDeLanta">Like us on Facebook!</a> <br></p>

max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta Multifamily Real Estate Investing - The Value Add" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div><div class="flex flex-col overflow-hidden w-full"><div class="flex pb-4 justify-between"><div><h3 class="pb-0.25 text-xl font-semibold w-full whitespace-normal overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-3 hdv6t0" data-testid="group-card-title">Atlanta Multifamily Real Estate Investing - The Value Add</h3><h3 class="pb-0.5 text-sm font-medium text-darkGold uppercase">Atlanta, GA</h3></div><div class="d2wac42 ml-4 relative block sm:hidden"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Atlanta Multifamily Real Estate Investing - The Value Add" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">**In this overheated real estate market, it is increasingly difficult to find great real estate deals, and it is really hard to find good contractors that will quote on your project and complete it with quality, on time and budget.**

**As a new multifamily investors/syndicators who has just purchased their first multifamily asset, you have budgeted money toward a significant value add project and cap-ex repairs. Although there is a general idea of what needs to be accomplished, there is a quick realization of the enormity of the task and the different skill set that is needed to complete this transformation successfully.**

***Multifamily Real Estate Investing - The Value Add Mastermind* will answer the following questions:**

* **How do you identify the renovation/value add items that will deliver the highest ROI?**
* **Where can you find “FREE” money to use toward increasing the value of your asset?**
* **Where do you find good contractors?**
* **How can you ensure that you receive quotes that can be compared accurately with one another?**
* **How can you receive quality work from a contractor?**
* **How can you ensure that the contractor will complete the project on time and budget?**


***Multifamily Real Estate Investing - The Value Add Mastermind* will look to empower you and show you how to become a "MAGNET" for good quality contractors who will want to work on your project, and ensure that all work is completed with quality, and on time and budget.**

**You won’t have to worry about having that difficult conversation with your investors regarding a blown budget and timeline of completion.**

**OR**

**A missed quarterly payout since there were unanticipated costs associated with that renovation/value add project.**

**OR**

**HEAVEN FORBID… You need to ask for more money from your investors because you don’t have enough to cover the renovation/value add project.**

**This Meetup group has been organized by *Van Sturgeon*, and he is a successful general contractor and real estate investor, who has been involved in thousands of renovation projects from single family homes, apartments, office, medical and many other commercial type buildings. He is the leading authority on multifamily renovations and value add projects, and has appeared on major news outlets like Yahoo News, Los Angeles Tribune and the Belmont Star.**

**In addition, Van has been a featured guest on Top Ranked multifamily podcasts with Bill Manassero, Rod Khleif, John Casmon, Joe Fairless, and Ken McElroy...and many others.**

**Van is semi-retired from the day to day operations and management of the 1200 doors that he owns across North America, and now spends his time helping multifamily real estate investors successfully plan and manage their renovation/value add projects and reach their investment goals.**

**If you are struggling as a new multifamily real estate investor with your newly acquired asset, then you are in the right place!**

***Multifamily Real Estate Investing - The Value Add Mastermind* will concentrate on the following :**

* **The 6 key steps every savvy multi-family real estate investor/syndicator must know to maximize profit and avoid costly mistakes.**&nbsp;
* **How to legally save yourself tens of thousands of dollars on renovation/value add projects… while also making the necessary upgrades to increase the value of your investment property.**
* **The brain-dead simple way to attract high-quality general contractors who will stick to your set timeline and budget… every single time.**
* **How this ‘Magic 8-Ball’ method reveals which renovation/vale add projects are going to give you the most Return On Investment (ROI) and avoid the ones that are just money-suckers.**
* **And more!**&nbsp;


**Have any questions for Van? Reach out at [info@vansturgeon.com](http://mailto:info@vansturgeon.com/)**

**Want a sneak peek of what we’ll be covering at our Meetup?**

**Watch this special Multifamily Renovation/Value Add episode Van recorded with Rod Khleif: [https://youtu.be/1wNPmFFf1KQ](https://youtu.be/1wNPmFFf1KQ)**&nbsp;

**Inside we cover topics like:**&nbsp;

* **Establishing Goals and Validating them in the marketplace**
* **How to approach a multifamily renovation/value add**
* **Developing a DETAILED Scope of Work**
* **Finding &amp; Screening Good Quality contractors**
* **How to quantify what "quality" means**
* **Clauses that should be included in Contract/Agreement**
* **Progress milestones and when to make payments**
* **Understanding the sequencing of contractors**
* **And More!**</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">28 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="ALE-Atlanta Linux Enthusiasts" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>The Atlanta Linux Enthusiasts (formerly GA 400 Linux Group) was been started to allow the casual to advanced Linux users to get together and share ideas, knowledge, and face-time with other Linux users. &nbsp;We're focused on helping beginning and returning Linux users learn the basics by establishing a solid foundation. &nbsp;We'll discuss distributions, file systems and storage, installation, databases, networking, and more!</p>
<p>Please visit the <a href="http://ale.org">ale.org</a> website and join the <a href="http://ale.org/?page_id=5">email lists</a> there based on your interests. <br>This website will be used primarily for event notices, discussion lists and calendaring.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Definitely sign up to the general ALE email list if you want to stay in the know about ALE. You may want to filter email. <br></p>
<p>If you want immediate help with an issue, both the email lists AND our IRC channel at <a href="https://webchat.freenode.net/">freenode #ale</a> are good places to ask for help.<br></p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">1546 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Queen Talk Healing Circle" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Queen Talk Healing Circle is a safe space for women to divinely transform and heal; physically, mentally, emotionally and spiritually.</p> 
<p>Queens, it is your birthright to be healed and whole, and no one can take that right from you, not even yourself.</p> 
<p>We are all connected through the center of our hearts, or in other words; spiritually connected. The power of women coming together to heal and to support others in the process is powerful and that in itself is healing.</p> 
<p>Every queen talk healing circle will look and feel differently every time, as it is divinely led; but the core of it will always remain the same which is to transform and heal women.</p> 
<p>Every month will be a different topic or we may continue the same topic for another month if we all agree there’s more work to do. Divinely led. Queen Talk Healing Circle will include but are not limited to Open Heart Prayer/Meditation (at the beginning of every Queen Talk Healing Circle), conversations, healing exercises, creative exercises, shared resources and ideas, tips and tools to take away, and last but not least SUPPORT embraced with love!</p> 
<p>Remember Queens, as we heal, generations before and after us are healing as well. Ultimately our healing, heals the world❤️</p> 
<p>*Note this is a monthly Circle, topics for Queen Talk Healing Circle will be shared 2 weeks before the Circle.</p> 
<p>Also, they will be hosted every 3rd Saturday (tentatively). Love you strong beautiful Queens!<br>Xoxo<br>Jemelia<br>“Lifting the veil in a world of illusions”🌹✨<br>Instagram: @queentalkwithjemelia</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">103 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="The Black Newcomers Network (BNN) and Live it Up!" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Meeting and networking on a social basis with fellow African Americans who have, at some point, relocated to the Atlanta metropolitan area. The Black Newcomers Network was founded in 1988. BNN is considered the premiere organization for networking among African Americans. For those who are not so new to the Atlanta area, we invite you as well to our monthly events and activities. We pride ourselves on being "A Family of Friends," and welcome everyone who would like to explore the city and experience new adventures throughout the year!!!</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Volunteer and Charity:</p>
<p>We are a charity Organization that helps needy families and the nursing homes.</p>
<p>Needy families:<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ieyyiiR5xFk&amp;t=5s">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ieyyiiR5xFk&amp;t=5s</a></p>
<p>Nursing homes: <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JM3hHqVbMYA&amp;t=39s">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JM3hHqVbMYA&amp;t=39s</a></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Rules:</p>
<p>We understand that not everyone can make it to a meetup event after they RSVP..IF YOU RSVP TO AN EVENT AND BECOME A NO-SHOW, WE WILL REMOvE YOU. Just be mindful and update your RSVP.</p>

If you identify as demisexual or sapiosexual, you may find yourself wondering where all the other people like you are when you want to meet someone new. Luckily, we’ve created this group to create social opportunities for all singles in your area who want to network and find deeper connections that matter to them. RSVPing HERE ON MEETUP WILL NOT SECURE YOU A SPOT.]</p><p><br></p><p>Revel is a new platform designed just for women in mid-life and beyond. Shut out, shut in, left behind...no more. Revel is building a nation-wide community to foster connection with others near and far who share our life experiences.</p><p><br></p><p>And, for a limited time, you can join Revel as a FREE-FOR-LIFE inaugural member!! Our platform is safe, secure, and respectful of your privacy. None of your info is ever shared outside of our own safely guarded membership.</p><p><br></p><p>To become a Revel member, just go to <a href="http://hellorevel.com/" target="_blank">helloRevel.com</a> and click ‘Join.’</p><p><br></p><p>When you sign up, you can choose to attend over 250 free monthly get-togethers.* Or, you can create your own gathering focused on any-and-everything that’s important to you — post a meetup at your local cafe, or create a weekly book club. Plus, you can search our member profile pages for members who live near you, or share your interests. </p><p><br></p><p>Hidden in your home, lost in dreary routines, or trapped in obligations that fail to bring joy? With children grown, and careers winding down, this is the time to revel in the rest of your life.</p><p><br></p><p>Revelers create a welcoming and supportive environment for all who identify as women in mid-life and beyond.</p><p><br></p><p>*If you live outside of our San Francisco, LA, DC, and NYC hubs, there may not currently be sufficient members to hold in-person events. That’s why we’re offering this limited free-for-life inaugural program. We hope to have a critical mass of members in all major cities within the next year.</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">261 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Meditation for Spiritual Awareness" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2"><p>Welcome to the Meditation for Spiritual Awareness meetup group! Jyoti Meditation is a practice of meditation on the inner Light taught by Sant Rajinder Singh Ji Maharaj. It is a simple meditation technique used to help participants invert their attention and connect with their inner source. Meditation has many practical benefits, helping to reduce stress-related illnesses, improve our concentration, and awaken us to our spiritual nature. In meditation, we withdraw our attention from the senses and world around us. This allows us to gradually release thoughts of the past and worries about the future so that we live in the present moment and connect with a source of divinity within. Please join us if you are interested in meditation and spirituality.</p></p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">544 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Hikers and Adventurers of Atlanta" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Hikers and Adventurers of Atlanta

Vision:
First and foremost, we are about adventure, discovery, exploration, and facing the unknown because that is what living is about - stepping outside that box and seeing what is possible.

Why Meetup?
Before I joined meetup, I hiked Kennesaw Mountain countless times alone and is still one of my favorite parks in Georgia with over 20 miles of walk-able trail. But I always saw these groups and wondered why I wasn't a part of one of them. How does that happen? I was recommended Meetup by a coworker, and I found a group that hiked Kennesaw Mountain every week. Shortly after, I became an organizer and have been for a little over 3 years. I joined other groups, learned of new places to hike, and suddenly discovered that there is much much more to see and experience in Georgia's natural landscape than Kennesaw Mountain or Stone Mountain.

Upcoming Activities and Events:
Hiking! of course, exploring new restaurants and eating spots, Theater and the Arts, Volunteer and Community events, Festivals, Casual Socials, Dancing, Singing, Games - cards, board games, pc gaming, Kayaking, Axe-throwing, skating - rollerblading/ice skating (eventually), Boating and whatever we can come-up with to live life and stay young at heart.

Members and Adventures:
These activities and events will be posted so that you can explore Atlanta and meet new people. While we all hope to have fun, it is important to remember that everyone is unique. You may find casual acquaintances, activity partners, networking opportunities or even enduring friendships. However, not everyone will get along and we ask that you be mindful of that, treat others with respect, and acknowledge boundaries when they are set.

Hi hope you will join us in this vision. Thank you for being there!
\- Aaron

DISCLAIMER
By RSVPing and attending our events, you waive all rights to make any legal claim against Meetup and this group's organizers. You are responsible for yourself and your own safety!

COVID: At all times, keep social distancing a priority for the safety of yourself and other hikers. (Be mindful of prolonged or unnecessary exposure to contact surfaces, including person to person). You may wear a mask, but it is not required. Participate at your own risk.

Attendance: As a growing group, enforcement of attendance policy will be lenient as we want you to stay. However, there are some courtesies that we ask of you out of respect for your organizers and your fellow Adventurers. 1. Communication - if you RSVP, plan to show on time. If at any time that changes, please update your RSVP accordingly. If you are to be late for any reason, please message or call the organizer to let them know (I will be setting up a number for myself specifically for this reason). 2. Tolerance - If everyone who RSVPs shows up on time, we will head out at the start time. If you are late and contact the group, we will wait no longer than 15 minutes. If you are late and do not contact the group, we will not wait. 3. Frequent No Shows - at this time there is no penalty for this but your RSVP sets expectations and assists the organizer in managing the event. If this becomes a problem for the organizer on a regular basis, then there may be action taken.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">392 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative; max-width: 100%;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; display: block; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; max-width: 100%;"><img alt="" aria-hidden="true" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27135%27%20height=%2775%27/%3e" style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0px; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"></span><img alt="Singles in the Suburbs (OTP North East Atlanta Metro)" data-testid="next-image" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" decoding="async" data-nimg="intrinsic" class="object-cover object-center rounded-md" style="position: absolute; inset: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: auto; display: block; width: 0px; height: 0px; min-width: 100%; max-width: 100%; min-height: 100%; max-height: 100%;"><noscript></noscript></span></div></div><p class="pma6wzk m-0 pb-1 text-sm text-gray6 overflow-ellipsis line-clamp-2">Tired of driving into Atlanta to meet other singles?  Rush hour traffic discouraging you from attending events?

This group is all about making friends and having a good time - minus the drive into Atlanta.

Whether you live or work in Gwinnett, now you can meet, mingle, and make connections locally, with local people.  Our goal here is to bring active singles together where they spend most of their time, in the North Gwinnett area (Lilburn, Lawrenceville, Duluth, Buford, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Cumming, Flowery Branch, Suwanee, Sugar Hill, Brookwood, etc.).

Come join the fun!

While everyone is welcome, group activities are oriented towards singles in the 25 to 45 age range.
Events are typically very laid back with little structure - kind of like hanging out in your own backyard with your friends.</p><div class="flex pt-6 text-sm text-gray6 w-full items-center justify-between"><div class="flex flex-row">3183 members · Public<button tabindex="0" aria-label="This group’s content, including its members and event details, are visible to the public." class="flex items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-white w-5 h-5 m-0"><span style="box-sizing: border-box; Abuse, CPTSD \u0026 Codependency Survivor Support","link":"https://www.meetup.com/kansas-city-narcissism-survivor-meetup-group","description":"Please consider joining our sister group at: https://www.meetup.com/pittsburgh-narcissism-survivor-meetup-group/\nfor more daily meetings, workshops and consistent support and validation.\n\nWe are a group for people who have suffered or are suffering from Narcissistic Abuse in a love or personal relationship. We will discuss and encourage sharing of our experiences, talk about trauma bonding and how to break the cycle. Most importantly, we will share our communal experience and provide support by listening and sharing our what we've gone through so that all attendees know that they are not alone.\n\nPlease read this message carefully: Before signing up to any meeting in this group, you MUST attend a First Timers Meeting event. There are NO exceptions to this. These meetings are designed to ensure community safety and if you sign up for an Established Member event without attending one, you will be removed from that event. Before you do anything else, including signing up for an Established Members group, check out our \"Events\" section and sign up for a First Timers Group and attend one BEFORE you sign up for an Established Member meeting. We are very strict about this rule, so please do so as we hate to remove people from meetings and have to send a PM advising someone of this rule.\n\nAll meetings are run through Zoom. The links and passwords are reset every day. The links are all sent the morning of the meetings. You will receive your link through whatever email you use through Meetup. Please ensure you have your settings with Meetup set to receive emails as they will come in through that email. If you sign up for a meeting, please check you have received your link well before the meeting as we do not check our emails during meetings. It is your responsibility to check that you have received your link - if you haven't received it and it's before meeting time, simply send your organizer (Kay R., Paige, Roby or Anthony) a PM and we will ensure you receive it.\n\nSome more general rules that will be reviewed in your First Timer's Meeting:\n\nDO NOT private message moderators/organizers unless you have a question regarding the group as a whole, or you didn't receive a link to the meeting. DO NOT message us for medical, legal, or general advice, and do not contact us to vent. We understand that times are tough and this is not an easy situation to deal with, but we are all running this group on a volunteer basis, and we do not have any medical or counseling degrees. If there is an emergency please call 911, contact your local police, hospital, or physician. There is also a domestic violence hotline (800.799.SAFE) and a suicide hotline (800-273-8255) - these are free 24 hour services. We appreciate your understanding in advance.\nDO NOT private message other members of the group. Again, this is an exception to the rule above, but if you see someone in a meeting you'd like to reach out to, please send the organizer of that meeting a message and we will ask that person if they consent to being contacted and will pass on your info to them. If a member tells you during a meeting to reach out to them, that is OK as they have consented already. This is for the safety of our members, which we take very seriously.\n\nWe are happy you are here and hope you find this a supportive community. All of the rules are above are to ensure that you are safe and that the people you will be interacting with are validating, here for the 'right reasons', and are properly vetted. We look forward to meeting you!\n\nx\n\nKay R.","city":"New EXPLORE A NEW FRONTIER WITH\u0026nbsp;\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt;DESI OUTDOORS\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u0026gt;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eFeatured on\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://www.themountainpath.net/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003ethemountainpath.net\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e http://www.themountainpath.net/\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e, Meetup's Facebook and Instagram channels\u0026nbsp;(\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003ehttps://www.facebook.com/meetup/photos/pb.8026914587.-2207520000../10157786678589588/ \u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eand \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003ehttps://www.instagram.com/p/B5JCWwVhfqF/\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003e)\u0026nbsp;on\u0026nbsp;Nov 21, 2019\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eDesi Outdoors\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;meetup group consists of and oriented towards Outdoors enthusiasts primarily from the Indian subcontinent, the land of Himalayas and numerous languages. We bring with us a culture of togetherness, sharing and love of nature. Group membership is kept selective and based on many factors that fit into core values of the group.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;Doeres \u003c/strong\u003econtinuously engage in various Outdoor activities for enriching, strengthening and balancing mind, body and spirit in \u003cstrong\u003eHarmony with Nature\u003c/strong\u003e. See \u003ca href=\"http://www.meetup.com/Desi-Outdoors-Enrichment-and-Recreational-Activities/pages/Meetup_memories/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ePast Events photos\u003c/a\u003e. Activities are low to moderate risk,moderate to strenuous difficulty, adventurous to challenging, with a mix of exploration, recreation, learning, fun, freedom and building a better Self \u0026amp; Society. Some activities involve kids and families.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;We are active year-around, enjoying all seasons and terrains of the North-East and around the world. Organizers expect new members to join for active participation in group meetups as per the mission above and not for increased meetup memberships, business or professional networking, socialization etc. \u003cstrong\u003eWe keep the group small to outdoors active members \u003c/strong\u003eand\u003cstrong\u003e\u0026nbsp;No Attendance \u003c/strong\u003ewithin 3 months of joining\u0026nbsp;or prolonged non-attendance removes you from the group. We can adequately prepare you for safe and warm winter outdoor activities during the season.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;Please read the\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"http://www.meetup.com/Desi-Outdoors-Enrichment-and-Recreational-Activities/pages/Disclaimer_of_No_Liability/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eDisclaimer\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;page.
